Reviews.Title: “Love this Location!”
Reviews.Author: Upstatefamily
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth straight year staying at the Excelsior as a large group - we usually have between 10-13 women in our party and get a couple of suites and a double room. We arrive early (around 10:00 a.m.) and are usually able to check into at least one of the suites - they are very accommodating. The rooms & suites are large (by NYC standards) although the bathrooms are on the small side. The 1 bedroom suites also have a pull out couch in the common area. We absolutely love the location - so close to Central park; the subway is right on the corner and we're within walking distance of Carmine's Restaurant on the Upper West Side (90th & Broadway) and Zabar's food & kitchen emporium on Broadway & 80th. It's a quiet area as opposed to the craziness of Times Square. Our group has stayed in other sections of NYC but have returned to the Excesior and will continue...

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: PBJlover
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights at the Excelsior with my 21-year-old daughter. It served us for exactly what we needed. We're only at the hotel to sleep and shower. We had a room on the third floor with two twin beds. It was extremely clean and very comfortable beds. The furnace did "clink" when it came on, but that wasn't often and it didn't keep us awake. We liked getting away from the noise of Times Square and downtown. Our room looked out to the back side of the Museum of Natural History and a park--very pretty. You're surrounded by a neighborhood and very close to the subway. Great value and we'll definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in the Upper West Side”
Reviews.Author: gchong8
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived mid-morning hopeful of a place to leave our bags. Lucky for us, the front desk person said that we could check in right away and would upgrade us to a suite. Great start to the weekend. The suite was spacious, renovated and quiet and made for a nice retreat from the hustle and bustle. Housekeeping was efficient and accommodating. Doorman would answer queries but made you feel you were bothering him (he wasn't busy as he was leaning against a wall). I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking in this part of NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel for exploring upper Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: TexasTraveller56
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel every time we go to NYC for a family vacation for 4 reasons: 1) location It is right across the street from the Museum of Natural History and Central Park. The Met and museum mile are a 5 minute taxi ride. 2) quiet The hotel is a little off the beaten path and in-between apartment buildings so it is very quiet versus other touristy areas. 3) awesome local food Right around the corner from the hotel are several blocks of teriffic places to eat - including Canteen 82 for great Asian food. 4) good price Since the hotel is off the beaten path, the price is hundreds less than touristy areas. For a 2 room suite with two full beds we paid $180. You may pay $10 more for a taxi to get to midtown, but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and reasonable hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: EKJ897
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spend a night at the Excelsior Hotel on the Upper West Side. It was a pleasant experience. Yes, our room was small, but it was very comfortable and had a pretty bathroom. Best of all, the hotel is on a quiet street, across from the Museum of Natural History. For New York, it was reasonably priced and well worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: mosolygo
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that I came to stay here as a 'freeby' â€“ given away with an airline promotion. Knowing nothing about the place, I was extremely surprised and pleased that it was situated next to the Natural History Museum, and almost overlooking Central Park. It is an older style hotel nicely renovated, but no frills. My room did not come anywhere near the typical American size â€“ just a Queen bed, small but adequate bathroom, work space and wardrobe. Only complaint that the A/C is very antiquated; either full on or off, even after two complaints. However, the fact that one can walk to half dozen museums, and chose between two subway and three bus lines to get around compensates for that. A relatively nice midtown area, several reasonably priced good quality small restaurants and coffee bars nearby complete the picture.

Reviews.Title: “Hot, hot, hotel and restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: wrldgrl22
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior Hotel is a gem and retains that feel of "old" New York - not the 70s creepy way, but the class of the 40s and 50s way. We were greeted by the staff and told that parking at the AMNH was $27 per day - what a steal in NY! We then headed up to our room - and yes, the hallway and the rooms are on the warm side - and if you're a middle aged woman you know what I mean! But, with the window left open a crack or the cool air on, you adapt! The room and the hotel are clean and no bed bugs -- a big plus in NYC! We had a glorious view of the planetarium of AMNH and the Park, which are added bonuses in the city! The Calle Noche restaurant is, according to my daughter, an added bonus, but unfortunately never got to try it. Grab a Starbucks around the corner and take morning walks in the Park! We'll be back! Did I say it was CLEAN? Glorious!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, NYC”
Reviews.Author: fuddsi
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel, excellent location for central park, natural history museum. midtown was within walking distance (1 mile). Gave a more natural impression of NY being near to residential district, saw SJP out for a stroll one evening! Only faults were a chip in the enamel of the bath, hairline crack in sink, dusty ipod docking station. Thats being picky, 2 double beds in room, excellent furnishings and decor, friendly staff, shower was excellent! Can't wait to go there again.

Reviews.Title: “VERY BAD EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: Valeria N
Reviews.Content: The problem with this hotel is that the staff was very rude to us just because we were a group of students. The hotel was over booked and they didn't give us a room to stay for the night, even though we had already paid. Instead they called a partner hotel and made us cross the entire city looking for this other hotel that looked cheaper than the Excelsior. I think that the staff should be more aware of giving a proper consumer service.

Reviews.Title: “I would go stay there again”
Reviews.Author: OziExplorer
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to Central Park and shopping. Safe area. I loved the location. Perfectly working wireless. Good quality sleep. Clean room. Comfort. No problems.

Reviews.Title: “short stay briiliant.”
Reviews.Author: overworked63
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel on a 4 night visit to n y city,location was brilliant ,neighberhood wonderfull,out the way of all the main city noise,next to central park and the museum if your intrested,the hotel and rooms are excactly as you see on the web sight photos, very nice staff and spotlessly clean.we had a room on the tenth floor to the back of the building which was great no problems and smashing views towards the north,will stay again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and affordable”
Reviews.Author: BuffaloGal017
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel a few times now. It has a great location- right next to the park and science museum and there's many restaurants/shops nearby. There is also a subway stop right at the corner. The neighborhood is great but it is still easy to access other parts of the city. I have always had a suite which has been great, but since it's an older hotel I imagine the regular rooms to be on the smaller side. However, the charm is what I love about it! I'm not a Marriott/Hilton kind of person I enjoy staying in local hotels whenever I travel. They recently added a bar and restaurant as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: stephen k
Reviews.Content: We have stayed twice at this hotel once for a week and then 9 days. The staff go out of their way to please and accomadate customer requirements,we have always been well treated by all members of staff from reception,front and back of house,maids and valet staff. Always considerate in finding a room to suit the family ie parents with a teenager can be difficult in many hotels, here we stay in comfortable rooms with good installations and views, Location is great for walking or metro is only yards away. Intend to vist again hopefully in the near future. Kedalls from Malaga Spain

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: J0anne67
Reviews.Content: Just spent a weekend at the Excelsior. We had their cheapest room (two twin beds, smallish, overlooking the park). NIcely appointed and located, and would have been fine except that the windows are single-pane so traffic and sirens etc very audible even on the 9th floor. And the heating system is antiquated so it sometimes blew cold air for a long time before overheating the place. Avoid the breakfast buffet -- $17 for weak coffee and unimaginative and generally greasy standard breakfast bacon, tater tots, scrambled eggs.

Reviews.Title: “Could be great but still fine”
Reviews.Author: stevens397
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable, nice suite at a good price. Good location for what we were doing. Downsides were: [1] found a AAA rate lower than our reserved rate and they told me they can't change it - that I had to cancel and rebook. Crazy. [2] Parking - you ca park across the street but I'm used to handing the keys to the valet and being done with it. Not as convenient but not awful. [3] staff is okay but not a hint of warmth. Shame for a boutique hotel and finally [4] no NY Times???!!! Really, this place just needs to be tweaked to be wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Good, and getting better”
Reviews.Author: mayansun
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel, if it is available, every time we go to NYC, twice a year. The hotel has always been good! Although in the past, the desk staff had not been as courteous as one would like. Not rude, mind you, but a little hard. Don't know what has caused the change, but this time, they were much more cordial and accommodating and tried to help as much as possible. Kudos. An added bonus is that a very nice restaurant, Calle Ocho, which was previously on Columbus around the corner has moved to a space on the lobby floor of the hotel. The restaurant is a Latin fusion place well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good Upper West Side Location”
Reviews.Author: CBRich117
Reviews.Content: If your visit to NYC calls for any time to be spent on the upper West Side, consider the Excelsior Hotel on W. 81st Street just off Central Park West. It is a small hotel, tastefully decorated and features an attentive staff. Local transportation is nearby while the Museum of Natural History and Haydn Planetarium are just across the street. Local restaurants cater to any culinary whim while other shops transform a walk into a delightful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in upper west side”
Reviews.Author: TheRealDesertFox
Reviews.Content: Had a nice suite at a great price for three nights over Christmas. The garage is self park, and right across the street. The people are helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: momtravelor39
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, room is very clean. The only downfall was the distance from times square. But if youre looking for something quieter, this is your place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location on the Upper West Side”
Reviews.Author: WineDarkC
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior is a solid Upper West Side hotel with a fantastic location. The staff is very professional. However the rooms, for the price, are a bit hit or miss. They are well appointed, and while some are well sized, the one we stayed at this time was very small, and located at the end of the elevator lobby. The room was also like a sauna, and when we turned on the A/C to cool things down, more heat came out of the HVAC unit. We ended up sleeping with the window open all night, and it was still uncomfortably hot.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Lasuvera
Reviews.Content: I received a complimentary upgrade to a larger suite and it was lovely. Great location for walking to museums, reasonably priced for that location, and helpful staff. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good deal”
Reviews.Author: Olistina
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. The location is excellent! A minute walk to Central Park and the 81st street station (A, B, C). The 79th street station (1, 2) is also close. Plenty of nice restaurants within easy walking distance. The neighborhood feel of this hotel and the surrounding area is a nice break from the more touristy parts of the city. We stayed in the Excelsior Deluxe room (upgrade) which was huge, comfy, and quiet. The price was reasonable for NYC and the museum view is really pretty. It would be nice if they included free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location, great stay”
Reviews.Author: Bigfit0129
Reviews.Content: I read other reviews complaining about the front desk staff. I don't know what they did to those people, but I have nothing but excellent things to say about them. They were helpful in every way and went the extra mile. Room - we stayed on the 8th floor facing the museum of natural history. The windows did nothing to block the noise from street. I'd recommend an even higher floor. Other than that, room was sufficient. Overall, no major complaints, convenient location, great staff, good room.

Reviews.Title: “First NYC trip.....Great Hotel on the Upper West Side”
Reviews.Author: Jmalone1947
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Excelsior in Sept. 2011 and we throughly enjoyed our stay at this first class hotel! I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a quiet location away from Midtown or Downtown New York City. The hotel is done in rich wood decor and has very comfortable guest rooms with a nice resturant downstairs and a Great Breakfast Buffet on the second floor every mornind between 7-11am. Excellent food and supured sevice at this location. Very friendly staff for NYC!!!

Reviews.Title: “good value, quiet, well located”
Reviews.Author: malcolm504
Reviews.Content: While not one of the grand dames of the city, the Excelsior never the less delivers big when it comes to the proverbial "bang for our buck". Located on 81st and central park west, it is a stone's throw from not only central park but also the museum of natural history, which is a definite crowd pleaser, and the 81st street subway with access to the B and C trains. Quiet hotel with charming decor and friendly staff. what more could you want?! Also a superb restaurant, "calle ocho" in the lobby. I strongly suggest this lovely establishment!

Reviews.Title: “Super location, great restaurant, service and attitude need improvement”
Reviews.Author: jwwcpa
Reviews.Content: Excelsior is a great location near museums, Central Park, Lincoln Center, Broadway. We took a wonderful 15 minute walk through Central Park to the Metropolitan Museum of Art. Also, visited the Museum of Natural History literally across the street adjoining the Hayden Planetarium. The adjoining restaurant, Calle Ocho is fabulous! Excellent food, near perfect Mojitos and friendly caring staff. In fact, my recommendation to the Excelsior Hotel is to hire some of the folks at Calle Ocho, which is independently owned, as front desk people. The Excelsior front desk folks need an attitude adjustment, they all seem bored and uncaring. Don't let this service weakness keep you from the Excelsior. There are so many good things that outweigh the front desk attitude problem including such important items as a free upgrade to a mini suite, free shoe shine service, your morning coffee and oatmeal at Starbuck's less than a minute away, beautiful European style lobby. This review would easily have been five stars but for the front desk service and attitude problem.

Reviews.Title: “The Go-To Hotel for Upper West Side”
Reviews.Author: Sugar_Bowl_Chick
Reviews.Content: Great rates, clean and spacious room and bath, super quiet, fabulous location, comfortable bed, great gym. I will definitely return on my next trip to NYC. I live in the country and am used to sleeping in total quiet. I slept like a log in this place! Plus, they allowed me a very early check-in following a red-eye flight from the west coast. They made it so easy and I really appreciated that. And the food at the Latin restaurant downstairs was amazing. You must try the Dulce corn cake over tomatoes appetizer. Wow. My search for a great NYC hotel on the Upper West Side is over.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: felicityma
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on my first trip to New York and was very impressed. Hotel was clean and comfortable. It's in a great location, very close to a subway station and convenient for city sites. There were plenty of places within walking distance to eat at. Staff I encountered were very friendly and helpful. All in all, hotel enhanced a great trip to Yew York.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value, will certainly return”
Reviews.Author: Bill D
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Excelsior this week for the first time, but will absolutely plan on returning. I'm tempted to give it a five-star rating based on how much I liked it and how great of a value it is, but want to reserve the five-star designation for "over-the-top fabulous" while this was more "very good value and comfort". I was in a suite, which had two double beds in one room with a nice sitting area & desk in the other. The fixtures in the bathroom were a bit old (surprise - it's not a new hotel) but worked perfectly fine and the bathroom (for that matter the entire room) was perfectly clean. I was very happy with the experience and will certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: diane2484
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior was one of the best hotels my family has stayed in NYC. It is a perfect location to go to the Natural History Museum. We stayed here for the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade. It was quite a surprise to us that the huge balloons are inflated right outside the hotel. Management ad staff were GREAT! Very responsive to our needs. Resaurant and bar was also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Excelsior Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: dilanste
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near the Museum of Natural history (81 st) and from my room I saw its park. Metro stop is on the corner with Central Park west (2-3 minutes from the hotel by walking). The area and the atmosphere is calm. You can go down to the street and stay on the parkes bench in the front of the hotel with your coffee looking people or speaking with your family. Room was clean and big, but wireless was not free in it. To use wireless you have to go in the lobby or outside on the parke bench. The hotel is not cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Not enough room at the Inn ....”
Reviews.Author: rosie358
Reviews.Content: Three middle aged (elderly?) ladies stayed here for five nights to celebrate the 60th Birthday of one of our party. We had booked through a Travel Agent for a three-bed room and were upgraded to a very nice Junior suite but with only 2 beds. When we queried the fact that the beds were too small to share unless the occupants were a 'couple' we were dismissively informed that they were both double beds and that the room was for four people. The receptionist ignored my observation that there were only 2 robes and 2 drinking glasses. The Birthday Girl slept on the sofa in the little sitting room and said it was quite comfortable, she didn't want to make a fuss as it was her celebration and we had travelled from Ireland for the occasion. We enjoyed our stay but this put a damper on it, especially as were paying over $1300 for the privilege.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: makem pete
Reviews.Content: this hotel is right on central park and about 20 mins walk from times square the position is great for the new york marathon as its right on the finish line the rooms are quite small with nowhere to put cases but by new york standards i believe they are good size .. also nice and clean the buffet breakfast is good value lots to eat and nice and fresh

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: thegormandizer
Reviews.Content: This is a real find. Unavoidable business had us coming right after the NYC marathon, and rooms were hard to come by. We ended up here but were really pleased the way it worked out. To begin with, the front desk staff was pleasant and professional; even though it was evident they were extremely busy. We always come early due to work and travel connections, and they were very nice making sure that all of our paperwork was correct and getting our bags stored in a very quick and efficient manner. Upon returning after work, our rooms were ready, and what lovely rooms they were. This is an older hotel that has been refurbished, yet it still maintains its uniqueness. The rooms, the halls, the elevators and all other areas were immaculate. Again, the staff could not have been any nicer. While I was waiting at the desk to ask a question, I overheard the couple in front of me with a unique problem. The desk staff handled them courteously, and solved their problem, never making them feel that they were being rushed or their problem wasnâ€™t important. I was extremely pleased with everything. Also, although we only sat in the hotelâ€™s bar/restaurant for drinks, it was a lively place, and the staff was wonderful. The food looked and smelled terrific, even though we didnâ€™t eat there. It must be a good place, as I understand that you need to make week-end brunch reservations weeks in advance. The location, across from the Museum of Natural History, is prime. You can go anywhere in Manhattan in a short time, and there are restaurants of every kind within a short walk. All in all, this is a hotel to which I will gladly return.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent”
Reviews.Author: Kenneth B
Reviews.Content: The Excesior is in a great location, and is a beatufull old building. regardless of previous bad reviews about the staff I found every member of the staff I came in contact with were extremely polite helpful and freindly.The rooms were spotlessly clean if a bit on the small size. The only downside was breakfast I thought it was abit overpriced for what was on offer. Ken & Rosalie Australia

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing coming from a meeting planner”
Reviews.Author: CERPSR
Reviews.Content: As an executive of a corporate meetings department, I was very disappointed in this hotel. From the cold welcome at the Front Desk, to the fact that my AT&T service did not work well at all in my room to the cold response when asked for late checkout, I would not go back nor recommend this hotel to anyone. Service is very important to me and while the location of the hotel is ideal, the poor experience outweighed the location. When I called down to ask for late checkout, the response was curt, "not possible" was all he said. When I mentioned at checkout and over the phone that I was having service issues, there was no understanding rather it completly put on me that it must be my service because no one else experiences these issues, (while another person I was with experienced the exact same issues). I could not call out on my phone, calls could not come in, some texts did not go through, could not connect to network, etc. Perhaps it was the room I was in and it was fluke but I expereinced it. Then, the greeting at check in was cold. I truly felt like I was doing THEM a favor by staying in their hotel. Perhaps this is typical of NYC but I have stayed at other local hotels and not experienced such curtness. I have opportunities to bring corporate executives and groups to this hotel but I would not book them at this hotel. This is the first time I have ever written a review, that's how strongly I felt about the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: pegitas
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior is fabulously located across from the Natural History Museum, a few feet from Central Park and a subway stop. Although it lives on the tony Upper West side, the rates during low seasons are surprisingly reasonable for New York. The lobby is elegant and bustling. The doorman was always pleasant and helpful. My room was very average (smallish) but I would definitely return here for the value and location.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: B B
Reviews.Content: Unpleasant first shower - dub did not drain well. Called maintenance. They came and worked on it but left a disgusting mess in the tub and on the floor. Housekeeping cleaned it up but not very well. I was not trilled about having to take another shower in there given how dirty the tub had been after the repairs. Room keys stopped working for no reason (they were not near my credit cards). Front desk staff referred me to a pay computer when I asked to print my boarding pass (Female with long black hair). I returned later and asked a man working at the desk (first name started with a B) and he graciously agreed to print the boarding pass for me. Staff was hit or miss.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: sue b
Reviews.Content: After experiencing hotels of the same status across America this was very disappointing. small room, no coffee making facilities, Wifi was not free (standard in most other hotels) and reception staff very unfriendly. The toilet kept blocking, the bar is franchised and closed at 11pm also couldn't take drinks out of the crowded bar into the more comfortable hotel lobby. To top it all every member of our group was presented with a bill at the end of our stay even though we had already paid for our accommodation involving further complaints with an unfriendly receptionist. Will never stay here again - looks fine but service is dreadful for the money paid. .

Reviews.Title: “Just a bit more effort and this would be a "VERY GOOD" rating...”
Reviews.Author: GeoWashington
Reviews.Content: I was placed in this hotel by my client. It was exceptionally well-located with regard to my business venue... and I dare say well-located in general. The Upper West Side is still close enough to all of the greatness New York offers... but quieter and more civil. Being so close to Central Park the neighborhood also feels more European and less frenetic. Some wonderful museums and restaurants are a short walk from the hotel. The doorman was friendly and helpful. Evening check-in was efficient but NOT welcoming or friendly. It seemed as if my associate and I had interrupted a conversation between the two receptionists. Neither the man nor woman welcomed us. There was no other guest at reception. I greeted them both and asked with a smile, "Where does the line start?" Now admittedly, my humor is not appreciated by everyone, but they both just stared at me... they said nothing. No smile. No greeting. Finally just "What is your name Sir?" The friendly doorman delivered my bag quickly and offered to place it (it's heavy and large) wherever I wanted it. The room was surprisingly spacious for NYC. Some of the furniture (not all) was beginning to look a little tired but all in all it was an inviting decor. The room and bathroom were spotless... except there were candy bar wrappers and other unidentifiable things on the floor between the nightstand and wall (I was looking for an outlet to charge my phone). I just wrote spotless... and 99% of it was... but there was a piece of onion (yes, onion) and some crumbs on the nightstand table top itself. The very cool and sophisticated radio/iPod-dock/nature-sound/clock had the correct time but was not illuminated and could not be seen during the day without staring into the front of the display and reading the black-on-black digital display. It could not be seen at night at all. Neither the radio nor nature-sounds worked. The bathroom was small but fine and the tiles, tub and sink were gleaming. Everything worked in that department. Two double beds, each with mattresses far too soft for my taste, led to a sore back each morning (my associate had the same comment). I would have liked a couple feather pillows from the many pillows provided, but alas, all foam. I didn't sleep well either night... (ditto my associate in his room). There was an empty cigarette pack and some scraps of paper on the floor outside my associateâ€™s room for the entire first day of our two-night stay. He picked it up and moved it to a telephone table outside the elevator. It stayed there, uncollected for the remainder of our visit. We had drinks at the attached restaurant. Excellent. Warm and friendly service. We didn't eat there but it was very inviting. Super decor and very alive. Not noisy. Looked great... as was the menu which we peeked at. The two elevators are slow. Morning checkout staff was friendly and efficient. This property is really close, in my opinion, to being a VERY GOOD rating. Management needs to remind some of the employees what their mission is (to wit: hospitality)... and urge their housekeeping staff to be more vigilant.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful NYC stay”
Reviews.Author: Carol S
Reviews.Content: Old World feel, staff was excellent, room comfy, close to Central Park, a great Starbucks right around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed Aussie”
Reviews.Author: Kate D
Reviews.Content: We searched the internet for a great rate, and with some degree of trepidation booked an affordable stay at the Excelsior. After 20+ hours flying to New York from Australia we were desperate to shower. Although we arrived 7 hours prior to check-in time thinking we would only be able to change our clothes in the common areas of the hotel, the staff at the Excelsior were more than happy to assist us with an early check-in. They also upgraded our room. After hearing horror stories about the cleanliness of hotels in America, we were very impressed with the quality of our room. The fittings were well maintained, the linen fresh and comfortable, and the room comfortably appointed. It felt warm and inviting, and whilst it wasn't the most luxurious hotel I've ever stayed in, it was a great room (particularly for what we paid!). Throughout our stay the staff were lovely, giving us advice on where to visit in the local area. The hotel is well positioned, close to transport, and the local neighbourhood gave us a real taste of New York life - complete with friendly locals. Overall I would have NO HESITATION in recommending this hotel, and would not consider staying anywhere else when I return to the Big Apple.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Shazbo92
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights with my friends in October. We booked a triple room with 3 single beds but on arrival were given 2 doubles so I had to share with my friend. Room was very small especially for 3 adults sharing. Found the staff throughout our stay VERY UNHELPFUL!!!! The only good thing about hotel is location. A few minutes walk from central park & the subway. Lots of restaurants & a supermarket nearby. Plan on going back to New York but wouldn't stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: lilacroller
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior Hotel in Upper West side of Manhattan has one superb qualification: it's location! On W 81st street, it is a few buildings from Central Park, across the street from the Museum of Natural History, right near subway entrance, and near some shops and restaurants I enjoy: e.g. Schweitzer's Linens. Otherwise, it is pleasant, well appointed, with comfortable beds. The rooms are small but the furnishings are good quality. I had an uncertain, unconfirmed encounter with a bed bug, as I woke up with a few bites on my neck. They could have arisen from a walk through central park the previous day or from a close encounter with a bed bug while asleep. Unless confirmed by another stay, I cannot attribute the welts to the hotel. The staff at the front desk needs some additional training in welcoming guests, but all in all, a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic-Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Christy H
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. It was perfectly located by Central Park and the Museum of Natural History. Also the neighborhood that the hotel was located in was wonderful too. Also, I just loved the hotel itself. We stayed in a suite and I would highly recommend it. Luxurious and spacious but a great value! We will definitely stay there again during our next trip to New York. Coffee shops across the street and small deli for convenience shopping. You can't go wrong at the Excelsior!

Reviews.Title: “Well placed hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nexus489
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights prior to a QM2 crossing. We enjoyed our stay, though we only used the room, not the bar or restaurant, but these seemed popular. Our room was clean and well presented, with two flat screen TV's! The staff were helpful, though the car booked by the hotel did not appear and a taxi was hastily summoned. My only, minor, criticism is we only saw two small lifts servicing 16 floors and quite often had to wait several minutes during peak times. The hotel is well located in a pleasant area of town with several good restaurants nearby, particularly on Broadway. Access downtown is simple. If you're of reasonable fitness it's a pleasant stroll through Columbus and Times Square. There is a subway station close by outside the Natural History Museum, with access directly onto 81st Street.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: frugalyankee
Reviews.Content: Great location near Central Park, Natural History Museum and subway. MUCH quieter than most mid-town hotels. Very clean. Prices vary widely - can be reasonable, can be expenisve. Very consistent and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with very pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: Katrina W
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently stayed here on a four nighter from the UK. We were unsure what to expect which left us open to disappointment as well as pleasant surprises. Thankfully, disappointments were few; we felt that the lack of tea/coffee making facilities was noticable every day and when we asked about access to facilities we were told that the hotel bar would make tea/coffee for us to take to our room. This was a reasonable compromise but the bar looked closed when we arrived back from a days wandering. Our room was immaculate, the bathroom generous and the bed was really comfy. We'd hoped to be able to see the street from our window but we were placed at the back. This was one of the pleasant surprises as it meant were were in a quieter part of the hotel. Location was great; moments from Central Park, lots of places nearby to eat at and the American Museum of Natural History over the road! (Great museum btw!!)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price, my review may answer some questions.”
Reviews.Author: Ravekid
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights. All I can say is that for the price, it is well worth it. The room we had was small, but we were upgraded to a south facing room which provided for some awesome photos. I would like to answer some questions that others might have. For starters, there is a reserved drop-off/pick-up parking area in front of the hotel. You will likely have no problem when you arrive as to where to park while checking in. Now for parking, parking for me was around $70 and I parked Sunday night and left Wed. morning. The museum lot is only open from 8AM till 10 or 11PM. They shut the gate over-night, so if you are leaving in the middle of the night, don't park here!! There is also some parking on the street, but for about three or four hours on Monday and Thursdays, there is no parking...I think this is when streets are cleaned, but I don't know. I was able to save a day of parking charges thanks to the bellhop pointing out someone leaving..he saved me around $30, so I gave him $10 extra. Make sure you take your ticket to the front desk as they have the validation stickers there. Some may have questions about the subway system. There is a train stop right on the block, and despite the "train sometimes skips this station" notation in the NYC transit info, the C train never skipped this station from I would say 8AM to 8PM. So at a minimum, you can catch the C train during the morning and afternoon hours. In addition, there a station where you can catch the 1 train at 79th street just two blocks or so SW. You can take the 1 train one stop south (downtown) to the 71st street station and catch a #2 express if you wish. There is what I believe a 3rd party tourist info desk in the front lobby. During day hours, a person is there and they can sell you show tickets and such (from what I read). What is really great is the small display. They have a great map of Manhattan and the subway system. Overall, I was pleased with our stay. A/C worked great, instant hot water for showers. The staff were all friendly. A huge plus was that I decided to leave a day early. There was no charge for an early exit and I waited for them to bill my CC before posting to make sure they didn't charge me for that day. The only downside is their breakfast is costly. There is a McDonalds and other places to eat a much more reasonable rate in the area. If I ever return to NYC, I will likely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Lollydod
Reviews.Content: We discovered the Excelsior via Travelocity and expected "discount" quality accommodations. We couldn't have been more surprised when we were shown our mini-suite, complete with all imaginable amenities. The staff were also extremely friendly and helpful. The location is ideal, with the front of the hotel facing the "dog park" alongside the American Museum of Natural History, and Central Park less than a block away. We plan to make the Excelsior our place to stay every time we visit NYC.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel on the Upper West Side”
Reviews.Author: blueskiesOttawa
Reviews.Content: We have travelled extensively in Europe and Asia, but chose NYC ( a first time visit) to celebrate a milestone birthday. We were delighted with the Excelsior, for its marvellous old world charm, fantastic location and excellent guest relations. I must complement Omayra (front desk), with whom I spoke prior to our arrival regarding room choice. As we checked in, she immediately recalled the booking and extended birthday wishes. What a lovely personal touch!! We were most impressed not only with the attractive lobby, but also our warm reception..... it set the tone for a fabulous stay. Neighbourhood restaurants, Good Enough to Eat and the Amersterdam Diner were wonderful and several great museums are within easy walking distance. We will definitely return to the Excelsior.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in a quiet location”
Reviews.Author: dani162
Reviews.Content: Considering the cost to stay here is $300 AU per night, I would have expected more, but this is NYC! The hotel is close to a train station - it will take you around 20 mins to get to Times Square on the train. The best thing about this hotel is its closeness to central park (only a few streets away) which is great for an early morning run. It is also opposite the museum of Natural History which is a must see - dinosaur replicas and pictures from the moon! About a 20 min walk to the Guggenheim museum which is overrated. The rooms are an older style but clean and contain the essentials. Restaurants in this area are not great. You need to head down to Columbus Ave to great some decent food. Mostly fast food around 89th street and not many nice bars or places to go out. In summary, shop around for a better deal if you want to stay in a quiet location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Julie P
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were at the Excelsior for a week. We had booked a twin room but were given a double. On calling reception we were moved to a larger twin bedded room with a better view immediately. The bedroon was very nice and each room had a safe which was very useful for keeping passports etc locked away. The decor was lovely (just my style) and the staff were very helpful at all times. The plumbing was not great and could have done with updating, but bathrooms were a reasonable size and very clean. The location of the Excelsior was very good. Close to bus routes and not too far away from the main attractions. On Amsterdam (one avenue across) try 'Good Enough to Eat' a lovely always busy place to have breakfast, somewhere I would recommend highly. The whole 'New York' experience was fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: scott h
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms with a great shower and good HVAC.Elevators are on their own plan.Restaurant/Bar in the lobby is a local hotspot that is well isolated from the Hotel.Location,location,location ! Surounded by great restaurants.Work on the front desk attitude ( came through before I even said hello) and you got a 5 star property.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel in a great location ~ try it!”
Reviews.Author: Marion T
Reviews.Content: What a wonder experience staying at the Excelsior was. Decor is fabulous, rooms are beautifully appointed staff so obliging, and the location is wonderful. A true New York experience of the best kind

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Nice old style decor. Some areas for improvement.”
Reviews.Author: Diego_W
Reviews.Content: Location is unbeatable at this hotel plus the lobby decor shows how old, good, hotels in NYC must have looked like years ago. Bedrooms are well mantained and though ours faced an alley and not the museum I cannot complaint comparing it with the size and amenities of those of other comparable hotels in Manhattan. Bathrooms, on the other hand, while thoroughly clean, are in need of some renovation. Not luxurious in any way. Staff service is hit-and-miss but on the down side I can mention that one of the front-desk staff (a woman) must have never looked up from the computer in all our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: CardFan55000
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior's location and outstanding facility were the best reasons we enjoyed our trip to NYC. It was a short walk through Central Park to get to the Metropolitan Museum of Art, it was across the street from the Museum of Science and Natural History, it was a short walk to Big Nick's Diner, one of the best diners in NYC, and it was only about a $10.00 cab ride to the port our cruise ship departed. Finally, the facility was beautiful and the staff was outstanding. For anyone visiting NYC, or for anyone taking a cruise out of the port at 12th at 55th, I strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excelsior Hotel”
Reviews.Author: antony t
Reviews.Content: Nice clean room.Location excellent,close to subway,good breakfast,no tea or coffee making facilities in the room

Reviews.Title: “If Excelsior Means Ever Higher, This Place is Ever Lower”
Reviews.Author: serioustraveler7612
Reviews.Content: Oh, where to begin? My wife made a four night reservation at this "luxury" hotel, a stay that would keep her close to business meetings uptown. We reserved a particular room category but called later to upgrade. Mistake. When we arrived at the hotel, the receptionist, who, to us, could have been nominated for most surly hotel employee in NYC, told us that the room we had reserved was not upgradable - but we could re-book for an additional $100/night. She seemed to refuse to think we were truthful, noting that a hotel representative would never have told us what we were reporting. Figuring that we were misunderstood (rather than mendacious, a possibility she apparently could not conceive), we ignored the left handed way she appeared to tell us we were lying. A luxury hotel? Things seemed to be on the mend when she offered us a park view. As we were near the magnificence of Central Park, we immediately latched on to that four-day pleasantry. When we got to the room, many of the windows overlooked an airshaft, but some did face the Museum of Natural History. Nice enough, but not the Central Park view we had anticipated - and were seemingly promised for our not insignificant increase in rate. I called Ms. Guest-Friendly and noted the difference. She advised me to look out the window at the grass in front of the museum. "We call that a park." Well, we don't, but oh, well. We had written to the hotel in advance requesting down pillows. (It's a luxury place, right?) Mistake. At bedtime, we called to note that our request had not been fulfilled. You guessed it. "We don't have those." At one point, we asked for a turndown. Mistake. "We don't offer that." Not at this luxury hotel. The bell staff was a comparative pleasure to work with, but the other professionals with whom we had contact seemed to have been cast by Alfred Hitchcock's Academy of Guest Relations. Note the reviews below that report similarly. We must congratulate the hotel manager who did decide to refund one night of surcharges because of our consistent unhappiness. Having prepaid the reservation, we couldn't leave and go elsewhere, but you can bet that the additional night we required in NYC was spent at one of our favorite hotels - a new 11th Avenue bastion of total elegance and four star service, a description that this hotel will not likely achieve, at least not from us. If we have future meetings in the same neighborhood, we'll be taking cabs from midtown.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: LoveNYCandABQ
Reviews.Content: 4-night stay in a double/double room with a south view of the Museum of Natural History and its beautiful Theodore Roosevelt Park. Room was spacious by NY standards, clean, well-appointed. Only drawback was lack of in-room coffee service, however there were two coffee shops nearby (World Coffee and Starbucks). Location is fantastic-upper west side, close to numerous restaurants on Columbus and Amsterdam Aves. Stone's throw from Central Park, less than a block from subway entrance for B, D. Old world charm in wood-paneled lobby. Attentive and friendly staff. Comfortable beds, quiet (14th floor). Given the chance, I will stay here again and recommend it to friends/family.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location just steps from the AMNH and Central Park”
Reviews.Author: verymary
Reviews.Content: In Manhattan on business, we were booked at the Excelsior by someone else and were really happy with the location and atmosphere upon check-in. We were surprised to enter our room and see that it was a two room suite on the front corner of the building with windows on 3 sides. There are French doors to the large king bedroom from the adequate sized living/sitting area and it's large windows overlooking the museum's picturesque grounds. We stayed for several nights and really loved the neighborhood - typical upper west side - near the park with eateries, bakeries, shops, pharmacies and dry cleaners everywhere. There is a dog park on the museum grounds which we enjoyed watching from our giant window-seats. We extended our stay - thinking we'd be moving to a cheaper room - and discovered that this hotel was not outrageously priced AT ALL and we could actually stay put. Grrrreat place!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location, close enough to the action.”
Reviews.Author: Goodbeard
Reviews.Content: 5 nights stay at this hotel, we got some flavor of living in NYC. Visited plenty of the sights using the subway just up the road. No issues with the staff, but we were not in the hotel room long enough anyway. Quiet room on the 11th floor, so slept soundly each night.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: javax
Reviews.Content: Good hotel just near Natural history museum. Clean and silent.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: NotreDameFromHawaii
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved staying here. It was such a nice getaway! We stayed in a suite with two television sets and a cozy bathroom. The beds were soft and luxurious, and the room always felt clean. It was a good deal considering its location and caliber of accommodations! The hotel is on the Upper West Side, so it was easy to visit Central Park, where we would go jogging in the morning. Great location, cute neighborhood, and lovely hotel. I did not give it a full five stars because the elevator was small and made it difficult for everyone in the hotel to go up- or downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, lovely room”
Reviews.Author: christine g
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before booking an ( inexpensive-relatively) hotel for a 4 night stay . Booked a standard two bed-room. When we got there, they said the only such room that was available was on the 3rd floor and would be too noisy so they upgraded us to a suite on the 12th floor. It worked out sooooo well for us, as as soon as we got back to the room at night, my son could go into the bedroom and watch cartoons ( we dont have TV at home, so this was part of the thrill for him!) and my sister and i could talk/plan/watch better shows. I think I read of another case of this exact thing happening to another family, down to the fllors, which is kind of odd, but it worked out really really well for us. Also had read that the desk staff was surly, which was absolutely NOT THE CASE when we were there. Everyone was very friendly, efficient. Also read that the rooms were hot. Not so with our AC unit. It was all really really nice. Great value for the money, great location in a funky neighbourhood, and really close to the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Go else where!!”
Reviews.Author: Darren H
Reviews.Content: Two word's 'NEVER AGAIN'. The shower draIn backed up, so you had a shower-bath. The over priced US$17 breakfast at 7.15am recieved (served from 7 too 11 am) was cold. The staff where un-approachable and beyound unhelpful. The bar and restaurant... ughh.. dont even ask, the US wants atleast a 20% tip on orders... I did else where, but strugglked giving even 5% here..House keeping, rang you when you have the "do not disturb" sign on the door... ahh what part of do not disturb aint you getting dip head? On a plus the room was good, excellent views. Failing that alone, never again. Also you have too pay for internet!!! WTF!! Honestly.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond expectations - Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Andyneedsadrink
Reviews.Content: Many of the reviews talk about the great location, its true. Quieter area but close to the madness. The staff are all wonderful, I read some reviews about negative staff and never saw this. But if you give attitude, you'll get it back anywhere... The hotel is first class, beautifully decorated and all rooms have been updated. Very clean and no bugs. The Subway is at the end of the block to get the B or C train. The trains will have you anywhere in 5-10 minutes and are very clean, safe and easy to follow. The area is very funky, great restaurants all over (use TA mobile to check them out), and shopping. Thereâ€™s a new restaurant that opened up in the hotel called the Calle Ocho (actually it relocated from up the street). Great food and the best sangria I have ever tasted (see my review on them for more info). The hotel has a great gym and AC in all rooms. We rented a fridge from them for $10. a day, well worth it as we bought groceries around the corner for breakfast, snacks and of course beer. Central park is at the end of the block and is so nice so explore, make sure you rent a boat to paddle around in. No coffee maker but Starbucks is across the street. We're coming back here next August for 10 days. Feel free to contact me if you have any questions

Reviews.Title: “A Treasure in the Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: JSPuskar
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at the Excelsior Hotel, and we'll be back. The room we had was comfortable, bright and clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel is perfectly located on the Upper West Side, within walking distance of Central Park, the Museum of Natural History, and lots of great places to dine and drink. For what the Excelsior provides, this is a good deal in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: SightSeer70
Reviews.Content: Very pleasantly surprised by overall experience. Room (two twin beds) was small but quite attractive, clean and neat. Room and bath appeared to have been recently remodeled. Pleasant staff. Breakfast area is attractively old-fashioned, and buffet at $17/person is excellent value. Highly recommended for the thrifty but discerning traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and room at fair NYC price”
Reviews.Author: wwalterRome
Reviews.Content: The very convenient upper West Side location, with the subway, buses and Central Park all within short walk will make you forget the somewhat obsolescing infrastructure. And at a fair price. When here Iâ€™m used to get a Deluxe Room with Park view (South), and despite my highly demanding sleeping habits (need absolute silence) Iâ€™m always ok.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: LordWool
Reviews.Content: Not cheap but it is New York after all....rooms were clean with good air con. Concierge and other staff helpful

Reviews.Title: “Convenient & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: SusanBTx
Reviews.Content: Great location for access to tourist sites by day and local neighborhood feel at night. Nice location across from museum park and very spacious room. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, staff could be better”
Reviews.Author: FashionGirl59
Reviews.Content: The location on this hotel is amazing and very picturesque. The neighborhood is very quiet and has great subway access. The main downside was the snooty service we received because we booked thru a discount site. We booked a room with two double beds and when we arrived they gave us a room with one queen size bed. When asked about the mistake they informed us that availability was not guaranteed and they didn't have any rooms with a King or two double beds available. In addition they were out of roll away beds, since I was traveling with another person we needed the two beds and consequently one of us opted for the floor of the bedroom. Good attributes are the beautiful building, great location and comfy down comforters. The rooms are very good size for NYC but I can not even convey my disgust for the snooty staff. Oh an one other thing when we visited the air conditioning in our room didn't work, apparently it is an older hotel and if the heat is turned on for the hotel you can't use the air conditioning. It is air or heat and that goes for the whole hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great service.”
Reviews.Author: leah90
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and had great customer service. The concierge, Candice, and front desk clerk, Frances, were very helpful and friendly. The room and bathroom where clean and quiet. Don't use the phone as long distance charges are very expensive. Close to attractions like central park, MET, Guggenheim. Close to great restaurants on the upper West side.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in a residential neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Marriotthk
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for a week. Great location in a residential neighbourhood, on or near two subway lines. A crosstown bus goes down the street (and across Central Park to the Metropolitan museum) Loads of great restaurants nearby and the fantastic Zabar's deli. An old style hotel but spotlessly clean and wonderfully comfortable beds. Only drawback was the lack of free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Dyintorace
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here for 5 nights in July 2011 and had a wonderful visit. The hotel staff was very helpful and pleasant and the facility itself is great. It is an older hotel, so we went in expecting that and were (pleasantly) surprised with the condition. The lobby is attractive and the location (upper west side) is fantastic! Right across from the history museum and near several great restaurants and Central Park! Be sure to hit the Shake Shack nearby on Columbus!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: inthepink33
Reviews.Content: Just across from the tree-filled grounds of the Natural History Musem and 2 minutes walk from Central Park and the subway in one direction, and lots of great eateries in the other. Clean, well presented rooms, good reception and concierge service. Only downside, no fridge, but it seems that most hotels in NY don't have them.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor hotel - service was non existent!”
Reviews.Author: Gail062
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms were very clean, it is a basic hotel and expensive for what it is. Everything is chargeable! The staff were not just unfriendly, they appear to be rude and ignorant and I would not suggest anyone to stay there at all. Position was good if you want to be near Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous! We will be back”
Reviews.Author: pretty-lady44118
Reviews.Content: We traveled to NYC for a vacation and chose the Excelsior because of the Tripadvisor reviews. We were not disappointed. The staff was responsive and courteous; our standard queen room was spacious and clean; the lobby was beautiful; and the Upper West Side location was perfect â€“ a half block from the Museum of Natural History, subway stop, and a cross town bus stop. Many affordable restaurants were within two blocks. We found the best rates on their website http://www.excelsiorhotelny.com/, not on the hotel discount websites.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED The Excelsior”
Reviews.Author: inga518
Reviews.Content: I had never stayed in the Upper West Side and was delighted with The Excelsior. Between Central Park West and Columbus Avenue, this hotel is in an amazing location. 1/2 block to the Natural History Museum. The room that I booked was actually a suite, very comfortable, updated, roomy. I was on the 14th floor and was able to look out the window to a view towards the northern sky...not into another building! The room rate was what I had expected, not over priced for peak time in NYC. Enjoyed combing the Upper West Side and found it to be just about adorable, a hip residential area with lots of shopping and restaurants. Staff was helpful but not as attentive as I would of expected. I would definitely stay at The Excelsior again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Caughman
Reviews.Content: Our room was fine--nice view of the street below to people watch. Hotel is within walking distance of many landmarks/places to eat/visit. The computer/internet connection area only had a couple computers which were almost always being used. I had to wait in line to be able to print our boarding passes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Upper West Side Gem”
Reviews.Author: HowFtLaud
Reviews.Content: A real quaint boutique European style hotel across the street from the Museum of Natural History. Right on the subway line. Next door to where Seinfeld, McEnroe, Stossel, Pandit live.

Reviews.Title: “would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: egbert499484
Reviews.Content: electric socket in room not finished big gap all around breakfast, the rubbish bin is in room near eating table we viewed tea leaves and breakfast food in bin whilst eating. dirty dishes put through hatch in bowl clean dishes returned through same hatch at one time virtually side by side no drinks available other than water, if you needed anything else it meant leaving the hotel for an outside coffee shop etc. charged 10$ a night for a fridge to store medical supplies i.e, insulin when quiered possible other storage told we could use ice in a bucket.

Reviews.Title: “horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: homeless53
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the worst ones I have ever stayed in. I would rate it as two stars max. It is just opposite the Natural History Museum and Central Park. To get to the centre it takes about 10 min on the subway. We had to move rooms twice within a week; the first time because of a giant cockroach in our room on the 15 (!) floor. The second time because our bathtub was clogged and the water wouldnâ€™t drain. We had complained several times and each time the staff just wasnâ€™t interested and acted as if they had heard these kinds of complaints before. They would not take responsibility and always claim they had just started their shifts or somebody on the next shift would deal with it. They were just indifferent and never once apologized for the poor conditions at their hotel. I would definitely not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed here twice so far, and look forward to returning.”
Reviews.Author: alnesser
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon in December 2010, but we first stayed here the first time I took my wife (then fiancee) to my hometown of NYC in August 2009. The hotel is elegant and clean, and during our first stay, we were even upgraded to a suite at no cost. On our last trip, we were even allowed to check in early, and the hotel was great about holding our bags for several hours after we checked out so that we could enjoy our last morning/early afternoon in the city and pick our bags up later. Overall, the hotel staff was average; not overly attentive, but not rude or unhelpful, either. The hotel's location makes it even more special. It's located in a nice, clean, quiet neighborhood, far enough from the madness of midtown to allow for a peaceful stroll when you first walk outside the hotel, yet close enough to the craziness for when you want to go down there. The C train can be caught down at the eastern corner of the block, right across the street from Central Park, and you can find yourself at Columbus Circle in just a few minutes. It's really great to have Central Park down the street. Columbus Avenue is down at the western corner, with great restaurants all around (including a Pizzeria Uno, which my wife and I love). You get all of this for a fairly reasonable rate by NYC standards. Another perk about the hotel's location is that it's the only hotel on that side of the block, so the area has a nice residential vibe about it. Furthermore, it's directly across the street from the Museum of Natural History, so there's another positive attribute. My wife and I can't wait for our next trip in August 2011, when we will certainly stay at the Excelsior once again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: KaterinaK
Reviews.Content: This is a very decent, clean and cozy hotel. The rooms were nice and comfortable, the breakfast was good, albeit a bit pricey ($17 per person), but we only ate there a few times since there are so many great cafes and delis around that area. The location couldn't be better: a stone's throw from a subway station, the Museum of Natural History, Central Park and numerous good restaurants and bars. Upper West Side is amazing. The only negative comment I can make about the hotel is something that has been pointed out by many others: the staff. Nothing terrible, but they seriously looked and acted like they couldn't care less about their guests and like they hated being stuck in the reception desk. Also, it can get a bit noisy during the night and early morning, due to traffic. We were on the seventh floor and I don't think I could have been able to sleep without earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location...I just wish...”
Reviews.Author: kirkrik
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been staying at the Excelsior for 25+ years, and we will continue to do so. The rooms are nice and meet our needs. They have made special considerations for me when I needed to keep a bicycle for a 4:00am bike ride. The location is fantastic if you like the Upper West Side (and we do). We will probably continue to stay at the Excelsior. I just wish that the staff was a little more sensitive to a traveler's needs. I've read a few other Tripadvisor reviews that mention a certain amount of ambivalence to the customers. I've always chalked that up to a culture clash between hardened New Yorkers and the throngs of tourists excited for their New York adventures. This last week I came to a realization that the staff just really doesn't see the need to go above and beyond. The specific example I have (and it seems a little petty when I think about it) deals with not having a printer available with their "business center". One of the last activities most travelers do today is print out a boarding pass so they can get make air travel a bit easier. And in every other hotel I've stayed in, and I've stayed in many, that service is now a given. It's one of those things that, if done well, will delight the hotel customer. Excelsior's policy seems to be built around protecting themselves against printer abuse. And to that end they've contracted the functionality out to a third party, and the customer has to pay the hotel $0.25 for every page the need to print. But more than thatâ€¦ Because the functionality is coming through a third party, the boarding passes you can see and print out from a web page have to be saved as a printable document. Now, there may be some more web savvy users out there that now how to do that instinctively, but I had to have the staff at the front desk talk me through it on the phone (I was trying to do it from my personal computer - did I mention that the Excelsior is charging you to access the Hotel's wifi so you can get to your boarding pass?). But because I had to print out not only 2 boarding passes, and 2 receipts for baggage charges, I also had to pay $0.25 for cover sheets for each of these documents. Why? Each of the documents already had my name on them. It was the same name that was going to be on the hotel room invoice. So after sending the documents to the printer, I had to ride the elevator down to the front desk (where I started in the first place because I assumed I could do all of this at their "business center") to see if they printed. The man at the desk (who I'd been on the phone with) wouldn't look me in the eye as he handed the print-outs to me. I said (calmly, because I'm not aggressive) "This is the sort of thing that is going to lose this hotel business". He replied, "All the other hotels will also charge you for print outs". (Again, he still wouldn't look me in the eye.) I answered, "That's NOT true." And I went back to the elevator. The next day I looked at my hotel invoice and saw a charge for $12.50 for "miscellaneous". I called the front desk and asked what it was for, and person actually said "let's see, you printed out 8 pieces of paper...how many pieces of paper did you print out?" I answered, "8 pieces - like you said", and she said "oh, we charged you $10 too much - I'll just refund you." I am left to wonder if the guy the night before didn't like being confronted about their ridiculous printing policy and decided to add an extra digit to my bill. So there it is, a bad taste left in my mouth at the end of an otherwise fine experience. A half an hour wasted - for both me and the staff - because the hotel wanted to get another $2.50 out of me. If the Excelsior Management is reading this, I hope they take a closer look at the policies that travelers have come to expect, and think of ways to surprise and delight us - not frustrate and waste our time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, small rooms and poor staff.”
Reviews.Author: FN_Madball
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located less than a block from the Metro and Central Park. Great location but rooms are small and standard is ok. Expensive WiFi and unhelpful staff who didn't even try to smile or be helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, unresponsive staff”
Reviews.Author: Jaatinen
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 12 nights with my family. Location is excellent - near the Central park but also by a small park of Museum of Natural History. Subway just a half of a block away. Beds good, no noise, maintenance was good. Nothing to complain about the rooms but nothing special to mention either. Had a good sleep every night. However the staff did not impress us. You can't say they were unfriendly but not much more than that. No Welcomes, no Good Mornings. When we left after 12 nights the behavior was consistent. I just paid and left. I don't recall hearing any words from the person in duty. They did not make during the whole of our stay any attempt to serve or be friendly. Still the location is great, rooms clean and we slept well - we were not looking for more than that. For others with just these needs I can recommend this hotel, but next time I will choose another one.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and convenient on the Upper West Side”
Reviews.Author: k8maxmom
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel for a week's vacation in New York city. The Upper West Side has a human scale atmosphere that is very refreshing after a busy day in other Manhattan neighborhoods. When we checked in, we were upgraded to a suite. The suite had a small but comfortable living room and a bedroom with two double beds. Each room had a television. The room did not have a coffee so we went to Zabar's and bought a $20 coffee maker, filters and two cups. We were given a complimentary pound of coffee. Nice to have coffee in the room. The front desk staff is efficicent but not friendly. The concierge is efficient but not friendly. The housekeeping staff was quick and thorough every day. The maintenance staff fixed the television within 5 minutes of placing the call. The room was spacious and very comfortable. The room was on the 15th floor and very quiet. There are subway stops in the same block as the hotel, and Central Park is one block away. I would stay, again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JAS0831
Reviews.Content: My mother-in-law wanted to take me and my two teenage daughters to New York. In past trips, she had stayed in Times Square, but she decided she wanted to stay by Central Park this time. As we were not at all familiar with hotels in the area, I booked The Excelsior based on other reviews and proximity to the park. I was a little nervous as some of the reviews remarked about poor service. This was not our experience at all. The staff was very helpful in securing reservations and giving directions. Our room was upgraded to a mini-suite and quite lovely. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York City who wants to be close to the park.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel: can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: Helene055
Reviews.Content: My sister and I arrived in New York on an early flight so we we're ready to leave our luggages and come back later when the room would be available. Not only Omayra, a very gracious lady at the reception desk, offered us the room right away but she gave us an upgraded room with no charge! The room was absolutely delightful and also very quiet, very clean and spacious. The hotel is VERY well situated; a lot of restaurants of different cuisine (I would recommend Kefi on Columbus and Fatty Crab on Broadway), a lot of museums and a subway station at two minutes. One thing is sure: next time I'll be in New York it will be at the Excelsior!

Reviews.Title: “Big city, big promise, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: rob_thirtysomething
Reviews.Content: Can't go wrong with nyc, but this hotel was a bit disappointing. The lobby and building are very impressive but we were bit surprised that the rooms didn't meet the expectations set on their web site. For most the tourist hot spots the excelsior is a bit too much of a walk but sub way nice and close and this area has a few places to eat and drink.

Reviews.Title: “I used To Be A regular here”
Reviews.Author: bccrab
Reviews.Content: Over the past 10 years I've stayed at the Excelsior numerous times totaling over 30 nights. I've been in every type of room or suite they offer. This hotel used to be an amazing value. The location is great with the Upper Westside neighborhood feel yet convenient to the subway. I found the rooms clean but not very modern. The TVs were old fashioned with limited channels. Here's what caused me to look elsewhere. The front desk staff is rude and after so many visits I would have expected some acknowledgement or at least a decent welcome but every trip was like the first. One rainy night I slipped on the tiles and fell pretty hard in the lobby and they barely looked up. There was nobody else there so it wasn't as if they were busy. Not even an " are you ok ?" . I've stayed there both alone and with family. I will admit the suites are a good size and sleep 4 comfortably, a rarity in NYC. Nevertheless I opted out and started staying at other hotels when I'm in NYC where I feel the service is better value for the money or at chain hotels where I can earn points.

Reviews.Title: “Cancelled Reservation without Notice-Ruined Plans”
Reviews.Author: sbask
Reviews.Content: My wife and I flew down from Boston for a special day and evening at the Project Hope Gala at the American Museum of Natural History, across the street from the hotel. This was one of the recommended hotels for this non-profit fundraiser. The hotel had cancelled the reservation, even though we had our confim# from AMEX. After an hour of the phone with AMEX and the hotel, the hotel would not yield. All hotels in the city were full that night, and we had to pay 1000 to stay at the Benjamin, way down on 50th and Park. Therefore, no time in the Park, two cab rides back and forth for a black tie event, with my wife in her gown. No compensation from the hotel for the any of the difference in cost of 750. Does not make one LOVE NYC.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel definitely would go back.”
Reviews.Author: barooga
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a gem. Close to Central park (one block away), the subway station, with a small park directly across the hotel, belonging to the museum of Natural History. There was an excellent bar and restaurant (Unos) quite close to the hotel, and the hotel's restaurant was very nice, with excellent service and good food - great for breakfast. The hotel itself was beautifully presented, with a warm and inviting lobby with lots of comfortable furniture to sit and chat if you were waiting for someone etc. and the hotel looks like it's had a major makeover fairly recently. (I love that they've kept the original elevator doors, they're beautiful!) The staff were efficient and helpful, with someone on duty at all hours and the rooms were excellent with a comfortable bed and a great shower. We had a bit of a problem with our first room, due to noise and were given an upgrade to a fantastic room as soon as we mentioned it. But the best part was the locality. It is situated in a predominately residential area, with nice apartment blocks, as well as local restaurants, a couple of laundries (very handy) corner store, small shops etc. We walked to most of the places in downtown NY, or caught cabs that were really cheap, but also used the subway, (if we wanted to travel further out,) which was easy to use and close to the hotel. We went on one of the cruises out of Pier 81 on our first morning, which took us around the whole of Manhattan Island and gave us a fantastic perspective of New York as well as the history. It also provides the best opportunity for taking a photo of the Statue of Liberty and saves the cost of doing the tour there later. We then used the double decker tour buses to check out the sights and they were worth every cent. You can get a ticket for two days and hop on and off as you wish, stopping at any place that takes your fancy, all over NYC. The Greline coaches were the best. Buying your Broadway show tickets at Time Square is the only way to go - tickets half price, just make sure you get there to line up around 2:30 ready for the 3:00pm opening of the ticket office. If you want to avoid the queues at the Empire State, be there by around 9:30am. We got up to the top within fiftteen minutes - it can be 1 to 2 hours wait later in the day. The Ground Zero tour is highly reccommended, and left a deep impression of both of us. There's so much to see and do in NYC and we packed in quite a lot of it in seven days. The hotel was in such an ideal location and was so comfortable and well kept that we just loved every minute of our stay in New York. Looking forward to going back again, one day, and would definitely stay at the Excelsior again and have told friends who are going to NYC soon, to do so to!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, clean, and good location!”
Reviews.Author: agnursmith
Reviews.Content: As i said, ver good hotel. A little expensive but in a great location. Very close to the Metro stations. Should have free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful three night stay...”
Reviews.Author: Pierreview
Reviews.Content: The location is lovely...close to the park, cafes on Columbus Ave., Hayden, walk through Central Park to the Guggenheim, subway close by...Our room was large with two beds, nice bath, and was very clean. We had no need for interaction with staff except at check in and that was pleasant. I look forward to returning on my next trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “great location, so so everything else”
Reviews.Author: pmwershof
Reviews.Content: Booked several months ago for a 6 night stay- room was small but efficient and almost clean- drop of blood on sink and hair on bathroom wall tiles! Then after 4 nights, found cockroach in closet. Had to call twice and wait 45 minutes before anyone came - we weren't fast enough to catch the creature and it disappeared. After much spraying, the room stank so we asked at the desk (1 am by this time) for another room and were given a filthy noisy room over front entrance! We asked for some reduction in the price and we got $100 off but only after asking. The front desk was professional but not very proactive. Should have given at least a free night. Didn't sleep well the last two nights- noisy and more hair on walls and on bathtub and uncleaned carpeting. We've been coming to NY for 11 years almost 5 times a year and loved the location of this place. NEVER AGAIN!! Other places are much better for the same cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very clean. Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Mitch2807
Reviews.Content: Location was excellent - very near Central Park, across the road from Natural History Museum. Very near subway, bank, and, one block from some nice restaurants and pubs. Rooms very clean but quite small. And quite a lot of noise from traffic during the night. (bring ear-plugs!). No tea-making facilities, but maybe that's normal in USA hotels (we have them in all Irish hotels). Breakfast very expensive at $17 each, and quite cold. Only had breakfast there once. Had Wifi in the rooms but at a cost of $3.99 for half an hour I only used it once! The concierge (Meredith) was friendly and helpful. Staff were ok - the guy we met when checking out wasn't friendly, but not rude either. The doorman was very helpful. Spend 40 mins flagging down a taxi for us in the pouring rain! No bar at hotel which was a shame. All in all it was a great location and clean and that's all that mattered to us. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at it's best... Amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: Marrasyn
