Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent an evening in a beautiful suite at the Excelsior. The rooms are well-appointed, yet comfortable. The beds were cozy and I loved how the french doors separated the living and bedroom area. The view was wonderful... we overlooked the Museum of Natural History. The common areas are also outstanding! The lobby is beautiful and smells like roses! Also, very close to transportation and entertainment. The staff was very attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Generally Top Notch, But a Little Rough Around the Edges”
Reviews.Author: AntSteve
Reviews.Content: If there is one constructive comment that we'd make, it would be that the front desk staff should learn how to smile and generally demonstrate that they appreciate the customers with whom they are interacting. On the other hand, the attendant in the breakfast room (Beata!), cleaning staff and Bellmen (Mark!) have been fabulous! They genuinely show that they are enjoying working for the hotel, and they are beyond reproach with regard to service delivery. Their attitude rubs off on you, which is a guaranteed way to ensure that you enjoy your stay at this delightful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location but thats about it”
Reviews.Author: spyonline
Reviews.Content: Locaton was awesome, perfect spot for a quiet time in NYC. Subway a half a block away which was nice and some decent places within walking distance. I did see alot of reviews on rude staff and now I can see why. Very moody it seemed and not very nice. Room was tiny like many hotels in the city but for the price I paid not worth it. Room had two used bandaids stuck to AC unit which was nasty and shower drain was very very slow so you were standing in water for all of your shower. It cost 52 bucks to park over night in the musems parking and that was with hotels discount, roughly 27 hours. Would I stay here again...na not for the money I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay in the Excelsior hotel in NYC was superb!”
Reviews.Author: Monikalaw3
Reviews.Content: Four girlfriends and I had a wonderful time in NYC as we had a weekend to ourselves celebrating the 50th birthday of a dear friend. Having never stayed at the Exclesior, I was unsure of what to expect. It is one of the rare times that I can say that our experience exceeded all expectations. The staff was OUTSTANDING! Omayra assisted us at the front desk and even upgraded our room when she found out one of us was celebrating a birthday. Everyone went out of their way to ensure the five of us had a fabulous experience.....from the front desk to the bellman to the concierge, security, housekeeping.....everyone had smiles on their faces and were genuinely interested in making sure our stay was the best it could possibly be. The rooms were spotless, the service impeccable, the location was excellent if you want a little distance from the hustle and bustle of Times Square, yet still close to Central Park, fabulous restaurants and the NYC Museum of Natural History. Thank you Omayra and the rest of the staff. I would definitely stay at the Excelsior again and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Roz08_11
Reviews.Content: We received the most appalling service, couldn't even call it service. Rooms were nice but couldn't control heat so too hot. Location fantastic for Central Park. Liked location the best, service the least. The staff were extremely rude with no one helping us & got even ruder when we didn't tip!! We carried our own bags & the bellboy wanted a tip!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for visiting museums”
Reviews.Author: ScottFife
Reviews.Content: Lovely clean hotel in a quieter location than downtown. We had a room overlooking the Natural History Museum and a small park with the downtown skyscapers in the background - very pretty at night. Full breakfast was plentiful and a good price - kept us going till early evening. A 7 day transport ticket was useful - crosstown bus in the street goes to Central Park E - not so far to walk for Guggenheim and Met Museum of Art; buses and subway closeby for downtown. Hotel staff pleasant and helpful with enquiries.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Olivah
Reviews.Content: The service we experienced was on the whole very good, my only problem was on check in the receptionist being very abrupt and answering the phone and talking to other staff while checking us in. To counter this however, the concierge (Anna I think she was called) was absolutely brilliant! She got us tickets from the Addams Family and we were on the 5th row back. Also, any questions she answered very well and gave us leaflets and information on all the main tourist attractions. Our room was perfect for our stay, a small lounge-like area and a wardrobe in one room and then doors through to our bedroom with two small double beds. The mattress's and pillows were so comfy, to the point we were sleeping about 11 hours by the last few days! The location was very good, not too far from the Subway station to take us right into New York and next to Central Park for walks on a morning. All in all it was a very pleasant experience and made us want to go back to New York more than we already did!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lamp2000
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Excelsior Hotel four years ago and hoped it would still be a great place to stay in NYC. It was! We had a lovely suite and everything exceeded our expectations. The area is excellent for restaurants and museums with public transportation just a few steps away. With a similar price deal, we would certainly stay at the Excelsior in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: freods
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel to the city a lot since our two kids live in Manhattan. The Excelsior was one of the best hotels we have visited. The common area was beautiful with fresh flowers and our two room suite was spotless with a wonderful view uptown at night. The breakfast was pricey so we didnt bother and just walked to a Lenny's for something to start the day. The area is very safe with the Museum right across the street, Central Park down the block, and the 20th precinct station close by. The king bed was the most comfortable we experienced in NY. There was plenty of hot water and two tvs. No free wi fi, no coffee pot in the room, and a somewhat arrogant desk clerk were downers. Nonetheless, we plan on returning in May.

Reviews.Title: “Geat Location in a beautiful neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: ilove2travel1964
Reviews.Content: I was apprehensive staying here after some reviews and the whole bedbug infestation that was terrorizing NYC. However, the room was pretty , clean and quite comfortable . The hotel staff was indifferent but really had no need for them. The hotel was in a great location with quaint boutiques and eateries. Subway stop right across the street. Could not have asked for a better location or better hotel. Will say here again on my next vacation as long as the reviews remain good

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, nothing like previous bad reviews indicate”
Reviews.Author: AdeleCPT
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nestled in the Upper West Side. It is 4 min walk from the subway and a brisk walk through central park delivers you on the East Side. The hotel is clean and staff were friendly, something I was concerned about after reading previpus reviews. The room was spacipus and neat as a pin. It was quiet (10th floor) and I was able to check in 2 hours early. Baggage was stored by the bellman at arrival and departure. Starbucks is just around the corner. Wi-fi isavailable, but at almost $10 per day somewhat ridiculous. Wi-fi speed is good, however. Would definitely stay hereagain.

Reviews.Title: “amazing location and great value”
Reviews.Author: zzook
Reviews.Content: My first time to New York and I was apprehensive about what had been described as a four star hotel. It is on a lovely quiet street (81st) in West Central Park, right opposite the Natural HIstory Museum and Planetarium. Subway stop is 200 metres from the door which meant only four stops downtown and access to all you could wish to see and do! Check in was very friendly and efficient and our 10th storey room had lovely views over the Planetarium and the trees and park around it..... even a few squirrels were running around yesterday morning as we headed for the subway! Bedroom had a king sized bed , ample storage space and a very clean bathroom with both bath and shower. Water was piping hot! Staff were very helpful with all our questions and stored our luggage for the rest of the day after we had checked out. Would certainly go back there on our next trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: eirang
Reviews.Content: stayed for 2 nights. am a seasoned business traveller; could not expect more except for 2 things that I think should be done: 1. remove the charge for internet use - just add $5 a day to the room charge. you will make more and annoy less. 2. tell your guests they can park at the museum and get their stub validated. I found out by chance.

Reviews.Title: “What a shame...”
Reviews.Author: cmh621
Reviews.Content: I rarely give negative reviews on hotels, but I have to say that this hotel has the worst customer service ever. It is a shame that people in management positions (who should be more respectful of their customers) are rude and have bad attitudes. They completely ruined my Valentine's Day and I would advise anyone to not stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: viki22
Reviews.Content: On arriving at the hotel we found we had been upgraded to the penthouse suite which comprised a bedroom (with two huge, comfortable king size beds), a clean bathroom and a sitting room with a lovely view of Manhattan. We were in very close proximity to Central Park, the building used in Ghostbusters, the Natural History Museum and the Dakota Building (where John Lennon was shot). It was very easy to get around New York from here on the Subway and there were several delicious eateries a short walk away. Breakfast is served at the hotel at an additional cost but we didn't find the need to use the restaurant at all. A safe is provided free of charge but you have to pay to use wi fi. The only down was that there was no tea/coffee facilities in the room although there is a Starbucks 2 minutes away. Overall we would highly recommend this hotel for friendly staff, helpful porters, nice rooms and good room service. The hotel also made arrangements to transport us back to the airport - a nice touch

Reviews.Title: “Staff are rude and unwelcoming”
Reviews.Author: judylynn2011
Reviews.Content: Had a pretty big problem with a cancelled reservation and when we tried to check in the front desk staff, mainly Lynn were extremely unhelpful and completely disinterested in trying to resolve the issue. Hotel is pretty well located for the downtown subway and didn't have any trouble getting around. Rooms were quite small but also well cleaned and serviced each day.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Great Locations”
Reviews.Author: JMW68
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean, front desk staff at check in not very friendly almost rude. Bellman and the gentleman that helped store our bags and called a taxi on check out day, was fabulous, friendly and courteous. NO in room coffee... continental breakfast 13 dollars... I would stay again, but would bring a small kettle and coffee with me. There is a starbucks around the corner for anyone requiring coffee as soon as your eyes open. The location is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “good location......but...”
Reviews.Author: NYC-newyear
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel for 6nights. Reception staff ok. Did what they had to do but nothing extra. Had requested high level room possibly with view of central park......that did not happen. However did get small room in quiet area of hotel with view of private apartment buildings. On inspection of our room a hair clip from a previous guest was on the floor behind our tv......5 days later the clip was still there. To add to this the wall attached headboards were full of dust and obviously never cleaned. Receptionst did not want to deal with any queries other than check you in/out. Absolutly no staff/customer relations....pity because location is great but you might as well be "anywhere"in the world.......staff take note....if you want repeat customers. Having stayed in other local hotels such as Lucerne,On the Ave,and Beacon We will not be returning to the Excelsior.... Excelsior staff please take note that you must go the make guests feel they are more than welcome if you are to get any or repeat business. I for one will not recommend this hotel totally due to staff handling......

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, great location”
Reviews.Author: grandfam
Reviews.Content: Located just a few doors from the 81st subway stop, we were very happy with the Excelsior. Our room was well lit, fresh and clean. The common rooms (lobby and breakfast room) were gorgeous with wood paneling. Full breakfast was excellent, with a hint of a European breakfast in the offerings.

Reviews.Title: “REALLY LOVELY HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Amy113
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night at this hotel on our way to Las Vegas, and we were absolutely delighted with our choice. To our surprise, we were upgraded to a top floor suite, which was really lovely... The room was newly decorated and spacious, very clean, the staff was wonderful.. Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for NYC Marathon”
Reviews.Author: MM2551
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel all the way around. Very clean, quiet for a good night's sleep and a perfect neighborhood for experiencing New York, the Children's Museum on 83rd, the Museum of Natural History and a perfect location for when I finished the marathon. Only a 5 block walk to get back to my family and the hotel after finishing the race. Will definitely stay here again for the race next time and any time I bring the family to NYC for the Museums. Top notch and super clean

Reviews.Title: “Will be Back, Wish We Stayed Sooner!!!”
Reviews.Author: johnsinead
Reviews.Content: The hotel is directly across the street from the Museum of Natural History on 81st between Columbus Ave and Central Park. It is clean and updated. One of the best hotels for the value in NYC. A short walk takes you to several bars and eateries. Will be staying here again in the very near future! Highly recommend it!! Note...There is no bar or restaurant in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mickeybUK
Reviews.Content: We visited as part of our anniversary celebrations and cannot speak highly enough of this hotel. On arrival at the lovely reception area, wood pannelling with lighting which complemented the decor nicely, we advised the desk that it was our anniversary and we would like a quiet room. They put us into an apartment ie. separate seating area and bedroom at the back of the hotel and we never heard any noise at all. Decor was of a good standard. The bed was enormous, I'm guessing Queen size. The room and hotel were impeccably clean. All staff were courteous and respectful. The hotel is well placed being literally 2 mins from Cenrtral Park, over the road from the Natural History Museum and 100m from the subway. As in most of New York there are quite a number of places to eat within a short stroll of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel - made our stay a delight!”
Reviews.Author: brownclantravellers
Reviews.Content: We stepped into the lovely clean lobby and instantly fell in love with the hotels old world charm. Then we were told our room had been upgraded to an even larger one! The room was fabulous and suited us and our 2 children (aged 12 and 16) perfectly. The room was spotless and daily maid service ensured all towels and shampoos etc were topped up and fresh. The real beauty of this hotel is in the little touches that take you back in time - the lifts, marble floors, exquisite chairs, staff uniforms etc. The location is brilliant. Right by central park and the subway. Close enough to great facilities for dining and shopping, but far enough away for peace and a good nights sleep. The hotel also arranged for a very comfortable taxi to Newark Airport at an excellent price with no add ons. We had a great time and felt very at home here!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: NormalfamilyNormalIL
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel. Around the corner from Central Park and across the street from the Natural History Museum. Across the street from a Subway stop that takes you downtown. Have to walk about 4 blocks for the Red line which goes to Ellis Island. Nice size rooms and bath. There is a small step going into the bathroom which you can trip on if not careful. There is a computer and printer you can use behind the front desk to print off your boarding pass. Serves breakfast but no other meal. We did not eat at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A good option on the west side”
Reviews.Author: cyberluddite
Reviews.Content: On a week when, for some reason, the places I usually stay in Manhattan were either full or priced much higher than usual, I opted to try the Excelsior, primarily because the price was within range of what I had hoped to spend. It wasn't the nicest place I've stayed in New York, but it was certainly nice enough, and I'd stay there again. If you're hoping for a place near Central Park on the west side, this is certainly a good location for you. It's on West 81st between Central Park West and Columbia (closest to Columbia), right across 81st Street from the Museum of Natural History. This is a location with lots of nearby choices for restaurants, bars, and shopping, along Columbia, Amsterdam, and Broadway--1, 2, and 3 blocks away, respectively. If you want to go elsewhere, the nearest subway station is less than a block from the hotel. The hotel is older--presumable from the around middle of the 20th Century--but nicely maintained and the common areas are attractively decorated. The room was nice but not luxurious. It was a bit small--this is certainly not uncommon for older Manhattan hotels--but it wasn't tiny, and there was still enough space to move around comfortably in. Housekeeping was thorough and efficient and the front desk staff and concierge were cordial and helpful. The hotel was quieter than the average midtown Manhattan hotel--81st Street does not have particularly heavy traffic as compared to many Manhattan streets. Wi-fi internet service is available and works well, but there is an additional charge of around $10 per day for it. It seems like prices vary somewhat on this hotel depending on season and bookings, but if you hit it when the hotel is offering decent rates, this is definitely a hotel worth considering. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved location, service could be friendlier”
Reviews.Author: sunnysideOR
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior is older, but it must have been completely remodeled recently because the rooms are in excellent condition and beautifully decorated. We loved the location; across 81st St. from the Museum of Natural History, 1/2 block from Central Park, and 1/2 block from the subway. We found it easy to get anywhere in Manhattan in a matter of minutes. There are many delis, cafes, & restaurants in the neighborhood, so we did not pay extra for the overpriced breakfast at the hotel. The room rate is about average for NYC, which is to say beaucoup $$$. But I'm sure it is possible to pay as much and get less. Ask for a room facing the museum park. Front desk staff was capable and efficient, but cold. The concierge acted like I was wasting her time, and the woman who answers the phone at the reservations line is just plain crabby and rude. No one cracked a smile except the housekeepers and maintenance staff, who were consistently friendly and helpful. Aside from the fact that most of the hotel staff do not know the meaning of the word "hospitality", we were happy with the Excelsior, and would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and privacy in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: twofromtexas42
Reviews.Content: When we stepped into the front lobby, it felt as if we had been transported back to a time of elegance, from the marble floors, to the wooden details throughout we felt like we were somewhere special. The front desk personnel were promt and professional. Time seemed to slow down once we stepped inside the elevator, and for us, that was a good thing. The halls were narrow and meandered a bit, but that added to the charm of an older building versus a new mega hotel. Our room was a nice suite, freshly remodeled and quite different from before. It was much more modern with subtle cream and light blue walls and light and airy window treatments. Our king sized bed was extremely comfortable and we slept like royalty. We could hear a slight hum of the city, but that didn't bother us at all. The Natural Museum of History was across the street and down the block and the surrounding restaurants and bars were extremely convenient. It was nice having the smaller delis, pharmacy, liquor stores, florist and grocery stores within walking distance and we found everything we wanted at all of these places. We made our suite our home away from home. Every morning, we ate breakfast on the second floor. The scrambled eggs were cooked perfectly and the pastries were fresh and delicious. After spending our days out and about seeing the city, it was nice to return to our room for a shower. The robes provided by the hotel were a nice touch. The only thing we missed was having a bar at the hotel, but that only encouraged us to get out and see what we wanted to see; a beautiful thriving city with interesting people from all over the world.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: 1Wichita
Reviews.Content: Whenever my wife and I travel to New York (every couple of years or so) was always stay at the Excelsior. For our interests, the location can't be beat. It is just across the street from the American Museum of Natural History, just steps from the 79th Street crosstown bus which will take you straight across Central Park to the Metropolitan Museum of Art, about a block from the B and C lines of the subway, a few blocks from the 1 and 2 lines of the westside subway (which I still think of as the IRT) and just down the street from Zabar's, where you can get your morning coffee and bagel, cream cheese and lox. Others have commented on the service -- we think it is great! Everyone is friendly and we have never had a problem that was not resolved right away. If you go to Manhattan, the Excelsior is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “great location,great presentation”
Reviews.Author: flyaway50
Reviews.Content: Loved the location,Central Park at the end of the street,as well as subway entrance.Room was just like in the pictures,clean and lovely linen. Concierge was very helpful. We are from NZ and thought the breakfasts were just great.We had the cheaper continental version,and everything was plentiful and lovely and clean,a great way to load up before going out into a New York day.Neighbourhood is just great,Zabars 2 blocks away and some great shops also,and felt so safe walking around there at night.Shake Shack down the road,and the ;hotel was so peaceful to come back to at night. We wanted a real neighbourhood experience in Upper West Side rather than frantic Times Square so thought it was great.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Excelsior was absolutely a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kpwMN
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at the Hotel Excelsior this past (long) weekend. Very comfortable room, quiet, spotless housekeeping and thoughtful staff. Starbucks is around the corner which is a great convenience as the continental breakfast is overpriced and unremarkable. Stay at the Hotel Excelsior for the marvelous UWS location, rooms and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but don't eat breakfast there”
Reviews.Author: acdixon65
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant experience at the Excelsior with one exception. It was clean, recently renovated, in a very nice neighborhood, and the front desk staff was friendly. The breakfast situation was something else. The hostess was surly, rude and impatient. They only offered a very expensive continental breakfast (no price breaks for small children) and and an even more expensive full breakfast. The hostess indicated very unpleasantly that cash just wouldn't do as a means of paying for it. We left disgusted and ate at the very friendly, inexpensive and delicious Manhattan Diner which is just a few blocks away on Broadway. Stay at the Excelsior; just don't eat there.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: Cluxly
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my boyfriend and everything was perfect. We couldn't fault it. The location is great, the room we stayed in was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was as it should be and the staff were friendly. Had an amazing time and would definitely stay again. My only regret is only booking a long weekend... New York is amazing and there just was't enough time to fit everything in.

Reviews.Title: “new york new york”
Reviews.Author: jennifersue
Reviews.Content: spent two nights here the hotel was top class ,very comfortable and excelent all round. situated near central park which was a lovely retreat from the city but we easily got around by underground. the cosierge wasnt that helpfull helping us get to new jersey for cruise but joe the taxi man outside was brilient and got us there and picked us up at the end of the cruise and took us back to new york then the jfk airport so look for him . his charge was very good and a lovely man. would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: danilosta08
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, we got a room with a great bed and nice fluffy sheets and down comforter. It was very clean had great showers and an amazing view! Also, the location is just excellent. Definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel - Rude Staff Who Couldn't Be Bothered!”
Reviews.Author: biztravelgirl21
Reviews.Content: Nice location on 81st street by the park, the rooms are clean, no room service. I like the hotel, it's boutique but the staff was rude. After traveling on a business trip, I needed a cab to take me to the airport early in the morning. The hotel attendant informed me the street was closed and she couldn't call a cab. Is the phone service shut down also? I asked for a car service and she said it was too late to call them. She said security could help get a cab but he wouldn't go past Amsterdam. Excuse me, do you work for this hotel or not? Isn't that the hotel staffs job to help hotel guests get car service, etc. This girl acted like she could not be bothered. Not impressed. Not sure if I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel - Fantastic Neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Twojackets
Reviews.Content: Negative reviews about "rude and unfriendly staff" are presumably from first-timers in New York City. In NYC you get what you give, and in my experience the service at the Excelsior was just fine. And why judge a hotel, especially in New York, just by the smile or the snarl you get from the front desk? Above all, the location is excellent. It's quiet, the rooms are relatively large by NY standards, it's right on beautiful Central Park, and surrounded by great diners and restaurants for every taste and budget from breakfast to dinner that make it pointless eating in the hotel. After a hard day's business or sightseeing, the Upper West Side is an oasis of chic calm - and just a short and easy taxi or subway ride from the bustle of central Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: muchachitaoz
Reviews.Content: I picked this place as it is close to friends in Manhattan.It is right opposite the Museum of Natural History & close to subways & buses. It was clean, friendly & came at a good price. The room was quite spacious for a NYC hotel and clean. Staff were helpful. Internet is at an additional cost. No breakfast was included in our package but there are lots of local places nearby for a good bit to eat. It was nice to be out of the hustle of midtown & in a more neighbourhood environment, close to Central Park also.

Reviews.Title: “Our first time at the Excelsior & Frances at the front desk was so helpful & polite. It's employees like her=returning.”
Reviews.Author: mpgenco51
Reviews.Content: Great location. We were immediately upgraded to a suite. It did not have a view, but the extra space made up for that. Only stayed 1 night. Suite was updated, clean, linens, pillows, robes, towels all immaculate. Convenient breakfast room open 7 to 11 a.m. Frances at the front desk had no problem with our request for a late check-out @ 1 p.m. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, excellent location, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: JackieQ58
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior is an old but very nice hotel which is perfect for families with children, since it is right next to the Museum of Natural History. Upon arriving we were told that we had been upgraded from a room with 2 double beds to a large suite which included a living room and beautiful view at no additional cost. What more can you ask for in a hotel? The breakfast was a little overpriced for what it was, but what isn't overpriced in New York? I liked it anyway because there was a nice lego table to keep my 4 year old busy while we ate. We already have reservations to go back next month.

Reviews.Title: “small friendly hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: dancedance72
Reviews.Content: the excelsior is a small old style hotel on the edge of central park. on arrival (first part of our honeymoon) we were upgraded to a suite. the staff were great offering advise and directions when we needed them. our room was large with a seperate sitting room and a small bathroom. price was part of a package but for new york was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Good location thats about it”
Reviews.Author: Rtx721
Reviews.Content: There is nothing goid to say about this hotel. The staff are rude and are not very helpful. Keep looking around and don't waste your time or money with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but uninterested front desk staff.”
Reviews.Author: travelsan29
Reviews.Content: Hotel Excelsior is located in a pretty calm neighborhood on upper west side just next to the Museum of Natural History and Central Park. Bus stops and a subway station are conveniently situated nearby. When arriving at the hotel we were â€œgreetedâ€� by the front desk staff that showed no interest in their guests whatsoever. No â€œwelcome to Hotel Excelsiorâ€� or â€œWe hope youÂ´ll enjoy your stay in New Yorkâ€�, we just got our keycard and the staff said that checkout time was at 12 noon next week. When we left on the final day of our stay we received the same uninterested â€œserviceâ€� as before. The room was really nice; it was actually two rooms, one smaller room/hallway and the bedroom. The rooms were clean and the beds were big and comfortable. The bathroom looked clean and tidy except for the shower head that was dirty. The shower was quite strange; at the max level it was more like the Niagara Falls. We received a room with a view at the inner yard, not the best view but in exchange the room was quiet which is very rare in New York City. For some reason the room had two TV sets but no small refrigerator or coffee maker/tea boiler. To sum it up: Positive aspects: Great location and a quiet room. The hotel had for New York City quite reasonable prices. Negative aspects: Front desk staff. No refrigerator or coffee maker/tea boiler.

Reviews.Title: “Excelsior - Ever Upward”
Reviews.Author: 5w30
Reviews.Content: Excelsior is the state motto of New York. Ever Upward. The Excelsior Hotel on New York's Upper West Side outdoes itself. Beautiful little hotel of the old-school variety overlooking the American Museum of Natural History and its Rose Center for Earth and Space ... old New Yorkers still call it the Hayden Planetarium! Check in was efficient even in this chaotic summer tourist season. And the room - a suite overlooking the treetops and the skyline of Manhattan! You are literally steps from Central Park West ... and a key subway stop, so if Midtown's your game you're 4 stops away! The amenities are first rate, first-class and plentiful. I think the Excelsior is a superb alternative to the usual Midtown Manhattan hotel, perfect for just about anyone, couples, families, seniors - anyone who wishes to stay in a neighborhood instead of a theme park!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: frequentflyer98121
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this wonderfully located hotel for business. Its a great value, I was upgraded to a suite that was great everything looked very clean but I believe I was bitten by bed bugs which has become a big problem in NYC. I've let them know so hopefully they'll address the issue asap. I would like to stay here regularly but am hesitant now.

Reviews.Title: “Not much attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: nhdrjon
Reviews.Content: First this was my first stay in a NewYork City Hotel in over 30 years since I have a lot of family there. I was a guest of my son who paid for pur stay so I don;t know its cost or value. The location is great and the room was nicely laid out. What I did not like 1) No provision for parking or assistance on this in any way. I know ow to get on street packing but for what I think this palce costs I expected better 2) Safe in room not operable due to instructions having been worn off or faded to illegibility. 3) No ice or refrigerator. Single Ice machine is on third floor 4) Elevator t button for my floor did not work 5) No coffee maker in room 6) Cheapest breakfast option is $12 per head continental we walked over to Zabar's 7) Got wake up call at about 4 am in morning which i definitely did not order, ( OK it may have been a wrong number by a guest but unlikely 8) No hot water in shower 9) Low shower pressure 10) Noisy staff cleaning other rooms on Sunday 1120 Internet access was available at extra cost None of these were a disaster but they do show an overall lack of attention to detail. I just got back from a stay in Prague and the hotel there did a lot better. If Leona Helmsley came back from the dead and took over this place a lot of staff would be defenestrated.

Reviews.Title: “Solid - well equipped, well located.”
Reviews.Author: Daniel81
Reviews.Content: I have stayed twice at the Excelsior, now, both pre and post-renovations. The hotel has always been nice, located in a heritage building right across the street from Central Park, and also right across the street from the famed Museum of Natural History. Location is definitely one of the prime features of this hotel; not only are the two aforementioned attractions only a minute from the front door, but so is one of the main metro stations. You are also only about a two minute walk from Amsterdam Avenue (a major restaurant/deli hub), and only a five minute walk from famous Broadway (albeit a bit more north than most of the "big" attractions). The hotel itself is very nice; marble and dark-wooded reception area, and the rooms themselves are quite tastefully done. Though not large, they are certainly above average in size for a New York hotel room, and offer a comfy and large bed, a desk and chair, flat-screen TV, and a large modern bathroom. The only downsides of the hotel are the staff, who are a bit stand-offish (though not rude), and the fact that you can't walk to the downtown attractions, though this is a minor issue as a five-to-ten minute ride on the subway will have you at them. I can't really think of any serious drawbacks about the hotel, as it gives you a nice place to stay in the well-to-do Upper West Side, and good access to almost any interesting part of Manhattan. While this isn't a five star hotel, I'd give it 3.5 easily, and possibly even four.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great price, good 3 stars.”
Reviews.Author: JonathanMTL
Reviews.Content: Well earned 3 stars: - Clean. - Well situated. - Nice rooms. - Good price.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location, Good Value, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: mimiwiz
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for 3 nights, three women shared a double-double very comfortably, once we asked for, and promptly received extra towels. Clean, comfortable, and convenient. Lots of good restaurant choices nearby, close to museum and Cenral Park. We felt safe, at any hour, and walked the neighborhood, experienced a good atmosphere and New York Upper West Side feel. Staff was courteous, not overly friendly or helpful. Room was adequate, especially since time in NY is spent exploring the city. Very close to subway station, easy to hail a cab, and would stay again. Free concert in Central Park was fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “awesome location”
Reviews.Author: novicetraveler64
Reviews.Content: This was our first overnite stay in the city. Tring to pick a hotel was overwhelming but based on the reviews and the location of this hotel I booked it. We were so happy with our selection! The hotel was more than what we expected. Our room was bigger than some Manhattan apartments and quite quiet as well. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom size was just right. The staff was friendly and having the subway station so close made travel very easy. An unexpected bonus was a farmers market close by on Sunday that provided us with some tasty treats for the train ride home! We will definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel away in less crowded, nice area of town”
Reviews.Author: SF94597
Reviews.Content: Selected hotel as was only in New York one night & had a business function at the Natural History Museum which is just across the street so met my needs for location. I like the upper west side & just steps away from Central Park. Less street noise than other places I've stayed in New York due to location. Room was small, but clean. While less street noise, definitely heard my hotel neighbors coming in later than I did. The charm of the hotel is it is a boutique - older building, not a chain, less traveled/busy location. In my room, the windows didn't completely shut as the older building/windows were a bit off-kilter. While this was fine in June, wonder if ok other times of the year. Staff was responsive to my questions. All in all -- hotel worked for me & could be good choice if ok with being in an older building & desiring a location where you aren't hearing the constant honking of New York taxis & impersonalization of large chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “An easy base to explore New York from!”
Reviews.Author: EnigmaticBlonde
Reviews.Content: I seem to say this an awful lot in my reviews, but it's a clean and simple hotel. I suppose it's because for this sort of holiday, it's simply somewhere to wash and get our heads down. The hotel was clean and well presented, but I have to say the sound proofing in the rooms was pretty poor! We were too exhausted to care, but I can imagine if you're a light sleeper, it would drive you insane! The bathroom was clean with ample towels being provided. We didn't eat in the hotel, we eat out every night - there is always somewere within walking distance. You can walk from here to the centre of NY, or there is a subway stop at the bottom of the road, which is a brilliant way to travel! Central park is literally at the end of the street and the Planitarium and Natural History Museum are oth within spitting distance. Finally go at Christmas like we did - It's magical!! Plan to go back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place, if you don't mind bedbugs.”
Reviews.Author: WaldoJ
Reviews.Content: I got a great rate ($180/night) to stay here for two nights midweek, selecting it based on TripAdvisor reviews. There was a lot about it that I liked. The location is beautiful, the facilities are in pretty good shape, the staff was perfectly friendly (not obsequious, not surly), and the lobby is really pretty nice (not that it matters). My room had the view only of the ventilation shaft in the middle of the building, but that was made up for by the room itself. Being Manhattan, I expected a closet-sized room. Au contrare. First there was a sitting room, with a spacious closet, desk, chair, couch, coffee table, and large flat-screen TV. Then, separated by French doors, was the bedroom. Not with the king bed that I'd reserved, but instead a pair of twins. (Disheartening, since I'm 6'4".) There was also a dresser, two chairs, and a small table between them. Finally, the bathroom, of a perfectly normal size, with a full bathtub, toilet, and a somewhat oversized sink, somewhat larger than the bathroom than the one in my own ranch-style house at home. (Somebody else complained that there was only room to stand up in the bathroom. So what? What is it that you're looking to do in there?) The beds turned out to be twin longs, and I slept comfortably. In all, I was surprised and pleased with the decor, size, and comfort of my room. The bad news was the discovery of a bedbug nymph in the bathroom shortly after my arrival. I once had bedbugs at home, some years ago, so the little guy immediately looked familiar. Trapping it under a glass, I compared it to photos from entomology websites, and the reddish-brown insect was a dead match for an immature bedbug. I saw no adults, never woke to find myself being bitten, and several hours far checking out, I have none of the telltale welts. I was going to quietly inform the hotel staff of this discovery upon my checkout, but the desk was staffed by a lone man who was barely awake, and I could not manage to deliver this news to him. No doubt, anyhow, they are aware. Since I emerged unscathed, I actually recommend this place, oddly.

Reviews.Title: “Best NYC Stay Ever!”
Reviews.Author: mecla
Reviews.Content: Great location, great service, exceptional room, fantastic value for dollar ... we are definitely going back ... M.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: crusader707
Reviews.Content: How come they rate this hotel as a 4 star ? I have stayed in 10 times better rooms in hotels that are rated 3 on the star ratings... Nothing wrong with the rooms, but they were far too small, the bathroom was just sufficient enough for one person to stand. The room was large enough just to fit the queen bed. You don't have a place to keep your baggage. The closet that they provide, can't even fit you... The only good part for this hotel was its location. Located in front of the museum and close to subway. Don't ever try to go for the continental breakfast that they offer for 12 bucks... You would hardly get anything over there, though they advertise a lot many stuffs.. They simply had milk, cereal, bread kept along with a couple of toasters, ultra-cold boiled eggs(that too on request), and some bagels. If you think about the food, you won't even want to pay more than 5 bucks for the same.. Won't recommend it to any traveller based upon the ratings that they show.. There were far better hotels in the area for similar or lower price...

Reviews.Title: “Very good value, and location”
Reviews.Author: easygoer78006
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights. Location across from Museum was good. Quiet at night. Close to subway connection. Parking available at Museum. Room was very nice - it wasn't the Plaza, but we didn't pay for the Plaza. When I go back, this is a place I will probably stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great location”
Reviews.Author: bloogedy
Reviews.Content: This hotel met our needs for a reasonable price for a family getaway to be tourists in NYC and hit the Natural History Museum and Metropolitan Museum of Art. Fabulous location for those goals. Small lobby with old fashioned, stately decor. Clean, comfortable traditional room with silky duvet covers on beds, generously sized bathroom, tub and sink. We paid ten extra dollars to have "museum view" and it was worth it, very quiet up there on 14th floor and truly beautiful view. One half block from Central Park. Although there was no coffee maker in the room, nor coffee available in the lobby, there was a Starbucks as well as a World Coffee shop both within two blocks. There was some type of $12 breakfast available on the second floor, but we had no intention of checking this out . Anyone planning to drive into town, take note-- that the hotel has arrangement with the Natural HIstory garage for $26/24 hours, and Central Parking on 83rd St for $40/24/hrs. Was originally told incorrect information when making reservation, however the hotel credited us the difference in our parking bill for one day, then we moved the car. Even if the two garages were same price, Nat Hist lot would be much better, awesome staff and right across the street from hote,. Hotel staff seemed a little conflicted about working with people, and divulged information grudgingly. However, the most frosty of these was also the best-informed. Not sure if I want to go back--a little unnecessarily unpleasant, but with some great things to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better than this for the money, bad staff on front desk”
Reviews.Author: delta34
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and upon arrival we were greeted by a very frosty man on reception, our room was small enough, no upgrade for us. The internet was not working while we were there and the staff were mostly uninterested in our stay. The lobby is in need of care and its a pity as this could be a great feature of the hotel. The rooms are also noisy with banging pipes at night. The worst part is that the hotel is under renovation, most of the floors are torn up with pieces of wood ,empty boxes and wires hanging from the walls,.. its not the most plesant of sights. We travel quite allot and have stayed in other NY hotels, overall if your looking for a warm reception you wont find it here, its only ok.... i think you could do better.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: therockandsister
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last week of March for two nights. We were unexpectedly given a free upgrade when we checked in, so we had a suite. It was large enough to accommodate a full size crib (or almost full size), which the hotel provided free of charge. The bedroom had 2 double beds, tv, nightstand, and chair; the living area had a regular size couch, chair, coffee table, tv, and a desk. Everything was very clean, although there was a wet spot by the heater in the bedroom. The hotel has refrigerators available for $10 a night, although we did not use that option. Our view was beautiful--looking out over the planetarium and part of Central Park. There were plenty of restaurants and small stores close by, as was the subway. The location was perfect--it feels like you are just part of a neighborhood, but you are across the street from the Natural History museum, 1 block from Central Park, and a 5 minute walk to the Metropolitan Museum of Art (and just a few more minutes to many other hotels on 5th Avenue). It was so nice to be away from the crazy crowds down in Midtown. We felt very safe. One minor drawback was that when guests in adjoining rooms were using the water in the bathroom (shower/bath), the pipes were pretty loud. And you have to pay for the internet, which is pretty silly these days. But overall, it was a great hotel for our family and for our vacation and we would recommend to others, especially those traveling with children--and we would definitely reserve a suite next time so that we had plenty of room.

Reviews.Title: “don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: hanagirl
Reviews.Content: My travel agent recommended this hotel, so I did not bother to read the reviews before I came. That was a mistake. All the recent reviews are negative and it's easy to see why. While my room is lovely, comfortable and quiet, and the location is great, within walking distance to the Metropolitan Museum across the Park, it seemed ridiculous to find myself walking down Columbus avenue at 6AM to find a cup of tea at a Starbucks, when I was paying nearly $300/ night for my lovely room. There is not even one of those coffee machines like any cheap motel would have in the room, much less room service. I had to carry my bags myself, and the front desk clerk was eating a sandwich as I checked in. The staff is slovenly, but some are at least friendly. They were no help with directions, or with a recommendation for a place to get a manicure, however. I was told breakfast was included, but it was not. The lobby is shabby and run down. I moved after one night. If you have $300/ night for a hotel, you can do much better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: coraidaniel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during St Paddys week. We were a little wary due to mixed reviews but received great service from the second our cab pulled up with a warm welcome from the doorman until we left this morning. Room was nicely appointed, updated vintage, very cute and very clean. Great location with Central Park 1/2 block away and lots of restaurants within walking distance. Can't wait to see it after renovations are completed. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: arbetta
Reviews.Content: We loved this Hotel. It was recommended to us and it was wonderful. We loved how convenient it was to the subway and Central Park. Being 3 ladies alone in NYC we felt very safe. We often left early in the am and returned very late around midnight and still felt very safe. The rooms weren't spectacular, but were clean and bright. Everyone was pleasant and helpful. Will come again....

Reviews.Title: “Good - and not so.”
Reviews.Author: Melston
Reviews.Content: First the good: They are updating and with many rooms done you should insist on a newly remodeled one. Our 'double double' turned out to be a freshly redone mini-suite on the very quiet 12th floor. There was ample hot water, nice toiletries and fluffy robes. The bedding was posh, plenty of closet space, and the room was really BIG for a city hotel room. The doormen were polite and prompt to be helpful. The not so good: Internet costs $10.00 a night. Access to a lobby computer to print boarding passes was $4.00 (didn't use it when I found that out) Continental breakfast in their breakfast room will set you back $12.00 a person (nice coffee shop catter-corner across the park opens @6am, and is 1/2 the price) No fridge. The desk staff ran warm-and-cold. The concierge was only in from about 9am to 3pm - never when we were at the hotel and needed something. We had to dodge workmen on walpapering the halls on our floor the last day we were there - then they started up @ 8 AM. Other Things to know: These 'double beds' are not for two people unless it is two small kids, or you are VERY friendly. They seem a lot narrower than standard doubles. Our beds were very soft, and my daughter had a hard time sleeping on them - ending up on the floor wrapped in the comforter. The Hotel is very close to the Subway, Cabs are easily found, and the 79 crosstown bus stops just across the street. We walked around the neighborhood pretty late at night, and it felt safe - but very quiet - lots of families and dogs running around. Conclusion: If you get a good deal, love Central Park and the museums, don't require a lot of help finding things to do, like quiet and comfortable places to crash - this might be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel In New York...No Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Gemski1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March 2009 for 5 days. The hotel was beautiful and our room was upgraded to a mini suite for free! The hotel was extremely clean, and the room was very well equipped. We received a free newspaper each morning and the ice bags for the ice machine were replaced daily. The location was great and the subway was at the end of the road. The only thing was that there wasn't much going on in the hotel and it could have done with having a bar. It was for this reason that the atmosphere was a little flat but who cares, go outside, New York is on the door step! Great place to put your head down!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Customer Service at Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: lily001NewJersey
Reviews.Content: We have a child graduating from Columbia in May 2010 and so we were interested in booking rooms at the Excelsior Hotel solely because of its proximity to the school. (Their rooms pictured on their website look tired and dated.) Two reservations were made and I asked for an email confirming our reservations. Three days later no confirming email had been sent so I called reservations back concerned that our reservations had not been processed. Reservations could not pull up either reservation, but transferred us to the front desk. The woman at the front desk was able to retrieve both reservations, but her attitude and lack of professionalism did not engender confidence so I cancelled the reservations and asked that I be sent an email indicating that the reservations had been cancelled (a credit card had been used to guarantee the reservations). I was told that I had to call the reservations department on Monday to make any changes to our reservations. I then asked to be transferred back to reservations at which point the woman at the front desk hung up on me. I then called back, spoke to another woman at the front desk, and asked to speak to a manager, but was told that there were no supervisory personnel at the hotel over the weekend. On Monday I will try to resolve the situation, but, given the fact that management generally sets the tone for any given hotel, I am now concerned about the professionalism and helpfulness I will encounter from the manager of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for NYC”
Reviews.Author: orlando_32
Reviews.Content: The purpose of the trip was to celebrate daughters 18th birthday to NYC. The family party consisted of 4 members (2 adults, 1 - 18 yrs, 1 - 11yrs). The location is great for downtown Manhattan and the subway (tube) is a 5 minute walk. The location is very quite and safe at night. I recommend taking a taxi to go downtown, as the typical taxi fare is $10. Taxi's are easily accessible outside the hotel. The hotel is a great location, and breakfast can be purchased from Lenny's or EJ's (Just ask for directions). EJ's provide cooked breakfast, and expect to pay $20-30 for family of 4. The world famous Lansky's is 5 blocks away (Again ask for directions). The hotel room suite (bedroom + sitting room) was great value. The two negatives were poor air-conditioning and no fridge. I suggest going online (www.goairlinkshuttle.com) to book your transfers from airport to hotel, and don't forget to re-confirm your return journey. I suggest using the open-top sightseeing bus for 2 days to get your bearings. We had a great trip in terms of shopping and eating. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Comfortable Great Prices and Excellent Location in NYC”
Reviews.Author: NewYork2177
Reviews.Content: My BF & I stayed at the Excelsior for 2 nights in January 2010 and we thought it was great. We had a late check in (after 10pm) and still received the room request we had placed. (I did call earlier in the day to confirm our requests: Highfloor, park view). Upon our arrival we were pleased to find a cozy, clean room with everything you could need: a comfortable queen size bed with nice bedding, adequate closet/storage, a clean,well stocked bathroom with hair dryer, an iron & board, desk, tv, phone, night standsand luggage rack.. The view was nice, with views over looking the park & Museum of Natural History. The desk help was ok, slightly above average as far as friendliness and helpfulness. The directions about parking were unclear,as you have to park in the museum parking lot which required you to drive into the "DoNot Enter" gate,so that was confusing and required some inquiry. Additionally the walls were a little thin and you could hear the people in other rooms every oncein a while. Overall for the price we were very pleased and would definitely stay there again. The location was great. We were able to walk to Central park, museums, great restaurants, the theaters, etc. Sure you don't get the huge expanse of a suite at the Marriott or the like but you get all you need and sometimes that's just right!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, quite posh !”
Reviews.Author: stonegirl
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel very nice indeed. Nice room with huge comfy beds, Breakfast was very good too. Staff nice and helful. Not the best location - you have to take a cab to all the touristy places - maybe im just too lazy...... . Could not fault the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Samtoh
Reviews.Content: We are a couple in our mid 30's and we stayed at the Excelsior over the new year 's period (29 Dec-1Jan). We chose this hotel based on the super cheap rate we got from a 3rd party website ($150 per night before tax). We stayed on the 16th floor facing the 81st street. We didn't find it to be too noisy. The room we stayed in has modern decor and not the grandmotherly decor that other reviewers have mentioned. Perhaps we have been given a renovated room? The room came with a queen size bed and a plasma tv. The bathroom though small was super clean and the closet was big enough to store our 2 suitcases. We did not encounter heat problems that some other reviewers have mentioned. The hotel's location can't be beaten. We could see the planetarium from our room and there are many good eateries nearby. The area is also very safe. We walked back to the hotel at 1am on New Year's day. We would stay here again only if 1) the price is right (the hotel would not match the rate we found), and 2) be guranteed a renovated room preferably on a high floor.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Excelsior for making our visit so pleasant.”
Reviews.Author: Kat_Grace75204
Reviews.Content: Great curbside appeal to begin with. Great customer svc, they even upgraded our room to a suite. The rooms were clean, the bathrooms were clean, all was good. I can't figure out what other people are complaining about. Maybe they just love to be negative. But this hotel was charming in a great location. A Starbucks is just across the street. Also Ray's pizza is just down the road! Love that Rays. The bartender was great too!!! The subway is just down the road and there were many cabs in the area. Overall I give this hotel a 10 best rating and will most definitely stay there again!!! Thanks for making our stay so pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice rooms, great location, staff was friendly and helpful.”
Reviews.Author: gabewantsmore
Reviews.Content: We would definitely stay here again. Rooms were spacious, clean, and comfortable and the staff was friendly and helpful. Can't beat the location: close to the subway and Central Park. Upper West Side neighborhood is nice, quiet, and has a plethora of great neighborhood restaurants!

Reviews.Title: “There are better choices in the area”
Reviews.Author: WarmthSeeker
Reviews.Content: The best thing the Excelsior has going for it is its location. Aside from that, my disappointments include: No way to get the temperature in the room right - either too hot or too cold. Windows flimsy - could see mini-blinds moving when the wind blew. Tiny bathroom used for smoke break just before our arrival . Though we were given fresh towels, the smell lingered. Breakfast offered no a la carte option - it's $12 even for for a single bowl of cereal. Concierge unresponsive and rarely on duty. Have to pay extra to be connected to the wireless internet service. Overall, it's only an adequate place to stay - nothing special, and there are much better choices for a similar price in the area - like the Beacon and the Lucerne.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good this time”
Reviews.Author: gerryfs
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd visit to the Excelsior always at the New Years holiday. Usually our stay is good but this time our room was horrible. The heat was on full blast with no controls - in the middle of the winter we had to keep the windows (facing 81st street) open all night just to keep from roasting. Every time the heat came up it sounded like someone was banging on the pipes with a ball peen hammer. And as you can imagine - New years eve on 81st street is NOT quiet. No curtains on the windows, the airconditioner- was like a hole in the wall - noise and wind coming thru - Definitely has put me off returning to this hotel ever again.

Reviews.Title: “My wife who is both thrifty and hard to please, loved it.”
Reviews.Author: aspiringtraveller
Reviews.Content: The hotel comfortable, the lobby and breakfast room charming, and the location, with easy access to Natural History Museum, Central Park and the Met and Museum Mile on the other side of the park, let alone numerous shops and restaurants on Amsterdam and Columbus avenues nearby (and one Michelin listed restaurant attached to the lobby) marvelous. The staff were all courteous and helpful. We have stayed there twice, and this review covers both stays, a year apart. The beds, rooms and bathrooms were of at least adequate size. Understand this is not a luxury hotel. There is no room service nor gym, pool etc. Main caution is that rooms facing 81st street have a great view, but also more traffic noise than the others, so if traffic noise likely to bother you seek rooms without the view or bring earplugs! It did not bother me but my wife was reluctant to take the room with the view. Minor irritations include the fact ice machines are not on every floor, no prints nor paintings on the walls of the rooms, but this is trivial. The place is far superior to others we have stayed at in same area at about the same or higher prices.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better in NYC; more like a 3 star”
Reviews.Author: HilGray
Reviews.Content: We visited New York with our two children in their 20's for our son's 21st birthday celebration. Overall the Excelsior is OK but the rooms we stayed in (902 and 906) were very dated. We had two single beds in each room and they were probably the smallest beds that we had slept in in New York and the bedspreads were like something your granny would have on her bed! On each bed there was just a sheet and the granny's bedspread with just one blanket in the cupboard. I guess if we had needed another blanket then we could have got one, but for New York in December a sheet and thin bedspread is really not adequate. The heating in the rooms was a frankly nightmare; either far too hot, too cold or too noisy. it was really impossible to get the temperature right. The windows were very drafty. The bathrooms however were spotlessly clean, but the bath tub did look quite small - not really big enough to lie down in although none of us tried. The point is that any hotel you stay in in NYC is just to sleep in and for the price we paid for this hotel was a good base, but we have stayed in much better 4 star hotels in NYC - The Waldorf, Sheraton Towers, Barclay Intercontinental - which were much plusher with much better public areas, better bedrooms, much better beds and closer to the action. The location is fine being just a block from Central Park and the nearest subway station (81st Street) was on the corner, so if you have bought an unlimited 7 day Metrocard for $27 you will get your money's worth. There were lots of good eateries in Amsterdam Avenue and good places for early morning coffee and muffins a short walking distance from the hotel, and also breakfast diners. Would I recommend the Excelsior? If you are on a budget it is cheaper than the 4 Star hotels nearer the action but if we had the choice we would not book there again. It was perfectly adequate but not particularly luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Excelsior hotel, NYC”
Reviews.Author: KatyaKatya
Reviews.Content: PERFECT location! Simply the best I could ask for. I know for a cheaper price I could have taken another hotel in the area, 3 stars probably, but I really felt pampered in the Excelsior (maybe that's because I stayed in a mini-suite). It actually felt to me like 5 stars. and again, what best was the location! I booked it right before the trip, last minute (via lastminutetravel, on line). The hotel has a really good gym, with good opening hours to it. Food was ok, nothing special to be honest. Overall, I guess you can figure it out by now, I recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Did I stay in the same hotel as these recent reviewers?”
Reviews.Author: WordGirl1968
Reviews.Content: I found the Excelsior to be an excellent value given the location. My room was perfectly clean (my top priority), quiet, and spacious. Given that I paid less than $300 and was steps from Central Park, I considered it a great deal. The decor is dated, I'll admit, but it was charming. I don't need everything to be brand new and spiffy as long as it's spotless. The service at the front desk leaves a little to be desired, though. They were downright cranky. Also, there was a problem with the elevator that had apparently been ongoing. All told, I'd recommend the Excelsior and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE - DO NOT SPEND YOUR MONEY HERE - YOU WILL BE DISAPPOINTED”
Reviews.Author: r_and_j_california
Reviews.Content: Be warned - if you sort reviews by date, recent reviews are consistently bad. -Very run down furnishings, worn and stained carpet. -Heating system old and not working properly, and when we called to get it fixed they said no one is available until 9 am, so we froze all night. -Door knob fell off bathroom door -Door to room does not fit frame, light shines through all night -Shower does not drain properly -Staff was unfriendly and unhelpful -Only one elevator was working, apparently this has been the case for over a month, you will wait for five minutes and then the elevator will be full -Hallway consistently smelled of smoke -Concierge is only interested in selling broadway tix, if you need information on anything else you will feel like you are bothering them

Reviews.Title: “Do not spend your money to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: nycfan85
Reviews.Content: We were quite dissatisfied with the quality of the room furnishings, window coverings and bathroom size. The hotel pipes were noisy, heating system inadequate, bathtub drain clogged, and only one tiny elevator was working. The staff didn't seem to care that there were guests staying at the hotel. When complaints were made to the management, they were met with comments which felt like ethnic slurs.

Reviews.Title: “A Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: indigobay
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Excelsior Hotel near Central Park in Manhattan on many occasions. Even though the rooms are small, they were always well kept and clean. This was not the case on our last visit. Here is a list of the problems we found: 1. The faucet in the bathroom sink was broken. 2. The shower head in the shower was broken. 3. The tub in the bathroom hardly drained at all. 4. The two times we turned on the heat, there was none. Only cold air came from the heat vent, sometimes for as long as 20 minutes. It required two different calls to the front desk to resolve the problem, and the explanation that the boiler was in an off cycle, was not credible. 5. The bed for the room was listed as a "queen size", but was in fact only a full size mattress. 6. One of the pieces of furniture had visibly torn fabric, at least a foot long 7. The carpeting was old and stained. 8. The television was a small, maybe 17 inch crt screen, not a flat screen, and the reception, even though it was cable, was terrible. I am not sure what they hope to accomplish by offering such a room, but if the rest of the hotel has deteriorated to this extent, then this hotel is hardly worth the stars or the prices that it charges. This is nothing but a careless attempt to increase profits at the expense of it guests.

Reviews.Title: “What a shame this well-located hotel is run-down and dimly lit, with grumpy staff to boot.”
Reviews.Author: viaggio1965
Reviews.Content: Staying four nights at the Excelsior could have been so ideal. But there were endless waits for crowded elevators (one was broken the entire stay), whole $450 rooms with a single overhead light, door handles falling off interior doors, un-vacuumed hallways where new carpet had been laid, and above all an unwelcoming staff (the housekeeping excepted). This place is ripe for a full makeover!

Reviews.Title: “Good marathon hotel - skip it if you're in town for something else”
Reviews.Author: Mccoyote
Reviews.Content: So like the title says, I was there to run the ING New York City Marathon and I picked this hotel for 2 reasons: the price and it's proximity to the finish line. Disliking Times Square I did not want to stay there. Sure it's close to the start line buses (if you're assigned to one) in the morning but thats about it. Moving on to the hotel: the lobby is small with beautiful woodwork but the furniture outdated and there is not enough room to sit. Only 2 couches and 2 chairs. Our room was small but very clean and well kept with a nice view. I really liked the bathroom with it's country charm. The beds are super comfy - important when you're running a marathon- and the blankets are cuddly. Here my dislikes: it was so small that the light from the hallway peered from under the door at night : it was like sleeping with a nightlight on! And since the door is right next to the bed, you hear all the others doors opening and closing. Overall, for that price, you can find a better hotel in NYC. I'm not saying it's terrible, I'm just saying there's better out there. If you're running the marathon, this hotel is only ten blocks from the finish line and you will appreciate getting to your room relatively quickly after the chaos of the finish line. Hotel prices really climb during marathon weekend and I appreciated the under 300$ price tag. Happy running! See you at the finish line!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location”
Reviews.Author: boyer_marty
Reviews.Content: We stayed in early October, a great time of year with our two young boys at the Excelsior. The reviews on this site are amazingly accurate. The decor was a bit dated, but the room was large. The people were nice. They upgraded us to a suite, but it lacked a great view. To be honest, we were simply thankful for the upgrade. After we had been traveling with our 7 and 4 year old, the space was welcome. The convenience of the location is fantastic, subway, coffee shops and food are all very walkable.

Reviews.Title: “A short stay”
Reviews.Author: cazoohc
Reviews.Content: The staff were helpful but not overly friendly. The room was a large enough, we were situated in a room without a good view, at least there was a nice big window! The room didn't have a mini bar or fridge which was a bit annoying as we wanted to keep our water cool in the heat. The location was great, central enough to get to anywhere in the city using the subway or walk to the lovely Central Park or The Natural History Museum. Whatever you do don't have breakfast at the hotel, it's a rip off and you can find a Starbucks and so many cafes just a few blocks away around Amsterdam Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Head Central”
Reviews.Author: Morgan42206
Reviews.Content: The front desk employees are desperately in need of training in gratiously greeting their guests and providing pleasant costumer service during their stay. The housekeeping staff and the valet were the complete opposites.....helpful and most accommodating. The rooms were incredibly heavy with bedroom odor...ie...bed head!! I had to spray perfume on my pillow to block out the odor. YUCK!! I asked for new pillows at the front desk and was abruptly told I could find extras in the closet. Guess what...no pillows in the closet and no pillow replacements were provided after informing the front desk that there were no pillows in the closet. The bathtub was half full of water by the time I finished my shower. YUCK again!! And, the hairdryer is a joke! It died after a minute...I suggest you take your own! It was so hot in the room that it was ridiculous...and this is November! A couple in the elevator with us said they thought they were in a steam bath all night and no satifation with the front desk in remedying the situation. Heads up!! Look further for lodging! You won't regret it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jmn026
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights and enjoyed our stay. The hotel was beautiful and the staff friendly and helpful. Even though we liked our stay, I would recommend avioding room 304. The room was spacious and clean BUT had no view as it was blocked by awnings above and below the windows. It also had a window unit that would not be very helpful in the heat of the summer. The bathroom was clean and had all the amenities that you need however it was very hot and became unbearable after a shower. The location was perfect. It is across the street from the Museum of Natural History (3 minute walk), less than a 5 minute walk to Central Park. Starbucks is around the corner but we enjoyed World Coffee each morning. 10 minutes away you have tons of resturants on Amsterdam Ave. to choose from. Time Square is about a $10 cab ride and there is a Metro station at the end of the block. I loved the neighborhood feel and would stay again..

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in New York”
Reviews.Author: syoung1998
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay at the Excelsior Hotel. It was only one block from the subway and from Central Park. The location was great as it was about two miles from the madness and noise of Times Square. The hotel is located in a quiet area just blocks away from great restaurants usually dined at by locals. Also, it was just a few blocks away from the Natural History Museum. We were upgraded to a Suite. It was very nice and probably close to 500 square feet. The room had a comfortable bed, and nice furnishings. It also had a kitchenette which consisted of a toaster oven, sink, microwave and fridge. The room was very clean and updated appropriately. The staff were very friendly with the goal of pleasing their guests. Overall, we would highly recommend this hotel. Simply put, if we were ever to go back to New York, the Excelsior Hotel would be our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “One block from Central Park, three from great bagels - what more could you ask for?”
Reviews.Author: jabberwocky888
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel partly based on the very positive reviews on this site, and they didn't lead me astray! This hotel is in the Upper West Side and is a very residential, leafy area; nothing beats taking an early Sunday morning stroll in Central Park and seeing all the locals as they walk their dogs, jog or cycle round the park. Zabar's deli is only three blocks away, and has a coffee shop attached. The hotel itself was very nice - the staff were friendly and helpful, the rooms clean and the beds the most comfortable hotel beds I've ever slept in. Yes, the location is a bit off the main drag if you want nightlife, but you can easily go downtown on the subway or cab. It is great for the museums though. It was the week before Hallowe'en when I was there, and it was great to see the stoops decorated with pumpkins and skulls. One quibble - the breakfast is a little limited, in that the only food served are bread products (great range though - bagels, rye, doughnuts, rolls) and dry cereal; some pieces of fruit or cartons of yoghurt would have been welcome!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, okay service, okay room”
Reviews.Author: Adam75082
Reviews.Content: The location is good, as it is centered right next to a subway stop and central park. It is on the opposite side of the busier shopping area. The service of the hotel was friendly and okay. Nothing special, but not bad either. Room was fairly small and the 2 beds could not be placed close to each other, if you care about that sort of item. AC worked, and the bathrooms were adequate. There are plenty of restaurants in the area to eat good food.

Reviews.Title: “SCAM RATES! BEWARE!!!”
Reviews.Author: HiltonP
Reviews.Content: We checked their online rates at the hotel's website before calling the hotel's reservations line to make our booking. The phone booking rate was higher than the rate on their website and when we asked if they could offer us the lower rate as reflected on their website, we were told YES. We were specifically told on the phone that while the email confirmation sent to us would reflect a higher rate, we need not worry as the front desk would have a note telling them to honor the lower internet rate. When we checked in, we were told that we would be charged at the higher rate and that we should either "take it or find another hotel" by the reservations manager DAISY and by the general manager IVAN WEINER. We even gave them the name of the reservations agent we spoke to and asked that they verify with her what she represented to us but they said they were not going to do that. We had no choice but to stay on since we are an elderly couple traveling and did not want the hassle of trying to find an alternative hotel and moving our luggage. Incidentally the rate on their website on the day we checked in showed a lower rate and yet they refused to honor it. Dismal, rude service. Scam rates. BEWARE!!

Reviews.Title: “Super location”
Reviews.Author: Penny17
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior Hotel is located across the street from the Museum of Natural History (remember the movie "Night at the Museum?") and a block from Central Park, which made for easy walking through the park to the Metropolitan Museum. Quiet, neighborhood atmosphere. Rooms were a pleasant surprise. Clean, with pretty decorative touches. Comfy beds. Cannot recommend the restaurant. We had a bowl of soup before going to the theater and it looked and tasted like warmed up water with a few veggies tossed in. However, there are loads of nearby restaurants. "Fred's" was my favorite for it's delicious and extremely reasonably priced food.

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: Susans6642
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay at the Excelsior Hotel every time we go to New York and we love it! The rooms are very comfortable and cozy. If you reserve a park view room, you won't be disappointed. On a clear day you literally can see for miles. The front desk staff are always very helpful. The bellhop however, is not. But that is the only downside of staying at this hotel. We were upgraded to a suite last time we stayed. The location is great! The "A and C" trains are just a few steps away and the 1, 2, or 3 trains are just a couple of blocks away. Like I said, we feel like this is our home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: JMSpeaker
Reviews.Content: Nice room next to the park with great views. .

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Traveler00767
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel twice now and have enjoyed each stay. The hotel is within walking distance to Central Park, a subway station and many local restaurants. We love the quaint feel of the hotel and its location in a more residential area of town. Excellent hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this unethical, bait and switch dump”
Reviews.Author: UWSer1
