Reviews.Content: This dump pulled a total bait and switch with me on the phone telling me the rate was one thing (and letting me reserve it at that rate on my credit card!) only to later hike it up 500% and tell me to take it or leave it after I'd made all my other travel arrangements! The hotel manager thought this was perfectly reasonable and offered no apology or anything saying only that he was sure someone would take it at the higher rate so I could take it or be stranded. Avoid this unethical dump at all costs. They're more interested in scamming than service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel if in need of a little refurb”
Reviews.Author: sarahabigailcollier
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel we were met by a very friendly and helpful Bell Captain who took our luggage and took us to the reception desk where he waited for us to check in and then escorted us to our room. There were 2 reception staff on at the time of our check in who were having an arguement about something in front of customers whilst we checked in (not very professional). The hotel is an older hotel and the decore in the reception area is in keeping with this, everything is very clean and nice. The elevators were very quick and a good size. The corridors and the room itself are clean but in needs of a refurbishment. Our room had single beds, haven't experienced that in a while and everything, whilst clean, is old and dated. The safe didn't work in our room and I had to dry my hair in 3 stages as the hairdryer in the bathroom overheats and shuts off. The shower head, which doesn't move, points sideways at a wall so you have to get between it and the wall to have a shower. There were also no Tea or Coffee making facilities in the room and the rooms do not have air con. The area around the hotel is very nice and there are quite a few restaurants in the area to choose from as well as deli and supermarkets to pick stuff up from. There is a subway station at the end of the block. I was glad I got a good price for the hotel and it was probably about worth what I paid for it. I would not have been pleased if I had paid full price for this as even for New York I would have been over charged. That being said, I would stay at this hotel again if I got a good deal on the price as it is perfectly acceptable. If this review is read by the management of the hotel I hope it is taken as advice, not criticism as this is a quite nice hotel it just needs some updating.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean and great location”
Reviews.Author: Gladiators_Football
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for one week with my mother this summer. The Excelsior is an elegant mid-class hotel on the upper west side(second bet area in NYC)! The dark wood interior of the hotel is very elegant and clean. The room was normal sized for NYC and very tidy. Beautiful bathroom with a bath tub. From the windows!! you could see central park even tough we booked a cheaper north city view!!! Front desk staff was very polite and helpful and so was the doorman. There were 2 different concierges whereas one of them (the male one) was really helpful and the other one (female) has been kind of harsh! The location of the hotel is just perfect. Nice area - broadway/restaurant row just 2 blocks away. Adjacent to the Museum of Natural History. A subway station is right next to the hotel - very good connections even at night! Overall a really neat hotel in a great location. I would definitely recommend it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than your average New York Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ngalgano
Reviews.Content: Having read numerous reviews about the standard of Hotels in NY it was with trepidation that we checked into this Hotel. We arrived late but were immediately upgraded to a suite at no charge. The room was large unlike what we were lead to belive was the norm in NYC. Even when we changed rooms after returning to to NYC we were given a standard room which was perfect for our needs even if not as spacious as our inital suite. Hotel room costs in NYC are high compared to the rest of the USA but this hotel was value for money. It is a little away from Downtown but with a subway staion on the corner getting into the centre was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Small, quiet, lovely area. Convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: LC_from_NJ
Reviews.Content: I travelled to NYC to meet up with some friends to walk in the Susan G. Komen Race for the Cure. This hotel was a little gem on a quiet street. I had a view of the small park across the street. The rooms were small, but immaculate. The bathroom was also small but immaculate. The bed was very comfortable. It would have been nice to have had a small coffee maker in the room, but Starbucks was less than a block away on Columbus. This hote was convenient to the subway, museums, Columbus Avenue and Central Park. The staff was friendly and professional. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for something in a beautiful, quiet area after a day in the big city.

Reviews.Title: “The Excelsior - Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Emiline
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights in The Excelsior and loved it. It's quite an old fashioned hotel, and perhaps the rooms could do with updating. However, it had everything we needed, was spotlessly clean and the beds were so comfortable. The location is absolutely perfect - 5 minutes walk to Central Park, 2 minutes walk to the Subway if you want to go Downtown, and it has lots of great restaurants and delis nearby. Only down-side was the Reception staff. There was one young lady in particular who didn't even raise her head when answering my questions. She was rather rude. We didn't try the food at all, as there were so many other places nearby. If I'm every lucky enough to return to New York, I will definitely try to book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great quiet uptown location near Central Park”
Reviews.Author: CanuckGuy9
Reviews.Content: We just spent 4 nights at the hotel on a holiday with 2 small children. The hotel room was small but clean and well organized. The furnishings were a litte dated but the beds were very comfortable. Our room faced north and was very quiet. The check in and out was very easy and making reservations were professionally done over the phone. Although we took cabs during our stay the subway is conveniently located at the end of 81st Street. The bathroom was recently renovated and had brand new fixtures. The water pressure in the shower was amazing and the water very hot. I ordered up extra towels and they were delivered in minutes. There is a no slip mat for kids located in the bathtub hanging on a metal fixture which we thought was odd. Our room had an older small colour TV and I would have preferred a larger flat sceeen TV. I found the air conditioning unit to be very loud but I lowered the fan speed to LOW from HI to alleviate part of the noise, It was leaking on our second day and the hotel fixed it in hours while we out of the room. The hotel is conveniently located one block from Central Park and across from the Museum of Natural History. There is a playground for kids just inside the park on the left hand side that my children really liked. If you walked north from that location there are 2 more playgrounds for children. They are both quite sandy and have water elements. Pack aqua socks/crocs and a swimsuit if you are using these playgrounds in the summer. We took the kids down south through the park to the Boathouse for lunch. There is a great takeout area beside the indoor restaurant with a family friendly eating area with shade and sun. The hotel is a block from Columbus Avenue where there is a Starbucks (N/W corner) that opens at 6AM and many family friendly restaurants. We recommend the Shake Shack (great burgers) 2 blocks south on Columbus and Lenny's (breakfast or lunch) and Cilantro (dinner) 2 blocks to the north at 468 Columbus . We would certainly return and revisit this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “clean, quaint, convenient, great location”
Reviews.Author: txmockbird1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a recommendation of a friend who had previously stayed here. Upon reading other reviews i was prepared for a rude staff .... that never occurred. Front desk help was courteous and prompt and the doormen and housekeeping staff friendly and quick to help. Room was small but for twin beds very comfortable - probably one of the most comfortable hotel beds and pillows i've slept on. Bathroom was well stocked with toiletries and towls ... shower was always hot and great water pressure. Rooms are relatively quiet and the design of the floors makes it so they are not on one long hallway which probably helps keep the noise down. Across from the Museum of Natural History and near central park the location is excellent. Neighborhood restaurants and shops were an quick and easy walk and cabs of course are plentiful. Location is also quieter and a bit removed from the craziness of times square and downtown areas. The restuarant that is attached to the hotel EightyOne was excellent. We stopped in for a drink after an exhausting first day and ended up ordering off the grill menu. The gimlet was excellent and even a simple hamburger was stellar. wouldn't hesitate ot stay here again or recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and staff; tidy rooms”
Reviews.Author: natalie75
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff. Small but very tidy and quiet room. Great location right near the subway, Central Park, and Museum of Natural History.

Reviews.Title: “Read if you are visiting for leisure”
Reviews.Author: Maz010
Reviews.Content: The negative points; Very little on site facilities, the restaurant/bar does not belonging to the Hotel, so you cannot bring drinks up to your room. Staff are ok, but if you are a tourist, don't expect advise unless they can earn from it! I asked about shopping but all they could tell (sell) me about was an excursion costing $40 PP. It is 30/40 blocks away from the real centre On a positive - because it is outside time square it is quite and sleeping is no issue, It is clean with good standards, getting around - it is close to the metro, there is good dining near by and all the museum art galleries are close by. I would stay here again, but only if I had the great price I had

Reviews.Title: “great location, very poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: londonfrog47
Reviews.Content: perfect location in NY, but the hotel in itself is very poor. Dated decor, unfriendly personnel, useless and grumpy concierge, VERY noisy air con, broken telly, no room service, broken down lift, the list goes on. Again, the location is perfect,but I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best location in New York”
Reviews.Author: MrsHep
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I have returned from our trip to New York and the Excelsior was an excellent choice. It really pays to stay in Manhattan! The Hotel is just around the corner from the Subway and also a stones throw from Central Park. We enjoyed morning strolls through the park and ate occasionally at SaraBeth's on the corner of 5th Avenue...around Â£12 each for eggs and great coffee. Breakfast at the Hotel is filling but very bread-based, croissants, toast, cereals, bagels but also some lovely starbucks coffee! $10 each at the hotel. Beds are incredibly comfortable and we had a great nights sleep! I didn't see any attitude from the reception staff and they even upgraded us to a suite as it was our honeymoon. The hotel was very clean, a lovely traditional NY style and internet access in the foyer for Â£2 per half hour to email my family. If you are planning on sightseeing just get a daily Metro pass for $8 each. All the trains are connecting so just get a decent map and you'll have loads of fun travelling around!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for family with young kids”
Reviews.Author: traveldc2007
Reviews.Content: We spent one night and it was great! Hotel location is perfect. Room- 1 br suite - was spacious (bathroom in our 1 BR suite was near front door, unlike shown in pics). I did peek into one of the single queen rooms and it did look small. Hotel had no rooms on reservation line but Expedia.com had rooms at good rates. Tips: Great Playground just inside Central Park @ 81st street (less than a block from the hotel) Street parking was easy to get Saturday night (no pay for meters after 7pm and free on Sunday) Use service elevator if elevators are running slowly (one of the two main elevators was out most of our short stay) it is located to right of the main elevators, just past the mail slot on the wall. great pizza & custom mac & cheese at PINCH & Smac on west side of Columbus ave btw 82nd &83rd parking at Museum of Natural History is $27 for 24 (with hotel discount) - this is a bargain as other garages are $40+ for 24 hours (MONH garage closes at 10pm) - ended up parking on street right in front of the hotel. Children's Museum of Manhattan is just a few blocks away I could not get the hotel wireless service to work with my ipod touch - couldn't get signup to work. Luckily I was able to use an open connection (I'm guessing from the apartment building next door, hopefully they didn't steal any of my info)

Reviews.Title: “Classy get-away”
Reviews.Author: Silasroy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the weekend here as a mini-vacation. Great location, very clean and comfortable room, fabulous restaurant (Eighty-One) on the premises. Enjoyed the old-world charm of the place.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: sciteach07
Reviews.Content: We loved our weekend stay at the Excelsior. It's right next to the Museum of Natural History and Central Park, which made it a great location. There's a subway stop at the end of the block, super easy. They upgraded us to a junior suite for free, which was a great way to start our day. Awesome showerhead in the bathroom!!! My only complaint was that you had to pay for wi-fi. I get free wi-fi at crappy beach hotels in FL, but have to pay for it in a nice hotel on the Upper West Side? What's that about?

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, quiet location, excellent service, brilliant trip”
Reviews.Author: lovenewyorkgirl
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel on the upper west side. the hotel is right next door to the american museum of natural history and just off central park. its a 20 minute walk to midtown but we really enjoyed not being slap bang in the middle of midtown and liked the quieter west side especially walking through the bottom of central park on most days. The metro is right on the street corner so very handy to get further down the island if you dont want to walk. The excelsior is 'quaint' and traditional but clean and very comfortable. nice rooms with plenty of space and nice traditional bathrooms. tip: ask for a room not next to the lifts as they can be a little noisy if you want a lie in! The service is very good and all staff very pleasant. We didnt eat in the hotel (it was a little too upmarket for us) but found lots of lovely places to eat. try the cupcakes at magnolias bakery on 71st street or brooklyn diner on 56th. Wholefoods at columbus circle is great for picnic food to eat in the park but also has a eat in area as well if you just want to grab a quick bite to eat from the massive deli. other tips we recommend is the helicopter ride over manhattan - worth every penny, if that is a little out of budget try theboat trip round the bottom of the island - excellent value for money and a great way to see and find out more about NYC. Go to WTC site - a very moving experience, the wtc tribute centre is definately worth a look when your there too. we 'did' the tv and movie theatre trip, again great value and very entertaining! lots to see in the 3 hours and they show you clips of the films on the tour so you can compare fact from fiction! Hope this helps, off again at easter but unfortunatley cant get into the excelsior this time! lets hope the other one we have booked is just as good!

Reviews.Title: “Great summer vacation”
Reviews.Author: dlaldl4652
Reviews.Content: Great location- near restaurants, museums, subway, parks, and shops! Older hotel with a lot of character---clean and comfortable. The bellman and the cleaning staff were very nice and helpful. No problems--Overall great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Good Service, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: bamafans1
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this site, my expectations for The Excelsior were high. I was not disappointed. We had a great stay. The location is wonderful. It is convenient to the Museum of Natural History, Central Park, and the subway. There are plenty of restaurants close by. H and H Bagels is a must visit for breakfast. Since the hotel is located in a residential area, it gave us a feel for how living in New York really is. There were people walking their dogs and pushing their strollers. We checked in early and we were upgraded to a suite at no extra charge. The staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was well maintained, the air conditioner worked great, and it was very quiet. The hotel will validate parking at the Museum of Natural History for $26 per 24 hours. We had a great experience and we will definitely be staying at The Excelsior on our next trip to NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Book this hotel”
Reviews.Author: bacookhunt
Reviews.Content: I came to NYC as a belated 16th birthday present for my daughter. She brought a friend and so did I. We were thrilled with the Excelsior -- we recieved an unexpected upgrade to a suite, which was beautiful -- it really did look just like the pictures online. The air conditioning worked perfectly ( a particular concern of mine); even the bathroom was beautiful with nice touches like a pedistal sink and supply of Q-tips and cotton balls,hairdryer and phone. . Great location, friendly staff - and we were even able to check in early, which was a bonus. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Blackpool B&b style rooms”
Reviews.Author: ciara99
Reviews.Content: I booked this through the internet as a trip on the last leg of our honeymoon paid four star prices for two nights. The entrance looks the part and the exterior and the bell boy service all look great. The room was small with frilly curtains and bedspread - air conditioning was basic and provided no cool air at all. The bathroom was tiny - it was like a nice cosy dated B&B which is fine if thats what you paid for but we didn't. The satff were less than helpful when I asked for directions to the subway they were less than obliging.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great”
Reviews.Author: Cat241
Reviews.Content: The neighbourhood was lovely but staying in this neighbourhood you would expect better service. The staff were not overly helpful and they charge you for ridiculous things. The room is dated - I can live with that the tv had terrible sound- time to upgrade The nickel and dime you for wireless, telephone calls etc. The nicest lady at the hotel was the housekeeper for the price i would expect more- Stay at the Fitpatrick Grand - different area but the staff make you feel welcome

Reviews.Title: “good hotel - bad internet”
Reviews.Author: seawen
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in order to visit museums and see a bit of NYC with our 2 daughters ages 2 & 8. We were upgraded to a one bedroom suite and it was lovely. The hotel is in a great location, has a nice continental breakfast and is kept up well. The only downside is that the internet is abysmally slow. It is not worth even purchasing it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, More than Expected”
Reviews.Author: romeow
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights June 3rd and 4th in a 1-bedroom suite (unexpected upgrade!). This hotel is beautiful and clean. It has an Old World feel but is not "tired". Bathroom had upgraded fixtures. All 3 rooms were clean and spacious. Bed was very comfortable. Clean robes, to wear while there, were provided at no additional charge. Central Park is a very short distance away. The American Museum of Natural History is directly across the street as well as the Theodore Roosevelt Park. The hotel offers a continental breakfast for an additional $10 which is adequate. Many very nice restaurants on Columbus Ave, which is not even a block away from the hotel. A Starbucks is right on Columbus not even a 5 minute walk. Another few minutes south on Columbus is a wonderful deli, Andy's Deli! A subway and bus stop is not even 2 minutes walk away (turn left as you exit the hotel). On one day I walked from Rockefeller Center to the hotel. This was quite a walk but is very doable if you are in sufficient shape for walking. Many areas to stop and rest along the way. The whole area is lovely. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: California09SanDiego
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased. We had a large room with an additional smaller room. It is in an excellent location - just 1/2 block from Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Xmas”
Reviews.Author: belmer
Reviews.Content: My better half and I have been to the States several times, but this was our first visit to NYC. We read some mixed reviews before going, but overall we were happy with our choice. Sure the room was smaller than you would expect elewhere, but I understand this is common for NYC. Location and price were great. Staff did their job - OK, not overy friendly but we werent in the hotel much anyway.

Reviews.Title: “I will never come back again”
Reviews.Author: ddong004
Reviews.Content: I came to NYC with my daughter for Broadway shows. As I would like to stay in an area which is not far away from Time Square (just within walking distance). When I saw the website mentioned that this hotel is centrally located in NYC to many locations such as Time Square, I chose this hotel because I had a good experience in staying Excelsior Hotel in HK for many times. However, I was quite disappointed about the location. The room is not as good as the standard of 4-star. The TV channels are not clear. Wireless Internet (paid) was slow. This hotel is totally different what I have thought about the Brand of Excelsior. When I complained with the front desk staff, she was really not patient.

Reviews.Title: “Nice area, great price, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: PsychoLogicXen
Reviews.Content: Quick summary: the staff was friendly, the room was clean and quiet, and the hotel is in a great location on the Upper West Side--less than a block from Central Park and a subway station, and across the street from the American Museum of Natural History. My fiance and I are frequent travelers to NYC and had an enjoyable experience at the Excelsior. We went Sat-Mon, Memorial Day weekend and this was out first time staying there. No complaints! We parked across the street in the AMNH's garage (make sure you have the hotel's front desk validate your parking ticket upon checkout for the discounted rate). Our biggest surprise was getting upgraded to a one-bedroom suite from a regular room, at no charge! Room notes: windows on three walls, two heater-A/C units, queen bed, pull-out sofa, two TVs, and a minibar. Like most hotels, their WiFi is available for a fee, but I was able to pick up another wireless access point to use for free (usual in most NYC neighborhoods).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very tiny room and mediocre service”
Reviews.Author: lsjJohannesburg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excelsior on the last 2 days of our trip in the USA. Upn arriving at the hotel we were met by a less than friendly staff member but later discovered he is always a bit grumpy whereas other staff members are extremely helpful. The room was tiny and we could not have stayed any longer in it but this was adequate for the bargain rate we paid for the room. No tea or coffee making facilities. Rooms very old fashioned but bathrooms very clean and have both bath and shower. Hotel overlooks Natural History Museum which was very useful. We also stayed in Midtown and would recommend this hotel if you want to experience the neighbourhood life of New York. Hotels in Midtown are more central to see the main tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, Fantastic location, wonderful holiday!!”
Reviews.Author: Countrygirls_9
Reviews.Content: I cannot rate this hotel highly enough!The staff were absolutely lovely-please ignore reviews to the contrary we had no problems and found them helpful and very pleasant! Our room had an amazing view of the park and skyline-I doubt we will ever find one to equal it in New York City- and the room was comfortable and very clean. Very comfortable beds too. The shower was rather old however but that is my only criticism and I made this point on the comment card I handed in at the hotel. The location of the hotel was perfect, close to bus stops, the subway and cabs go past the hotel all the time. Lots of great areas just walking distance though, including Central Park, Broadway etc. Lots of great places to eat close by too. In short, I would definitely recommend this hotel and hope to go back again soon. A wonderful holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for a first-time NYC visitor”
Reviews.Author: martti_helsinki
Reviews.Content: Our group of 4 adults stayed at the Excelsior for 6 nights in two standard rooms between Apr 27 - May 3, 2009. As this was the first trip to NYC for all of us, the location was excellent: a peaceful residential middle class neighbourhood, with one metro station in less than 100 metres and another with different lines just a few blocks away. Central Park and Museum of Natural History are right across the street, the Guggenheim and a lot more museums across the park. The Excelsior has a certain traditional old world atmosphere that we found quite cosy. The rooms are perhaps a little worn but very clean. The front desk staff were ok and professional, no complaints about that. Don't use the $10 breakfast buffet, it's not worth it. The avenues nearby - Columbus, Amsterdam and Broadway - all offer plenty of breakfast choices, for example Manhattan Diner is excellent. Visit Zabar's at Broadway for delicacy souvenirs. I could easily recommend the Excelsior to anyone who appreciates a peaceful location with excellent connections. Martti Helsinki, Finland

Reviews.Title: “Excelsior exceeded expectations...”
Reviews.Author: Travelfrugalbutwell
Reviews.Content: My teenager daughter and I spent 4/16-4/17/09 in NYC. Our expectations are high because we lived in Manhattan for a few years...this location is excellent within 1 block of central park west and the 81st subway stop, at the Museum of Natural History whose side park is outside the front door. Local restaurants are top notch and affordable. The lobby is small, but beautiful wood and marble. We stayed on the 11th floor, an end unit with a balcony! It was quiet, I slept well both nights-which I never did when I lived there. The bright bathroom's french tile was the perfect mix of floral/white. We had a great rate and then received a room upgrade, so a real deal. The continental breakfast in the second floor library at $10 was a pleasant surprise, starbucks coffee and a latte machine made even my teenager happy. This allowed us to get our day off to a quick start and kept us going until dinner; so we saw 3 colleges and shopped in between. I definitely will return and highly recommend it, but do shop around for discount rates. BEWARE of the minibar, just moving items to store a water bottle left us with charges; the front desk did credit us at check-out based on our word alone. A class act!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place with Kids, Great Rate”
Reviews.Author: dangoldber1
Reviews.Content: What a treat. The rooms are somewhat small, but the price was right ($130 per night through hotels.com + tax) , place was very clean. And if you have kids with you, the location is fabulous. Right across the street of the Museum of Natural History. Just off Central Park Wst, Near the Great Restaurants of Columbus Ave. (There's a Shake shack down the street a few blocks away now). The staff was friendly, the cntinental breakfast included was ample. A great reduced rate for parking at $27 per day at the museum of natural history garage. ( You can''t beat that in the city where the rate is usually around 45-50 bucs a day now). Rooms with 2 beds are single beds, small kids can share, but these are definately "single" size beds and not the full size you might typically expect in a room with 2 beds.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: luvsummers
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed here while attending the opening day game at Yankee Stadium. My husband travels a lot so he is very tolerant of hotel issues. I, on the other hand, easily get hotel cooties. We got a super discount and our room had two twin beds. :( My husband and I are tall people and the beds were a little short, but very comfortable. The size of the room was decent by NY standards. Bathroom was very clean. Room clean. Great location. Tons of places to eat on Columbia and Amsterdam. Subway is close. I find no fault with the Excelsior. I'm hard to please.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Reception Staff Didn't Care That They Couldn't Find Our Booking”
Reviews.Author: Jennifercc
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Excelsior Hotel Manhattan at 5pm local time having flown from Dublin. We presented our accomodation voucher from a reputable Travel Agency to check in. The extremely rude reception staff proceded to ignore us & talk to each other about how they could not find our reservation. As Hotel-Beds had finished for the evening they told us we could have a room for one night & that we'd have to sort it out the next day. First thing the next morning, they put an express check out slip under our door. We proceeded down to reception & made some calls to our Travel Agent. The travel agent tried to phone the reception desk to speak with us however the male Receptionist had no interest in assisting us & hung up the phone on our Travel Agent several times as well as being obnoxiously rude to us in the mean time and making us feel as though we were pestering him or some how trying to blag our way into their hotel. The hotel had no interest in clarifying our situation or confirming that we were in fact booked for the duration of our stay & that we had actually paid in advance. They left it to us to speak with the booking agent & eventually resolve that the reason the hotel stated that we had no reservation was because they'd recorded my firstname as my surname & vice versa & they did not trust that I was the person I stated I was on check in as my name was backwards! - I would definitely not recommend this hotel to anyone who appreciates good service.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: meliketravel
Reviews.Content: This review is a little late, as I stayed at the Excelsior right before Christmas. I booked this hotel at escapes.ca as a packaged vacation and I felt like I got a good deal, since the Excelsior is on the Upper West side. I stayed here for 3 nights. The location was great, as its right across from the Subway (literally 1-2 minute walk). It is also across from the Museum and a 3 minute walk to Central Park. If you like to shop, walk further southwest to find stores such as Sephora and Filene's Basement. There are plenty of restaurants nearby since the restaurant itself doesn't have a restaurant (I believe there's one right beside it though). For breakfast, we went to the cafe diagonally across the street. Within walking distance there's also a pharmacy and a Japanese restaurant that's opened late if you get the late-night munchies. To go to Times Square, I believe its only a 10-minute subway ride. The hotel itself is a little old and the guest rooms are on the small side, but everything was clean. Internet is not free in rooms, which is typical of hotels in Manhattan. I can't remember the hotel rating, but I would give think its close to a Quality Inn/Comfort Inn level. For the location alone, I would return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay -- Will Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: megsmith
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excelsior for a long weekend in mid-march. The group consisted of my husband and me and our friend and her boyfriend. (All in our 20s.) We got a great deal through Travelocity -- two nights plus airfare from Pittsburgh for $519/couple. My husband and I stayed at the Excelsior several years ago and enjoyed our stay. So, I booked without consulting tripadvisor first. But I got worried when I read some of the reviews -- had the place gone to pot in those years? NO! The hotel is a solid 3* joint. It has a lovely lobby and the front desk people were very pleasant, despite the fact that the hotel was full. (The poor bellman seemed a bit overwhelmed, but was very professional nonetheless.) The hotel also has a restaurant which is very well reviewed, but we never got the chance to step in as we were too busy running around the city. I was quite pleased with our room, which I conclude was an upgrade from what we booked. (Our room the first trip, though large for NYC, was not nearly as big.) We had a two-room, I guess it must be called, suite. The bedroom had a queen size bed and the adjoining room had its own television (which I couldn't get to show cable, but I didn't call to see what the deal was either since I didn't care) and a pull-out couch. The linens were of nice quality, as were the toiletries left for us. Though I didn't check, our friends apparently had the same type of room on the other side of our floor. The desk and a few cracked tiles in the bathroom did show some limited signs of wear -- but certainly not unattractive. I think the only reason I even noticed was because of some of the reviews I'd read on this website. Oh, and for the reviewer complaining about the street noise -- are you kidding me?! It's New York! While I didn't notice ANY street noise at the Excelsior, I certainly expect some when I have a street-facing room in NYC! The hotel is in a great location. (I personally prefer to stay out of midtown b/c it's just not my scene.) There is a subway station at the end of the block, as is Central Park. The natural history museum is right across the street. We found things we want to do well within walking distance. (For example, we walked from Rockefeller Center through the Park to the hotel, which a stop at the Shake Shack to be a fun afternoon activity. If you stay at this hotel, you must stop at the Shake Shack!) All in all, the four of us were perfectly pleased by our stay. (It would have been a good deal even at much higher price!) As it turned out, I stayed an extra night in the City for business, transferring to the Benjamin (Lex at 50th) to be closer to my firm's NYC office since it was St. Pat's and I knew the City would be a mess. While the Benjamin was a bit nicer, I wouldn't pick it over the Excelsior except for the reason that brought me there in the first place. Also -- for your reference (since I find these things to be important in evaluating a review) -- I travel reasonably frequently for business (staying in Hyatts and Omnis generally) and have stayed in NYC many times (for pleasure) at hotels such as the Hyatt at Grand Central, the Millennium Hilton, Le Parker Meridien, and the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel, but beware of the rude and menacing maintenance guy”
Reviews.Author: cristynewyork
Reviews.Content: We we very well impressed by the location and good quality of the hotel, good and confortable room, good toilette and good service upon arrival, all went well until we had to call maintenance in order to take our things out of the safe becoiuse it run out of batteries. The service was slow, though we were in a hurry, and had to call three times, then a big guy arrived, bad tempered, rude and aggresive, after trying to explain the problem finally menacing with what he "kept in his pocket" someone with this kind of qualities is a big problem which should be solved in any place who deals with custumers specially in a hotel of this quality.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Excellent Location, Excellent Staff, Excellent Trip”
Reviews.Author: ILoveNYC1234
Reviews.Content: Location was brilliant - Right opposite central park, subway leading into city centre on the corner of the street and plenty of different restaurants in the area. Room was a good size and clean - had everything we needed. The staff were really friendly and helpful - even lent us an umbrella when it was raining. Overall great value for money in a great location! Would definately stay again!

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel! Great location.”
Reviews.Author: AmyRx
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through an Orbitz package special. It was chosen mainly for price and location. What a great stay we had! It was in a perfect location for going to museums, Central Park, and catching transit to other areas. There are lots of places to eat right around the hotel - even with a young child in tow. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a Jr. Suite which made traveling with a 3-year-old so much better/easier - we were able to put him to bed in one room and close the door so we did not disturb him with lights or television. Unlike other reviewers, we found this hotel to be very quiet - and it was completely booked for at least one of the nights we stayed. We did, however, have the issue with the heating vents clattering quite loudly and waking us up. The biggest issue with the 3-year-old, was the minibar tray left out in the open (and at the perfect eye level for someone 3 feet tall!). Upon our request, however, the hotel agreed to disconnect this tray and remove it (a bit reluctantly, but still they did). We were charged for all items on our checkout bill, but a quick trip to the front desk rectified that with no issues. All of our employee contact was very good - we found everyone to be very friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and will definitely consider it for future Manhattan stays.

Reviews.Title: “Just Great, I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: ML316
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the rate: 119 a night. It must be the financial crisis. Lobby, breakfast room, elevators, all lovely. We got upgraded to a suite, which was a wow.. huge, with comfortable furniture, TV's in both lr and br. Terrific toiletries (including a toothbrush and paste), comfy terry cloth bathrobes. Great neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly wonderful-will be back”
Reviews.Author: mcortez72572
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a pleasant surprise after all the so-so reviews I read here. The front desk was courteous, not overfriendly. I appreciate no time wasting personally. Who needs chit chat? The hotel had CHARACTER and that's why we traveled to NYC. I loved the wood detailing, chandeliers and all the little details that make it MEMORABLE. The location was PERFECT and the area is beautiful. Go to Artie's Deli on 79th and Broadway. GREAT FOOD! The beds were clean and comfortable. The bathroom was SPOTLESS and very pretty. Be careful with the HOT water..it gets STEAMING. This was my favorite part of the hotel..the spectacular shower. My ONLY complaint would be that the windows/room walls are a little on the thin side. But, maybe on a higher floor this is not the case(windows).

Reviews.Title: “Good location ...”
Reviews.Author: aslanman
Reviews.Content: ... 5 minute cab ride from Times Square, 70 yards from Central Park. First impressions good with a nice Reception area. Staff are ok! The rooms are clean and tidy although our room was small and the decor is very dated. We found the manager of the hotel bar/restaurant to be a very pushy and real pain which resulted in us avoiding the bar/restaurant at all costs. We can strongly recommend EJ's diner on Amsterdam Avenue for an excellent breakfast/brunch and beside that is a great Irish bar "St James' Gate" with a really friendly manager/owner, Paul!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Again”
Reviews.Author: Kathstew23
Reviews.Content: We arrived a little earlier than the check in time but had no problem checking in. This time we were on the 6th floor with a view of the museum and park. The room was clean and tidy. The staff were helpful when we needed them. There are great places to eat nearby Good enough to eat up near 84th street on Amsterdam is highly recommended as is Zabars on Broadway if you want to pick up snacks and drinks for the room. There is a good wine store just around the corner and a general store just up from Unos. Take the time to walk in New York we found even more places to see this this time and had remembered to pack our walking boots which helped. It did not get above freezing the entire time we were there, so wrap up warm and take a good thick moisturiser as your face really takes a battering. The Four Seasons have a special 3 course meal deal for $59.00 each if you fancy something special, I would avoid the Bateaux New York as it was over priced, cold, poor service, inferior food and the company could not care less about it as they already have your money. The entertainment was second rate and they did not even bother to tell you what you were seeing as you were cruising along. I had been on the Bataeux a couple of years ago and it was fantastic which is why I booked it for my 40th birthday at a cost of $300.00 + $135.00 for drinks on the night . There is an excellent French Bistro called Jules at 65 Marks place in the East Village which has live music and good food at very reasonable prices. Avoid Normas at Le Parker Merdian as it cost $90.00 for a basic breakfast of Eggs Benidict, 2 glasses of orange juice and two coffees. I will always recommend the Excelsior for location and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great service and cant wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: thesloaneranger
Reviews.Content: ive just returned from a trip to nyc and had a fabulous time! im from scotland, and had never been to the states before so wasnt quite sure what to expect - but it was a blast from start to finish! :D i arrived at the hotel around 12.30 and although check in time wasnt until 2pm according to the paperwork i had, the gentleman at reception said this was no problem, and would we like either a quiet room, or a room with a view :D it was nice to have the option and we selected the view - as we were on the 9th floor it was pretty quiet anyway so a win-win situation! :D i imagine during the high season the early check in and room choice will not be available, but as we were there during the quieter time of year it was very much appreciated. the room we had (902) was a twin room. the beds were roomy, VERY comfortable and had loads of pillows, so no sore neck! lol! there was also a desk/dressing table, tv with a good selection of channels, hair drier, iron and walk in wardrobe/closet. there was also a well stocked mini bar and on top of that was a selection of chocolate/pringles/1st aid kit etc. all these however are on pressure pads, which if the item is off its pad for more than 20secs, is automatically added to your room bill. we accidently knocked the pringles over and you woulda thought a grenade was about to go off the way we chased after it to return it to its rightful place! lol! the en-suite bathroom was very clean and had soft towels, nice complementary toiletries and also a sewing kit. if you wish to avoid the mini bar (note: no prices are stated for these items) there are vending machines on some floors - these are listed on the back of your room card holder. you can buy juice/soda or snacks, chocolate, biscuits etc. these vending machines also carry a few essentials such as toothbrush and tampons which is handy, esp if you arrive late and dont fancy venturing out for some toothpaste! lol! the drinks from the machines are $2 and the foodstuffs vary between $1 and $2 so not expensive compared to some other hotel vending machines ive seen in the past. as we were staying on a room-only basis i cant comment on the in-house food. there is a sort of flashy jazz bar/restaurant that can be accessed from reception. however, this is not attached to the hotel so you cannot take drinks from there to your room. we never bothered to see if there was another bar in the hotel as despite the prices, we just loved the atmosphere at the jazz bar :D the staff in there were also amazing people to chat to, and didnt mind if you nursed your $10 beer a little longer than usual to make it last! lol! outside the hotel, you have a subway approx 30secs walk east, as well as central park, museum and planetarium. head west to columbus ave and you have a bar/grill, newstand, bagel/grocer shop and off-sales/liquor store. take the 2min stroll west along w 81st street after columbus and you will find amsterdam ave, which has loads of restaurants/bars/shops etc. ovbiously being further uptown, there isint a huge amount to do in the immediate area of the hotel, but by taking 2mins to walk a block or two and there is plenty places to eat and drink, and with the subway being at the end of the street, the city is yours for the taking! :D at the end of our stay, check out time was 12. as we werent flying til the evening and didnt fancy lugging our bags around the city we asked if there was some kind of place we could dump our stuff. we were told the hotel had a strong room where our bags could be left free of charge and we were given tickets for them so no-one else could accidently take the wrong ones. this was great as it allowed us to have a few precious extra hours enjoying the city, safe in the knowledge that our stuff was safe. the doorman, bellboy, housekeeping and front desk staff are all very friendly at the excelsior and nothing was too much trouble. im not sure what happened to previous posters, but our experience of the staff here was a good one - either the hotel have improved things or we were just lucky, im not sure. but either way ive no complaints about the excelsior hotel :D

Reviews.Title: “Great Location But Some Problems”
Reviews.Author: lucky
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a wonderful location on the Upper West Side. The UPW is a quiet reprieve from the hectic pace of downtown Manhattan. And the best thing? You're a half block from the underground metro, which means you can be downtown in ten minutes! What could be better? Well, there's more. Also half a block away is Central Park. You're across the street from the Natural History Museum. A Starbucks is two minutes away. And lots of shopping and restaurants nearby. So location is definitely a 'plus'. Other plus's: - comfy beds - nice breakfast (but pricy) - lovely tile in the bathroom On the negative side: - some VERY bad front desk staff... practically the worst I've ever seen... I notice other reviewers have commented on this so I won't say more - found a cockroach in the room one day. Apparently this is almost unavoidable in NYC, and even the best hotels have 'em. But still, it wasn't pleasant. - elevators extremely slow Overall, I'd return to this hotel for the location. It's not for everyone, because it's out of the 'main action', but we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Christmas in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Casa_Baskey
Reviews.Content: We were looking for an affordable hotel near the heart of NYC. We found the Excelsior Hotel which was located in Upper Manhattan - across from Central Park and the Natural History Museum. The room was very nice and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Although it would be a very long walk to the heart of NYC, the same was easily accessed by Metro or Taxi Cab. We tried the Metro the first day and although very affordable, it was not suited for us. We then hired taxi cabs back and forth (for around $10 - 15 USD) and we were very pleased with the location. Quiet retreat after a busy day in the City. We would definitely return to this clean, affordable hotel which is near the city limits of the Big Apple.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare on W81st Street”
Reviews.Author: P0liteCanadian
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four that stayed at the Excelsior Dec 29th, 2008 to Jan 1, 2009. As we have benefitted from this site for our travel plans, we felt compelled enough to post this in the hopes that some of you will benefit from some honest feedback. Location is great but unfortunately, this is about it for this place.(except for the nice fellow that gets the taxis, bags etc) For sake of brevity, here are (our) facts: 1) Entering the room we find a women's belt and a bottle missing from the bar fridge. (?) Watch out for the bar fridge as if you move anything inside after 20 seconds its computer logs that you have consumed the item. 2) We ordered and had confirmation of 2 double beds. Upon arrival learned that one was a pull out sofa. Yes this fits 2 people but we flipped coins for the 2 of us that would have sore backs the next day! 3) Room was spacious enough but could hear other rooms -even across the building and outside garbage trucks at night and the elevator beside us. 4) Bathroom: No fan, water never gets hot, just luke warm. Bath tub didn't drain well. Toilet didnt flush well (more on this below) Being somewhat overly polite Canadians, we did not make issue with the above. After all what are you going to do when everything is booked up and its close to New Year's. Best make the best of it. 5) Toilet plugs for the 3rd time-(cleaning staff had to plunge it twice) Have had enough and go downstairs to the front desk. Here is where it becomes obvious that the culture at the Excelsior has evolved to the point where it appears they are just "collecting a pay cheque." It's sad really because all we were looking for at this point was some basic solution. Even an alternative room or staff bathroom would have sufficed, but nothing offered. Front desk guy asks me "What do you want me to do about it?" That's it. So I said , well how about a plunger? So a plunger is left in our room. Still doesnt work, so we go to sleep and hope we have somewhere to "go" the next day. (check out day) Turns out there is a perfectly good working bathroom on the 2nd floor but had to discover this ourselves...wow thanks front desk guy who worked Dec 31st. Hope you have a better 2009 full of customer service basic skills. Long and short of it is we will never again visit this hotel. The front desk staff have a "not my job" attitude. They did not welcome us, neither did they aplogise for any inconvenience, neither did they say thank you for staying with them. I know this wasn't just us because I stood there and listened to the front desk give the same lack of courtesy to several others. They don't even smile. Obviously not a happy crew. Maybe they know its a poor hotel too....?

Reviews.Title: “Oh that heater”
Reviews.Author: cdeast
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in this hotel before, primarily because of the great location on the upper west side. Many good restaurants nearby, and the blue line subway is at the end of the block, which makes it very easy to get to mid-town Manhattan. It is also only 3/4 of a block from Central Park. However, the the heating system is beginning to show it's age and the windows are drafty and need replaced. As others have mentioned, the heating unit can be very noisey , and our's prevented us from getting a decent night's sleep during our two night stay. The staff at the front desk were friendly and helpful , which wasn't the case on my previous visits.( looked like some new faces). Our room with twin beds was small and one of the beds was in front of the closet , which made it difficult to get to. Price is good , but I am not sure if I want to spend a night in a hotel , where it is very difficult to sleep. Will probably look for another hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Good location bad heating in cold weather”
Reviews.Author: davidzee
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a great neighborhood, right next to Central Park and near great eating and cultural life on the Upper West Side. Rooms are on the smaller side but decent and well appointed based on the cost relative to most hotels in Manhattan. As mentioned by other reviewer, heater was broken/not working in our room on a very cold night. I asked front desk to send someone to fix, which they said they'd do, then didn't. On second request, I got a cockamamie story about the hotel system only turning on heat when outside temperature drops below 45. Not sure I believe a hotel would allow internal temperatures to drop to 46 before giving us heat. Didn't appreciate being lied to, if indeed the hotel was just trying to save money by cutting back on heat. We had to double-up on blankets, so that was our solution. I can't say this is a bad hotel or a bad deal especially given the hotel's other good features -- great location, clean and safe, a classic old pre-war hotel near Central Park, etc. Just be aware it's not perfect, and if very cold outside, be prepared.

Reviews.Title: “Great get Away”
Reviews.Author: cescottie
Reviews.Content: Wellrun hotel with good desk service. Comfy room and good ensuite facilities. Easy access to Metro and Central Park. Service to keep bags after check-out for those late flights gives another bag free walk about day.

Reviews.Title: “Only down point for our 25th Wedding Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: TonyMaldon
Reviews.Content: Well well, please do not be decieved by the pictures that are on the web site, in which the reception area looks vast, it is not, the reception staff are probably the most unhelpful people on earth, the gym must be hidden away as we certainly did not find it. We had a one bedroon suite which was very dated, with wall paper from a past era. Be warned that all of the products that are in the mini bar sit on pressure pads which are connected to the reception and if you take one out for 20 seconds the cost will go on your bill whether you have it or not. If you happen to be a person who enjoys a hot drink after 11am then this hotel is definatley not for you, as there are no facilities for tea or coffee,either in the rooms or hotel when we questioned reception on this point we were abruptly told that there was a star bucks at the end of the street, for info star bucks opens at 05.30am till 11pm, if you require a hot drink through the night the receptions attitude is tough. You could always use the restaurant in the evening for a hot drink but the staff do not make you feel welcome unless you are eating there at there high prices. The one good point for this hotel is that the doormen are helpful and will advise where to go and how to get there, it is a shame that this is a small consilation. I would rate this as a 2 star hoteand no higher.l

Reviews.Title: “Run Down and Rude”
Reviews.Author: seanthree
Reviews.Content: We read about the rude staff at the front desk but decided to go anyway thinking it could not be that bad. The front desk was as rude as depicted and the concierge was one of most unhelpful. When we asked for a breakfast place in the area they said just go walk X, Y and Z street. We asked for a particular recommendation and they just repeated the same thing. The thing that shocked us the most is that the management has not responded. Being fairly resourcefull we could do without the staff, but on top of that the rooms are run down with poor plumbing and heating that you cannot control. A bit ridiculous for the price. My advice is to find another place.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: zebedee4504
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights 16/17 Nov 08. We booked on a budget and there were four of us in one room - cosy but we had two queen beds and a bathroom. The shower was ferocious and the room was perfect for what we paid - after all this is New York and who wants to spend time in a hotel room. The only gripe we did have was that the room was extremely hot but we put the air conditioning on cold blast all day whilst we were out and this solved the problem. The reception staff were competent and Joe the doorman was the best! He arranged a cab for us back to JFK with no hassle what so ever. We would go back tomorrow if the bank manager would allow! We ate at Cafe Freda on Columbas - fantastic mexican and for breakfast turn right instead of left onto Columbus and you will come across no end of choice. Avoid the Starbucks for tea if you want a decent cup - stick to coffee! PS the liquer stores are plentiful in this district for a tipple before you go out for dinner. Bistro Citron is a short walk and does fab french without the big bill.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zanna58
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel,less than 5 mins walk to Central Park & Subway Station.Our party had 3 separate rooms,all of which were well equiped,no tea or coffee making facilities although we knew this when booking.(Maybe the hotel could have a rethink on this)Starbucks is just round the corner.None of our rooms had great views but in a big hotel like this they can't all look out onto Central Park or the Museum!!! Can't fault any part of our stay except the hotel was too warm everywhere,we welcomed air con & open windows. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling Staff”
Reviews.Author: kez75
Reviews.Content: I have never experienced a place where the staff were so rude and unhelpful. This was my first trip to the States in a party of 13 girls. From the moment we arrived at the hotel to check-in to the moment we checked out - the reception staff were the worst I have ever experienced in my life! The hotel itself was charming with clean, tidy rooms and easy access to Central Park but it was pretty obvious that none of the staff had never attended any sort of customer service course and really shouldn't have any contact with the public. My advice would be to stay away from this hotel unless you are happy to pay again for everything you have already booked and paid for, and you dont mind people shrugging their shoulders when they dont want to deal with you any longer. Oh and dont expect a manager to be in attendance at any time for you to speak to. On the plus side the concierge guys were brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “Change Front Desk Employees!!”
Reviews.Author: TexSanFran
Reviews.Content: It's a real shame such a beautiful, fantastically located hotel doesn't have appropriate employees working at the front desk. The maids, doormen and baggage clerks were very friendly and professional. The front desk female employee with long black hair wan unpleasant, rude, twerpy, passive aggressive, uncooperative and never smiled. Her co-worker at the front desk pretended not to hear the discussions this woman had with all guests. A real shame. Never going back.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: Meddybempster
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel for wedding guests as the reception was at the Museum of Natural History across the street. The experiences of our group were consistently TERRIBLE...no hot water...televisions that did not work...requests for repairs that were ignored...front desk staff was the rudest and least responsive, including hanging up when called, swearing at a guest of any hotel in which I have ever stayed. Our observations were that other guests experienced the same problems and were trated in the same way! STAY AWAY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: steve1944
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have spent a January weekend at the Excelsior for the last two years. While the hotel has its charm (ever so slightly going to seed), there are other options on the Upper West Side. In trying to make reservations, again, for this January, I encountered their Director of Sales and their General Manager. As a result of the former's attitude and ego and the latter's focus on the "big picture," (precluding any involvement with such things as customers), we will explore those other options. The Excelsior's charm is somewhat thin and really cannot bear the weight of any unpleasant experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff - broken heater almost fries us alive”
Reviews.Author: medellia33
Reviews.Content: the staff was unbelievably rude and unaccomodating...a broken heater blasted firey heat all night long and we had to open the windows and door to the room...the staff did nothing to correct the problem and offered only at $75 credit on $250 room after much unneeded miscommunication...they are liars and honestly don't care about their guests or their reputation...great rooms for sleeping in decent location, but a WASTE OF TIME all together...DO NOT give this hotel your business...

Reviews.Title: “The Excellent Excelsior”
Reviews.Author: maysdens
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a convenient location. Subway access is located at the end of the same block, the Museum of Natural History is located across the street, Central Park is one block away and the hotel is located in a safe location of town. We had a suite and were very pleaed with our accomodations. We will definitely stay at the Excelsior the next time we visit New York. Unlike some others, we found the front desk staff to be both helpful and cordial.

Reviews.Title: “Made the trip perfect”
Reviews.Author: SCMother_of_two_boys
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite that overlooked the museum and it was perfect. The location is excellent for families--right next to the Museum of Natural History and Central Park. You can walk to any type of restaraunt and it is a safe feeling area. Lots to do. Will stay here again--hopefully soon!

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, agree with other reviews front desk staff are a bit up themselves”
Reviews.Author: ecamille
Reviews.Content: After staying at 3 different hotels in N.Y, this was the best. Lovely rooms, beautifully detailed, nice and quiet, Porter/bell hop very helpfull and friendly. Lovely food, and very attentive staff in bar and resturant. The front desk staff are something else, (example) we asked to change a twenty dollar so we could get a first dollars for tips for the bell hop. The women behind the desk looked down her nose and then said 'what, and questioned what we wanted it for and then said 'no'. Other than this the hotel was in a nice location, and very happy to stay there again. I work in hospitality so disapointed to witness this type of attitude from front office staff. The front office staff let the hotel down.

Reviews.Title: “More than accomodating.”
Reviews.Author: tandscrow
Reviews.Content: I had origially booked one night. Plans changed and I needed three nights. There were only suites available for the middle night so I ended up having to make three separate reservations. When I arrived I asked if we could be in the same room all three nights. I even said we would be willing to stay in a regular room and pay for the suite the middle night. They more than graciously put us in a suite for all three nights. They were in a great location ( across the street from The Museum of Natural History). There were great restaurants closeby and the subway was across the street as well.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre 4-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1catraveler
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior Hotel @ 81st & Columbus near Central Park West. Nice neighborhood across from the Museum of Natural History and park. Lovely, nice lobby, friendly staff, apparently being renovated floor by floor. Nice room, however only one small easy chair, plus a desk with one straight back chair (no place to sit together and eat a snack, etc.), old, small TV with poor reception, nice bedding. Bathroom with beautiful white "Country French" tile design. Worst features: completely stocked mini-bar (if you picked up anything from the basket on top or from in the cooler you are charged if you hold any item for more than 20 seconds! Other bad features: no coffee maker and the toilet overflowed twice! Yikes! Would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Rosalee-R
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior was a pleasure to stay in. The location is fantastic. The neighborhood is quiet, picturesque, there are a large selection of restaurants within walking distance and transportation options are right there, Zabars and Central Park are within easy walking distance and make the location even more of a highlight. The hotel decor is quaint and the rooms are very comfortable. I would agree with other reviewers that the desk staff are somewhat snooty. The woman at the concierge desk was rude and of no help whatsoever. However, after speaking with the manager we discovered that the concierge desk is contracted out and the employees are not those of the hotel. In any case, the concierge reflects on the hotel and it would be in the Excelsior's best interest to make sure that the staff at the desk are much better suited to their job.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very Quiet, Snooty Desk People”
Reviews.Author: Spohie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 1/2 a block from Central Park, across the street from the Natural History Museum and directly across the park from the Metropolitan Museum of Art. It was also 1/2 block from the subway. It's a very safe neighborhood and it feels removed from all the craziness downtown. There is a large fine for honking in that part of town and it was the quietest place I've ever stayed! The 2 front desk people we encountered were not very friendly but everyone else was. We got a suite for us and our 2 children (there is a sleeper sofa in the extra room) and it worked well for us. The view was of the other part of the hotel. I tried to change it but they said we would have to wait until the next day and contact Travelocity (who I booked through). I would stay there again, but not for the retail price! We paid $350 plus taxes and that was painful enough.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend. Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: VancouverElizabeth
Reviews.Content: Stayed there four nights. Everything about this hotel exceeded expectations. The location excellent. Across from Central Park and steps to a subway. Short subway ride to Columbus Circle and Times Square. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. As well as other staff members. The room was very clean and tastefully decorated. Bed was comfortable with nice linens. The price was right at $281.00 per night. Which was a bargain for the quality of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Affection for the Excelsior”
Reviews.Author: Jojonellie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights in May because we earned two free nights from a credit card and this hotel was on the list. To make it short and sweet, I really liked this hotel. The room we had was small, but it was nice. It had a north city view and we enjoyed looking at all the residential rooftops. The room had a queen bed, very comfortable, and the usual amentities (chairs, armoire, etc.) The bathroom was beautiful and had items I don't usually see in a hotel, like a jar of cotton balls. My husband wasn't as charmed as I was, but he likes modern decor while I prefer a more traditional look, which this hotel is. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel or use the library room, but we did enjoy the location next to Central Park and the use of the hotel's umbrellas (it rained!). The maid service was excellent and the maid was very friendly. The front desk people were not overly friendly, but they were not rude. We felt very comfortable here and loved the location and the cleanliness of the hotel. Like I said, I would like to come back for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: ADKWoman
Reviews.Content: I grew up in NYC and went for a visit mid-September. I stayed, last minute, at the Excelsior. Totally great. No, this is not the Waldorf Astoria. But it elegant nonetheless. The lobby is mahogany and marble. (Who cares if the front desk people are snooty, as said in other reviews. Are you there to make friends with the staff? It is very true that the consierge person is short and actually misleading. Plan you trip well, and don't rely on the staff for much.) My "junior suite" had a ton of room, a rarity for NYC. A couch, a table, plenty of windows, two dressers, a comfortable bed with crisp, clean sheets, a marble bath which was incredibly clean, with a tub and a window. They offer toiletries, plenty of crisp, clean towels. There is a mini-bar and a safe. This place cannot be beat if you want a quiet, clean, well-located hotel. The only drawback, to me personally, was the decor. I felt like I was staying in an upscale, county inn, with the florals and the stripes. But nothing was dated or faded. All new, all nice. Stay there happily if you want to be on the upper west side.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: sampchicago
Reviews.Content: in the super-expensive world of nyc hotels this one is a standout value. it is not up to date and you'll have to get over the somewhat cold face of the place - everything is extra & they're still trying to overcharge for the phones in this cell phone era. but that's the way they may think they can keep the basic price down. and they do that while providing competent staff and quite serviceable accommodations in a great location. i'd definitely return if i needed a manhattan hotel and were spending my own money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for it's location and the availablity of a suite with a separate bedroom with doors--a rarity in NYC at a reasonable price. The Queen suite bedroom was larger than we were expecting. The living room area with the sofa bed was tight after the sofa opened up but that wasn't a problem. Very comfortable bed; nice but small bath; very quiet location (no view, that's why) and overall a good experience. Breakfast is not included in the room price. Continental breakfast was $17.95; hot breakfast was $19.95 and both were very good and extensive. The concierge left a lot to be desired. She just didn't have that willingness to please attitude necessary for the job. One of the doormen went out of his way our last day to walk our luggage down to the far corner and hail a cab for us because the near corner was blocked to traffic and we couldn't get a cab in front of the hotel. Excellent location to subways at 81st & Central Park West (1 minute walk) and 79th & Amsterdam (6 minute walk) from which we could go almost everywhere without having to transfer. It's a 12 minute walk to Lincoln Center. Central Park and the Natural History Museum are literally right outside the front door.

Reviews.Title: “Staff with attitude problem; adequate accommodation”
Reviews.Author: felipeordonez
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior touts itself as a "luxury" hotel with lots of trimmings for what is, admittedly, a reasonable price by Manhattan standards. That's what enticed me to book it. However, from the minute we arrived we realized that it is no such thing. The reception staff were completely humourless, even unhelpful, and remained so throughout the five days of our stay, despite a change of personnel. It is not so much a welcome as a "well, what do you want?" approach to hotel-keeping. The rooms are not luxurious: they are adequate but no more, with ancient airconditioners that are both noisy and ineffective. Bathrooms are OK. We did not have breakfast in the hotel, but the cost of breakfast seems quite reasonable by NY standards. In contrast to the front office staff, the housekeeping staff were friendly and helpful. The attraction of the Excelsior is its price, and to a certain extent its location a few yards off Central Park, but one has to put up with some surly service from the staff as part of that price. It's a place to sleep, but not much more.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Smiler33
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a weeks holiday - staying at the Excelsior and I can certainly recommend it. I was staying, with my partner, in NY for a wedding in Central Park & this hotel was ideally suited for it. Placed on the upper west side on 81st there was a subway station just down the road and around the corner you could hop on/hop off the bus tours (if you had the relevant ticket) or you could stroll across Central Park to the shops on 5th Avenue. The road was peaceful in the evening compared to the hustle & bustle of downtown & our room was on the 3rd floor at the front - we werent bothered by traffic noise at all. The room & bathroom were very clean & comfortable & the air conditioning was very welcome with the temperature hitting 90 degrees with 90% humidity outside! The hotel staff were all courtious, approachable and helpful. Breakfast was hearty and reasonably priced and there were a number of great restaurants & bars in the area for the evenings we had to ourselves. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who didnt want to stay in the thick of things downtown. On my next visit I will definately be booking in again.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: ianScotland
Reviews.Content: Have just had a 4 night stay and thoroughly enjoyed it - excellent location for park, subway and restaurants. Room was fair size for New York and very clean. Staff all very friendly and efficient so no complaints there. I booked through e-bookers at what I thought a very good price, so overall great value for New York.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scottsdale_AZArizona
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights and did not have any complaints. Hotel is in a good location and was quieter than we had expected. Rooms are fine and everything was very clean. We would recommend to anyone staying in the city.

Reviews.Title: “An elegant and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chocbid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excelsior for 6 nights at the end of August. The hotel is located in the upper west side of Manhattan which is a very pleasant and quiet area to stay in. There are lots of restaurants within a short walking distance. It was my first visit to New York and we found the hotel to be elegant and comfortable. We were accommodated on the 14th floor (two lifts operating) and our room, whilst not particularly large, was clean and comfortable. There was a large wardrobe (with free safe) The bathroom was excellent and had a window which let in fresh air (unusual in my experience of hotel bathrooms) and a powerful hairdryer fixed to the wall. We stayed on a room only basis preferring to sample local diners for breakfast. I can recommend Barney Greengrass - a jewish diner/deli on Amerstam which offered interesting concoctions and unlimited coffee plus a diner called 'Good Enough to Eat' which does excellent pancakes with different toppings and unlimited coffee refills. This wasn't so good for evening meals we found. The reason I haven't awarded the full 5 stars is because we found some of the reception staff to be unfriendly and lacking in basic communication skills. The doormen were extremely helpful and friendly as were the domestic cleaning staff. Despite this, I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel and would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: gill25Blackburn
Reviews.Content: I must admit we were a little worried about staying here after reading all the negative reviews. We worried in vain!! From the moment the taxi pulled up outside, the staff were really friendly and courteous. We got our rooms upgraded to suites free of charge, the rooms were spotless and nothing was too much trouble. The hotel is in a fab area, the tube was at the end of the street which we used every day, central park a few steps away. Excellent restaurants and delis on Columbus Avenue - would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Unattractive”
Reviews.Author: roxipod
Reviews.Content: Aside from good location, this hotel has not much appeal. Front desk lacked basic hospitality skills and room was dull and bathroom was ridiculously small. Air con almost an antique piece.

Reviews.Title: “Understated Elegance in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: howi58
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior is a good hotel, conveniently situated adjacent to Central Park and overlooking the landscaped gardens next to the Natural History Museum. There is a subway station just around the corner. the wood-panelled foyer is redolent of a bygone era and this is reflected in the bedroom decor, which is very pleasant, if occasionally a little faded. Rooms are large and comfortable and pleasing touches, such as complimentary sewing kits and luxury cosmetics enhance the environment. The hotel breakfasts are served in the library - once again, elegantly wood-panelled - and were, we felt, particularly good value. In addition to the usual cold offerings, several choices of freshly brewed coffee and tea and an enormous range of breads, cakes and pastries, guests are able to choose from a variety of american-style hot dishes - waffles, pancakes etc. - and also omelettes and full "cooked" options. Our only reservation about this hotel relates to the front of house staff. I found some of the receptionists surly and unhelpful, for example I felt that being told I had to personally present my laundry at reception, rather than having it collected from my bedroom, was inconsistent with a hotel of this quality. Also, a female concierge refused to reboot her computer at the end of her shift, one evening, meaning that we had to wait until the following morning for the information we required. I should add that the reception staff were again unhelpful here. All that said, we enjoyed the Excelsior and I would recommend it as representing good value' especially bearing in mind its location and overall facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Excelsior!”
Reviews.Author: danarusf
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Excelsior Hotel, New York in early July 2008 for a few days. The staff there were very welcoming and helpful. My room was clean,comfortable and quiet. I especially enjoyed the shower and the air conditioning was a blessing as the temperature was into the mid eighties! The hotel is located in a a very pleasant area close to resturants, bars and coffee shops.The subway is a short walk away where you can access conections to Times Square which is a centre of excitement, bright colours and stimulation. We enjoyed the bus tours which were reasonably priced. In all, a very pleasant city break. Thank you Excelisor Hotel!! - I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely satisfied, a great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Mer313131
Reviews.Content: When comparing the reviews between hotels, Excelsior seemed to have the most raving fans of any medium-priced hotel in a good location, so we booked it. We were staying in NYC for the weekend but only for one night at a hotel (the other night with friends). We were very pleased with the whole experience, from the check-in, to check-out. The lobby was gorgeous. We were able to have our bags held by the bellman for an extended amount of time both before and after our check-in and out, with ease and professionalism. We were incorrectly booked by Travelocity for two twin beds, which could have been a hassle, but instead the front desk gentleman switched us to a large junior suite with a queen bed without us even asking. The suite was very clean, notably the bathroom, which sometimes seems to suffer in city hotels. When we needed extra towels, they were up within 5 minutes. The AC worked great, not loud at all. The mini-bar is pricey, but hello....it is NYC, and the prices are listed on a menu next to the minibar, so you know what to expect.
