The location was great, well-lit and safe, within 5 minutes walking distance from the subway, central park, museum of natural history, and several restaurants. The only negative thing I could say was the view of our room was towards a brick wall. However, we did not specify what view we would have liked, so I would suggest asking for a "park" view when either booking or checking in. This did not bother us, as we only were in our room when sleeping, changing or showering. If you are booking through a third party, as we did, make sure you call ahead to the hotel directly beforehand to ensure your room and the view are what you want and expect. Wonderful job!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: baja_bum
Reviews.Content: Just checking out TODAY and have to admit, I was slightly worried prior to our (family of 4) arrival, based on some earlier reviews-once again proving "you can't please everyone." The staff was courteous (I found Lynn at the front desk to be helpful and the concierge staff were full of great tips and ideas), the room (a 1 bedroom suite on the 3rd floor) was SPOTLESS and featured an excellent view of the park area overlooking the Museum of Natural History. EVERY day the room was made up nicely (housekeeper placed my daughter's stuffed animals together on her bed having a party - a nice touch), and the toiletries were replenished and included the usual soap/shampoo etc. BUT also included razor & shaving cream, tooth brush and tooth paste and other "EXTRAS." The LOCATION was FANTASTIC with short walk to GOOD restaurants in ALL price ranges, Central Park...etc. and the subway (which we NEVER felt unsafe on) was just around the corner! The Hotel Excelsior is a GEM...and...an OASIS at the end of the day. I would NEVER hesitate to recommend this to even my pickiest of friends and family and WILL stay here again if back in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Bother”
Reviews.Author: ecjbear
Reviews.Content: Most unfriendly and uncaring front desk staff---we seemend to be a bother to them from the initial registration. When we returned to the desk later to change a travelers check, the clerk could not even bother to check her drawer for smaller bills--said it was not possible to change a $100 bill---in the whole hotel!!! The clerk next to her opened his drawer and changed it to the requested 10s and 20s. When there was a computer problem in getting a boarding pass for our flight home, the clerk suggested that I go to 72nd st---11 blocks away to use their computer!!!! The concierge was pleasant but---"does not have a printer" --suggested we go around the block to the mail company and use theirs to get our printed boarding passes home! We ordered a car to the airport with the helpful door man who assured us it would be there. When we called down in the morning to check, the desk clerk knew nothing about it. It did arrive as ordered but since the doorman was gone no one "knew anything about it"... not our responsibility to book--can't trace it..... At check out the clerk argued about providing a paid receipt---I had received the bill under the door in the morning and found no problem. My request was for a balance of zero since it was on my credit card already. He said it was done at the end of the day and that since I had the bill it was not necessary. When I insisted that I wanted the "paid in full" rceipt he finally produced it from the printer in front of him----- took only about 15 seconds ---less time to get the receipt than it took to raise all the objections to granting my request. Is this an odd request?? Have always gotten it automatically from everywhere I have been. The only positive we have about the hotel is the gentleman who cooked breakfast to request in the morning. He was kind and attentive and he was the reason we returned to the breakfast area each morning. Room was fair but very noisy air conditioner--difficult to hear tv much less sleep. Public areas dirty. I am pretty well traveled--all over the US including prior visits to New York, Europe, Africa, the far east. This was the most blatantly uncaring. Happy to be home.

Reviews.Title: “Never again...”
Reviews.Author: SeniorTravelor62
Reviews.Content: Avoid the Excelsior if at all possible. We had read the reviews but thought surely the staff attitude would have improved once management had seen the comments of previous guests. Apparently not! The young lady on the day shift was rude, unhelpful and condescending - not what I'm looking for at $300.+ per day. Her male co-worker was no better. When I asked to speak with the manager I was told he was [conveniently] out of town. The room was clean but very, very small and we had to change because the first room was even smaller and the TV didn't work. The location is pretty convenient buth the few pluses don't make up for the negatives.

Reviews.Title: “It was great”
Reviews.Author: Kartouche
Reviews.Content: Have just read reviews of this hotel, lots of which are negative. My husband and I stayed here during March 07 for 6 nights. We had a quiet courtyard suite which was large by anyone's standards - and it was spotlessly clean. We didn't have any problem with the reception staff at all. We ate breakfast tin hotel every day, which we thought was a bargain at US$16 each. We live in London and travel quite a bit in Europe so this is a very very cheap rate for breakfast compared to what we are used to. Also the quality was good with a charming guy who cooked eggs to order. When our room heating didn't work a man was sent straight away to fix it (as it was minus 9 outside at the time we were grateful for that!!). It's in a great location and there is a fabulous Mexican restaurant (Cafe Freida) just up the road and a couple of really good upmarket Italians. The desk staff were very helpful when advising us where to eat. It's possible to walk through Central Park to the museums and taxis are always available. There's also a subway nearby. I hope that this helps if you are thinking of staying there and have been put off by the other reviewers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - wonderful room”
Reviews.Author: Barbara45
Reviews.Content: I almost canceled our reservations after reading these reviews but thank goodness I did not as we had a perfect five night stay. In fairness to the other reviewers, we did not talk to the front desk the entire time (besides checking in and checking out-which was very pleasant). If we wanted to know something, we checked the internet and had great success finding the best restaurants within a few blocks of the hotel (Telepan was one that was superb). There was nothing wrong with the room to constantly complain to the front desk. Maid service was timely. There was always a newspaper waiting by our door in the morning. The location of this hotel is the big selling point. The entrance to the subway is 300 steps from hotel front door. One night, our Broadway show ended at 9:55 p.m. We were back in our room at 10:15 p.m. - yes, it was that convenient to pop on the subway. Also, Central Park is located right by that subway entrance and it is lovely to get a bagel at H&H and go for walk thru the park in the morning. The view from the hotel is amazing. You look over a park and the History Museum. To the left, you can see Central Park. We were on the 15th floor so that helped a lot with the viewing. The neighborhood is very safe and you feel as if you are amid New Yorker's out for the evening walking their dogs, etc. It is the opposite of being down in Times Square crowded with the hoards of tourists.

Reviews.Title: “They'll look down their noses at you”
Reviews.Author: MuppetNewYork
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel if you like front-desk staff who look down their noses at you, are completely unhelpful and unknowledgable, and won't lift a finger to help you. A simple enquiry about local churches elicited no useful response. Sure, you could look it up on the internet...if you're happy to pay $4.00 for 20 minutes. Small rooms, really not worth the money. Try the novotel instead!

Reviews.Title: “Left a bad taste!”
Reviews.Author: VicsMix
Reviews.Content: Apart from the miserable guy on the desk and the general ignorance of staff during our three day stay we were reasonably happy. Our problem started when we arrived home. The hotel had placed a charge on my credit card (they take details of your card at check in which is normal practice). I e-mailed them and they informed me the charge was for using the mini-bar. I sincerely explained that we had not used the mini-bar or any other additional service and kindly asked if they would credit my visa card with the original amount. They ignored this e-mail and my subsequent four e-mails which was extremely annoying. I contacted my Visa company and they kindly removed the charge from my bill. What is unusual is that they charged my visa on the day I checked out but they said nothing to me at the time of check-out. This has left a very bad taste!

Reviews.Title: “great location great hotel”
Reviews.Author: fatboyrotherham
Reviews.Content: over all good hotel, door staff and house keeping excelent. fantastic location, area great for eating out, easy to get downtown subway near by. only problem the front desk staff,they need to go to charm school badly. would recomend this hotel any time.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: holidaylover5403
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the excelsior for 3 nights at the end of April, I was a bit nervous after some of the reviews I had read but need'nt have worried, the room was a triple and was very nice, comfy bed, great shower, very clean and spacious bedroom and bathroom, besides when you are in New York you are out most of the time but this Hotel I found more than adequate, I would like to mention we have stayed in many Hotels in our time and expect a good standard, The staff we found to be nice, we wanted blankets because the quilt was far too warm and these were delivered immediately, we were always courtious and they were the same back, we are thinking of returning next year to new York and we will definately stay at the Excelsior again, New York is wonderful and 3 nights is not enough to explore this wonderful place, Check out the Excelsior for yourself, be friendly to the staff and you will get the same response

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Wendy2601
Reviews.Content: My Aunt and I stayed a the hotel on a shopping trip. We had a twin double room which was very spacious and clean. The hotel is a couple of minutes from the subway which takes you straight to all the major places down town. In the other direction is Starbucks and numerous shops and restaurants. We loved the location and felt very safe coming back in the dark after our hectic days shopping and sight seeing. The only down side was no tea and coffee in the room. I really feel it let down an otherwise perfect stay not to be able to have a morning coffee without having to get dressed and walk round the corner to get it - come on Excelsior it wouldn't cost that much and all the guests commented on it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for families with children”
Reviews.Author: aroxanne4
Reviews.Content: Our family of four-which includes two young boys- just spent four days at the Excelsior Hotel and we kept saying that we couldn't have picked a better location! Surrounded by elegant apartment buildings and all the lovely green of Central Park and the park around the Natural History Museum, the Excelsior Hotel was a perfect place to come home to after the hustle-and-bustle of New York. When we came up at of our subway stop after a day spent in Midtown, both my husband and I commented that we felt like we could breath again. However, I don't want to give the impression that the hotel is isolated. It's a half block from Central Park, a half block from a subway stop, across the street from the Natural History Museum and around the corner from Columbus Ave., with its shopping, coffee shops, local bistros, groceries, liquor store, pharmacy. Walking Columbus Ave., with your children makes you feel like a local! In the time we were there, I got cold medicine for my son, two good bottles of wine, numerous Starbucks, cereal bars and a high-end French meal. All within a block and a half! The hotel was elegant and the staff was kind. When we checked in, the concierge stopped us and gave business cards of the hotel to our sons, in case they got lost and needed to tell someone where they were staying. It was a kind and thoughtful gesture. We'd reserved a suite for the four of us which proved a good idea. The adults were able to relax in the bedroom while the boys were able to play video games in the living room. The suite was a good size, a good layout, attractive and clean. The sofa bed that our sons slept on had a surprisingly comfortable mattress. We were a little disappointed that our suite wasn't higher--it was on the fourth floor. The street noise was considerable, although by the second night our sons were immune to it. In the bedroom, with the French doors closed, we couldn't hear it. We had a park view, but perhaps the cheaper courtyard view would minimize the street noise. The only thing missing about our visit was room service. The Excelsior Hotel doesn't have it, and with two kids, the idea of heading out for dinner or waiting for breakfast can be too much. However, they did provide delivery menus at the front desk and we ordered twice from the delicious Artie's Delicatessen, which had our food to us in under thirty minutes. However, the lack of room service won't change our appreciation for this hotel. When we come to New York, this is where we will always stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!! Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: crichwill
Reviews.Content: First of all, after reading all of the reviews, I expected terrible service. However, the staff was delightful and more than accommodating. I was even offered an upgrade, which is surprising since I booked through hotels.com. The room heating and air worked fine. Yes, the hotel was hot, but the windows opened and with the AC on, our room was the perfect temperature. The beds were extremely comfortable. The hot water worked just fine. I think since the hotel is old, the faucets were installed backwards. So, turning the temperature in the shower towards cold, actually made the water warm and turning the control towards cold made the water very warm. The hotel was very clean and the bellmen were very kind. Recomendations: use a car service to LGA (through the bellman for $40.00. It is much nicer and the same price as a taxi). Be sure the eat at Azaleas (make a reservation) in the theater district. The concierge recommended it and it was phenomenal. It was the best meal we ate in NY!! Take the gray line hop on hop off all loops tour if you are there for a weekend and want to see the entire city. Don't forget to hit Canal Street to do some bargain shopping as well. Hotels.com matches any price you find on the internet so search booking.com and hotelconxions.com before calling booking through hotels.com. The location was PERFECT if you want to be near an upscale part of NY. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: Riceranch
Reviews.Content: My 8 year old son and I spent 4 nights at the Excelsior and found it to be absolutely lovely. The room was surprisingly spacious for New York City, very comfortable beds, and the shower was phenomenal - even my son enjoyed showering each day, which can be the source of an argument at home! We found the staff to be very friendly and responsive, and I was disturbed to see more than one traveler taking out their stress on the front desk staff for situations clearly beyond their control. Travelers - mind your manners - people want to help you much more when you do!! The concierge in particular went out of his way to be helpful and kind to us, and his advice was very useful on several occasions. The location is absolutely ideal - just steps from the Museum of Natural History, the subway station, and Central Park, not to mention the amazing selection of terrific restaurants within a 5 block radius. The only drawback for us was the grossly overpriced breakfast, typical of New York City, but for $20 per person I felt the selection could have been significantly better - so we walked to a nearby restaurant most days. We would absolutely return to this hotel and hope to do so soon.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, European-style”
Reviews.Author: Fruitley
Reviews.Content: Half block from 81 St subway stop, quiet residential neighborhood, nothing fancy - like an older European hotel, very friendly staff. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty”
Reviews.Author: VacationingProf
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and it's really disappointing to report that we wouldn't stay there again voluntarily. My one year old daughter kept picking things up from the carpet that were from previous guests - like hair pins that I don't use and that would be easily picked up by a vacuum cleaner. Not only did no-one seem to vacuum during our four night stay, but also apparently not between guests. Gross! Also our trash was never emptied - despite our ordering in food usually once a day, and our bathroom was left untouched. However, someone was coming into the room everyday as they kept closing the net curtains that we were leaving open. Too bad they didn't think to clean while they were there! However, none of this was a surprise after the 'welcome' we received. Even though we were carrying a one year old, 3 big bags, a diaper bag, two back packs and a stroller, none of the three doormen who were standing around chatting thought to help us out at all. The only time help was 'offered' was when the concierge jumped up to tell us we couldn't go to our room with all that and had to have a bellman help...oh well. We were already loaded into the elevator at that point...hmmmm But paled in comparison to our treatment by the guy at the front desk who was EXTREMELY rude to us and all the other guests I saw him speak to. Some people got mad, some people were just confused and others just sort of laughed at him. I was in the first camp and my husband the latter! The doormen continued to be useless throughout the whole stay. They probably got the door for us (we were usually with a stroller) less times than I can count on one hand. We used to live in a door man building on Manhattan's Upper West Side and know this is unusual. The hotel is in need of major refurbishment (torn couches etc), the bed was extremely soft, and like I said, we found stuff on the floor from previous guests - though people without small children may not notice. However, it's a great location especially with a child. Across the road from the Natural History Museum, a block from the park and near great delis and restaurants. It's located very conveniently for all the major west side subway stops, a quick walk across the park to the east side or across the road from the bus to the east side. If it was clean, I would stay here again even with the rude staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Tzipi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excelsior for six days and were completely satisfied. It's across the street from the Museum of Natural History, half a block to the subway, and steps away from dozens of restaurants and Zabar's--we self-catered breakfast. The breakfast buffet is nice and adequate but cost $16 ea. The bar is beautiful and quiet. Local relatives say the restaurant is good but we didn't get a chance to try it. Our room was beautifully decorated; the best combination of paint, walpaper, carpet and bedspread I have ever seen in a hotel. All areas were clean. And no minibar! All in all, a great value. We will book again. PS The pictures on the hotel's web site are a good preview of what you will get.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: RGGBoston
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior Hotel does not excel in any way. My wife and I wanted a romantic weekend in NY and chose the Excelsior due to the pictures we on its web site. I wish we did not judge this book by its cover. The staff was not only rude and arogant, but when asked a question the answer was usually just plain wrong. While we checked in the clerk received a telephone call and I stood there while she argued with the caller about retrieving her laundry before it was stolen. The continental breakfast would not have passed at a roadside motel let alone an upper west side hotel. The only saving grace was its location, very easy to access the entire city by foot or subway.

Reviews.Title: “Still a Great Find”
Reviews.Author: gosaka
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 3 nights again at the Excelsior. I'm always on the lookout for a quality hotel bargain in NYC and can't find anything that beats the Excelsior. We stayed in a regular hotel double room for $219/night (without the enormous NY taxes added). It's convenient to the subway, in a relatively quiet neighborhood and convenient to Lincoln Center where my daughter had auditions to do. Starbucks is across the street, lot's of restaurants nearby, jogging in Central Park. Perfect for me.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Linda44
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Excelsior for two nights and found it to be lovely. Our room was absolutely immaculate and the bathroom was large. (Room 806) We enjoyed the view of the park and the Museum of Natural History. I loved the floral tile work and the little alcove window over the bathtub. The bed was extremely comfortable. We utilized the room safe which was not working when we arrived. The front desk sent someone up to fix it in a matter of minutes. We found the staff courteous and helpful. The doorman actually ran out to the street with an umbrella when my husband was flagging down a taxi. The concierge always had a smile whenever we exited the elevator. We did not utilize the restaurant on the 2nd floor. However, we did find a wonderful little diner within walking distance that was quite a bargain for NYC. When we left the hotel, we turned right and walked up to Broadway (2 blocks). Turn left on Broadway and pass Filenes at 79th. The diner is on the same side of the street as Filenes just past it on Broadway and 78th. The breakfast includes freshly squeezed orange juice and coffee. There are about 8 full selections, as well as ala carte choices. I had the full breakfast and chose the challah french toast with a generous serving of bacon. The entire bill was 6.50 with tax! For lunch try Artie's Deli. Wonderful! Just turn right when leaving the hotel,and walk to Broadway. This time, go right on Broadway and walk to 83rd. Huge sandwiches, great matzo ball soup and very fair prices. Had dinner at Freds one night and Pergola des Artistes the other. The later offers wonderful fixed price French dinners. We took a taxi there and I believe it is at 46th Street on the west side near Times Square. Worth the trip! The hotel stored our luggage on our 3rd day there as we had an evening flight home. Found everything about the hotel very lovely and will definitely stay there again when we visit New York

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: weavebom
Reviews.Content: This hotel certainly rates higher than for instance the Milford Plaza Downtown which we stayed at on our last visit (very basic small rooms) The rooms were nicely decorated clean and a good size for two adults and two teenagers (17& 13) beware though two queen size beds meant brother and sister had to share. It was February & cold outside, but as the room had its own air conditioning unit it was not hard to keep the room cosy. One thing missing was a kettle for a first thing morning cuppa, so we bought a cheap kettle $10 and that was sorted ! We liked the district in which the Excelsior was located more peaceful than downtown ensuring a good nights sleep. The subway is at the end of the block and very easy to walk to for all destinations. A good supply of eateries in the area a stroll away - try EJs diner for a great breakfast in traditional diner surroundings. The only downside of the hotel was the staff at the desk are not that friendly and the porters and concierge have always got their hands out for a tip. But as interaction with these people is very limited on a day to day basis donâ€™t let this put you off, the maids are very pleasant who service the rooms really well every day.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: vincarol
Reviews.Content: Great location, Great staff, Best value in New York. Close to everything. Family friendly. Boutique feel. Recent renovations did not interfere with stay and hope to improve future adventures. Check out Zabars and EJ's. Starbucks is just across the street but complimentary coffee would be appreciated. Hope to stay on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: wregle
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Excelsior during the 1st week of December. Went to NYC to enjoy the Christmas decorations and the Rockettes. While I prefer the hustle of Times Square, this hotel met all of our needs. Take some time to enjoy the wonderful neighborhood. There are so many neat shops and restaurants within walking distance. This is something you don't experience in the Times Square area. Zabars is definetely worth a look. Also walk to Alice's Tea Cup for a delightful breakfast or brunch. We only had one problem and that was with the toliet overflowing. With 1 phone call we got quick results. The water pressure in the shower was amazing! We inquired about the breakfast but thought it was too pricey. Starbucks is 1/2 block away so we were fine. I did not like having to pay to use the computer. We only had to chcek in for our flight and I think there should be a free computer for guest use. We arrived early in the morning and were able to check right in. We also had a late flight out and they were very happy to store our luggage. I do suggest you let them call a car for you when you need to check out so you don't have to wait for a taxi. Not a whole lot more and it was reassuring to know it would be there on time. The subway is very close so getting into Times Square was never a problem. Beware though, we tried to take the subway back late one evening and the line we needed was already closed. Some taxis do not want to take you from Times Square back to Central Park West. It took us over an hour to get a taxi. Overall, it was a nice place to stay. I found the staff was as nice to us as we were to them. Kindness and respect goes a long way.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Even Think About It”
Reviews.Author: DCMat
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the Excelsior on and off for several years and, despite its limitations (e.g., no room service) we usually found it a pleasant, good place to spend three or four days. We came to the Excelsior during the week between Christmas and New Year this year -- and it was a disaster. Some examples: the room was infernally hot and only could be made tolerable by running the AC full blast (in late December), but this made it hard to sleep because of the ancient AC unit's noise. The hotel ran out of hot water at 9 AM (in the middle of a shower) and we had to wait half an hour until it got lukewarm enough to use. All three keys to our room stopped working one day before our scheduled checkout time and a surly front desk attendant, instead of apologizing for the programming error, accused us of keeping the keys next to magnetic devices.

Reviews.Title: “Super tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: annadingaling
Reviews.Content: All hotels in New York are expensive and compared to the other available hotels in the same price bracket, this one appeared far better on websites and also on reviewing past travellers' reviews. We too were impressed with the hotel, which was everything we expected for a mid price 3* hotel. The hotel is half way up central park on the west side between 8th and Columbus, which meant every morning we enjoyed the walk through central park into town. If you're not a fan of walking the subway is right on the corner of 8th. I really liked the area as it was not as touristy as mid town near Times Square, but still pretty central. You are near the Uptown bus tour stop and the Natural History museum and well placed to see other such tourist sites. Our price did not include breakfast and being British we wanted to eat breakfast in diners, lunch in cafes and dinner in local restaurants - all of which we achieved. Recommend EJs and French Roast for breakfast and Nice Matin for dinner. Hotel had these recommendations and more of which these were the ones we tried. Having been to NYC several times already this perfect as it was in a different quieter and more pleasant part of town without being too far away. The hotel room was large based on prior experience of NYC hotels, with nice fresh new-looking bedding, bathroom was adequate and room had nice view of rooftops of the city. Spent bit of time in the hotel room at the end of the day watching the big tv, would not have wanted to spend too much more time there, but who does in NYC. Was very happy with the hotel, would definitely recommend it and for a similar price would definitely choose it again (it cost Â£140 a night during the wk and Â£170 for the weekend roughly). Cant give it 5* as didnt try brekkie and doesnt have the facilities of a big 4/5*, main asset is the location and pleasant comfort of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Beckwasthere
Reviews.Content: I booked the Excelsior Hotel for a 5 night Christmas shopping trip to NY for me and my mum. I was a bit worried after I had booked the hotel due to reading a fair amount of negative comments, particularly regarding the staff. However, I was pleasantly surprised when I got there. The hotel is smart looking, the staff were fine, not overly friendly but nor were they rude and they dealt with any queries we had efficiently. The room was as expected, nothing special but the beds were comfortable, the size was fine and there was nothing to complain about. The location was fantastic, right near the 81st subway so it was perfect for getting around and seeing the city. We never had breakfast in the hotel as it seemed expensive - $20 not including coffee but there are plenty of delis and coffee shops nearby where you can get breakfast for less than $5 which is probably a better way to do things anyway. We were barely in the hotel, more just coming and going as there is so much to see and do. I would stay at this hotel again, mainly due to the location but it was a comfortable and pleasant stay there too.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal in a wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: RikkiLeigh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Excelsior in early November while attending a conference near Rock Center. I chose the hotel primarily due to cost and the fact that I booked late. All hotels near the conference were booking in at over $500 for a Wednesday through Friday stay in early November, which was not in my department budget, even for NYC. I found the Excelsior on Travelocity for a reasonable price (package deal with airfare for $681), researched it on TripAdvisor.com and booked it with a bit of trepidation due to the negative comments on the staff. My experience was mostly positive with a few exceptions. Positives: * GREAT location! Very safe, residential neighborhood, but close to food, bookstores and shops on Columbus and Broadway. Not to mention proximity to museums and Central Park. * Nice rooms. Not the biggest in the world, but not the smallest I've seen in NYC either. The room I had overlooked the park across the street and had ample room for two adults (although I was traveling alone) and luggage without an issue. * Accessible to transportation. With subway stops within a block of the hotel that will whisk you away to anywhere in Manhattan for $2.00, even those of us with an expense account to pay for taxi transportation would rather take the subway (see negatives regarding more on the taxi service at the location). * Quiet. This hotel is out of the bustle of midtown or some of the lower manhattan hotels. It is, for all intents and purposes, a residential neighborhood. I had quite a good time on my one day off (Wednesday) hanging at Starbucks watching dogwalkers, moms and nannys walk by with their charges and then heading off to the Barnes & Noble and doing the same thing. * Doorman and bellmen are amazingly service oriented! These guys did everything right and made sure I was well taken care of at all turns. Negatives: * Some of the other reviewers are right, SOME of the staff has issues. Desk agents are less than helpful, whether it be checking in, checking out or any other problem you bring to their attention. They seem frazzled and uncaring. Whether it's an understaffing situation or just that they'd rather be lottery winners, I'm not sure, but this should be addressed by management. * The one problem that was irritating was that the remote control in my room for my television did not work. Right, just get off your lazy butt and change the channel, you're saying. he problem being is they use a LodgeNET system, which works on channel 3 of the television and relies on the remote to actually surf away from the menu channel. Despite several calls and stops at the desk, when I left on Friday morning, I still had no access to television. I didn't mind, I read a book and worked a bit on my laptop, but the point is, this level of service (or lackthereof) on the part of the desk staff is unacceptable at any level. * Taxis. This is not the fault of the hotel, but during peak rush times and bad weather, getting a taxi in front of the hotel is near impossible (see subway alternative perk though). Getting to the airport on Friday in the rain, thank GOD the bellman knew this and had cost-effective alternatives to offer me. All in all, I'd stay here again and, as a matter of fact, I am planning a mini-vacation trip here next year and will more than likely stay at the Excelsior again. Bottom line, yes there are some minor service issues, but going in with your eyes open and realizing that you, as an individual can also be responsible for your own wake-up calls (there are alarm clocks in the room and my cell phone alarm woke me just fine) and other things you don't think twice about doing for yourself at home, I think you'll be pleasantly suprised with the Excelsior.

Reviews.Title: “I Love New York”
Reviews.Author: sez-jay
Reviews.Content: having read previous review we were quite concerned as some were negative, however we are delighted to report the hotel was excellent! The room was internal with no view(only other rooms and the breakfast room) but this was fine as there were curtains to disguise it and to be honest we were so pleased with the room we didn't mind at all.We had a little sitting room with sofa, desk and built in cupboard with complimentary fluffy dressing gowns ! and a big bedroom with nice furniture and plenty of room. The bathroom was really clean with complimentary soaps, sewing kits etc and the towels were changed every day.The location of the hotel is fab, just a 2 min walk from the subway which is ideal when you legs are aching from all the walking. It is also located opposite the natural history museum and near central park. overall an enjoyable experience, new York is amazing but it was nice to have a decent hotel to relax in at the end of a long day. couldn't fault the hotel and would 100% stay there again and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice west side hotel”
Reviews.Author: triptraveller
Reviews.Content: Excelsior has a traditional decor - with wood paneling in the reception and even the elevators. The atmosphere is 'residential' - and service is helpful. When I needed to change rooms, this was accomplished efficiently - and the outcome was a nice, small suite of rooms on an upper floor, at the back of the hotel (lthe location and arrangement were just right -and worth paying an upgrade in the rate). Nice breakfast buffet - with eggs or omelets cooked to order -- plus a wide array of meats, cheeses, breads, cereals, juice, and fruit. Plus, tea or coffee to go ! (But no room-service.) Staff is helpful with reservation of a car to return to the airport as well. All around, Excelsior is comfortable and accomodating !

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: janemcnally
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location in the Upper West Side just a stones throw from Central Park. In the past we have stayed in hotels uptown and have found this experience to be somewhat claustraphobic at times. The Excelsior is located in a peaceful typical 'better' Upper West neighbourhood with some lovely coffee shops and delis. Uptown is only a short five minute taxi drive away. The hotel itself is clean and comfortable although the rooms are not huge, (like most NY hotels anyway i suppose.) The reception staff were helpful and pleasant (the trip advisor comments about rude staff were not proven during our stay). Only criticism, no hotel bar to relax in during the evening although there are a few bars within walking distance. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excelsior Hotel - Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: Lamp2000
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one week at the Excelsior and had a lovely time. Our "package deal" room was on the fourth floor in the back instead of being on the street side so it was quiet at night (a good trade-off). The room was kept very clean and had an air conditioner under the window for when there is no breeze. The location was superb: a short walk to Central Park and many restaurants along Amsterdam and Columbus Avenues. A Metro stop was on the corner. I would have liked a hot pot in the room. We did not use the breakfast room or any of the other special rooms on the second floor because we were only at the hotel to sleep. Other hotels may be a bit cheaper but everything in NYC is expensive. The Excelsior is moderately priced and we had no surprises. An alarm clock is in the room so you don't have to depend on a wake up call.

Reviews.Title: “Don't ever stay at the Excelsior Hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: carolecf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excelsior Hotel in NYC when we came to the city to do the NYC Marathon. It was a disaster! We booked a wake up call for marathon morning - it never came! Not a single guest in the hotel (most of whom were running the marathon) got a wake up call. The hotel staff were unapologetic simply saying "Too bad, accidents happen." Returning to the hotel after finishing the marathon we found that we had no hot water!! Again the staff were unapologetic saying the hotel was busy and we couldn't expect to get hot water! After much argument and them sending some to verify that we actually had no hot water we were finally offered another room. I could go on and on about the atrocious service and rude staff we encountered in this hotel, but these two examples are probably sufficient. We wrote a letter of complaint to the general manager - but got no response. Obviously the lack of service starts at the top.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Scousepeasant
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ideally located for a group of us attending an event just across the Park & handy for local restaurants on Columbus & Amsterdam Avenues. Staff were OK & the outside of the building appeared to be undergoing rennovation, but that wasn't causing any disturbance. the cost was about $275 a night. I've stayed nearer the centre of Manhattan in the past, but this place was far enough out to be relatively peaceful, eat in restaurants full of locals at night, but still be close enough to the action. The rooms were small & there were no tea or coffee making facilities & no free internet. But as all rooms I've stayed in in NY have been tiny & there's a Starbucks or equivalent on every corner these aren't major hassles.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: vanessa_Rio
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel! extremely clean with a beautiful view of the American Museum of Natural History. An excellent choise for those who want to stay at Upper West Side.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: suekay1
Reviews.Content: Just got back from NY on Friday. Stayed at the Excelsior for 5 nights. Was a bit worried because of the negative comments regarding the staff. However, they weren't too bad. They didn't bend over backwards to be overly friendly but they were pleasant enough. The room was clean. Maid service evey day and fresh towels. The room was pretty stuffy though,because the air con was too noisy to leave on at night. As everyone else has mentioned the location is great. The subway is out to the left of the hotel along at the corner. The Natural Histroy Museum and Central Park are close by. We walked down to Broadway for breakfast a few days,couple of good diners there that are reasonably priced,Manhatten Diner does lovely pancakes. To get to Broadway just turn right as you come out of the hotel and its 2 blocks down. Would go back to the Excelsior again because it's clean,good location and the surrounding neighbourhood feels safe.

Reviews.Title: “Excelsior Hotel... a true Upper West Side experience!”
Reviews.Author: traveltree
Reviews.Content: Writing a review for the Excelsior Hotel is painful only because I want this hotel all to myself. What a gem! It is located on the UWS right across from the Museum of Natural History and justthisclose to Central Park. My top floor room had museum/ park views. The staff was helpful and the room was really quiet ,really comfy, and really clean. I know I will stay here whenever I begin to yearn for the beauty and slower pace of the UWS.

Reviews.Title: “top notch , friendly service, location!”
Reviews.Author: CosmoNyc
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior is a hidden gem. Beautiful, pre war (?) building right across from American Museum of Natural History with a million dollar view of Manhattan. In a quiet neighborhood, but accessible to public transportation and taxis, as well as Central Park. The staff, including the general manager were so very friendly and courteous. The room was very clean, comfortable and tastefully decorated. I was sad to leave. I have already recommended this place to several friends and colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: spiceroni
Reviews.Content: Had a great experience with the Excelsior. Rooms were spacious and clean, beds were very comfortable. Hotel staff was great. We booked a few months ahead, so we really got great value for the price we paid for the Hotel. Very convenient location, right next to the Museum of Natural History and Subway Station right at the corner, 81st Station - which will take you to all stops. No trouble getting around NYC with this very convenient location. Great restaurants on Columbus Ave, Central Park right across the street - couldn't have asked for a better location, especially since we had 2 young children. Easy to get cabs at any time as well. The staff was not overly friendly but helpful. The concierge service was excellent. Would definitely recommend this Hotel for families with young children.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, But . . .”
Reviews.Author: shewho
Reviews.Content: I should start by saying I got a rate of $190 per night for our room (1 bedroom, 2 double beds, 2 adults with 2 children), and at that price, it was okay. But having seen what is more frequently charged, I felt compelled to report the problems we encountered. While the room looked clean, it had an unpleasant odor. (My husband suggested it was disinfectant. I would have said cat pee, but I tried very hard to believe it was disinfectant instead.) The air conditioner couldn't muster the oomph to actually cool the entire room. Someone vacuuming over our heads woke us up before 8 a.m. on Sunday morning. And as others have reported here, the front desk staff were dreadful. We were in town for the weekend to attend a baseball game, and having noticed that the subway train we intended to take didn't seem to run on weekends, we asked at the front desk if it was possible to take the subway from the corner station to Yankee Stadium on a Saturday. They said no. When we asked the best way to get there on a weekend, the desk clerk said he was sure one of the many brochures on their concierge desk could tell us. He'd have lost points with me for rudeness and general uselessness even if his answers hadn't ultimately proved wrong. (Yes, you can take the subway from that station to the stadium, even on weekends. And the game was great, by the way, except perhaps for people from Tampa.) But the front desk has to get that question from guests over and over again, which makes his answer seem as much malicious as stupid. And as for writing that off as "just a New Yorker," I'd have to say we've found New Yorkers to be the some of the most outgoing and helpful people in the world. My children joke that every time you stop to read a subway map in the city, some passer-by will ask what you're looking for and offer to help. Perhaps next time we should just ask for suggestions for a good hotel on the Upper West Side.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great Experience-Unprofessional”
Reviews.Author: TLKtravel
Reviews.Content: Arrogant staff, unprofessional experience, not a great time... We had booked a suite directly through the hotel. When we arrived to check in, havoc was in store. We were given keys to the room, went up, keys didn't work. Went back downstairs and a bellboy accompanied us to the room -- tried the keys, still didn't work. Used his master key and let us into a room that was a) too small and not a suite and b) other people's things were in it!!!! They obviously messed up the room. Went back to lobby, given keys to another room -- keys still don't work. Took multiple trips up/down to figure out the correct keys and correct room. Very unprofessional -- apparently there was a 'systems glitch'. Staff refused to bring extra items like an extra chair, were unaccomodating unfriendly and arrogant in general. Room was stuffy and small and minimal windows to the outside. Too expensive for this type of service! Even after complaining to the manager on the phone post-visit, no compensation was adjusted and there was a lack of understanding of why this was a poor visit. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND IT.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Trip to New York, Excelsior is the best!”
Reviews.Author: HazelRW
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the more scathing reviews on this site, I was a little apprehensive about our upcomming vacation to New York, to stay at this hotel & had very low expectations about what we would experience.... I could not have been more wrong...! Right from the moment that we checked in with our Special needs baby son Travis , my husband & myself received the very highest level of service & hospitality from the Staff at the Excelsior.. We were given a free upgrade to a Suite ( even though the Hotel was very full ) Just by asking for a nice room & the price of a smile... All through our stay, the desk staff went out of their way to be helpful, answering any questions we had quickly & politely.. the other members of staff ( in the Breakfast room & Lobby ) remembered us quickly & made a fuss of our son each time they saw us, adding to the freindly atmosphere we experienced all over New York...Our suite was comfortable with big fluffy robes to wear & was cleaned & restocked with fresh towels each day.. The housekeeping staff even tidyed Travis's cot & regrouped all his Soft toys! Just a couple of minor gripes... 1. not having a Coffee/Tea maker in the room, but Starbucks is only two minutes walk from the hotel, so my husband went & got a take out for us each day while I got Travis ready to go... 2. No Bar or restaurant for the evening... But there are LOADS within a block or two so it was not too much of a problem... We did have breakfast in the hotel twice ( $19 for a full American breakfast, fresh cooked for you ) which was nice, but there are plenty of places just outside if you want something different or want to spend a little less.. The location was great, just half a block from Central Park & right by the Natural History museum.. The Subway is just two minutes from the hotel, but the walk through the park is so nice we prefered to do that, as we needed to carry Travis's wheelchair down into the 81st street subway due to no lifts. Also we were pleased that some New York taxis cabs are able to take a wheel chair, so we had a ride or two when we were too tired to walk..! The very best thing about the Hotel is how peaceful it is after a day of sightseeing or shopping.. We passed many of the other hotels on our travels & never found one that had a more restful location. Don't be worried about visiting this hotel, you will have a great time, just be nice to the staff & they will do the same for you.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in an even greater neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: flaguy
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at The Excelsior and couldn't be happier with my choice. I was on the 8th floor and had two large windows that overlooked the park-like grounds of the Museum of Natural History. I had a queen size bed with very nice linens, large closet with electronic safe, and good-sized bathroom. The place was very clean and the housekeeper did an excellent job every day. The hotel is within a block of the subway stop at 81st and Central Park West and the crosstown bus stops right in front of the hotel. Central Park is right across the street from the subway stop and four or five blocks in the other direction on 81st is Riverside Park with the walk along the Hudson River. I ate in the breakfast room ($19.50!) my last morning when it was storming outside but please get out and explore the neighborhood for a diner, coffee shop, or bakery. My favorites were within sight of each other at 77th & Broadway. The Manhattan Diner (24 hrs.) was my favorite with waiter service and a number of breakfast specials for $6.75. Big Nick's across the street is OK for breakfast but they have excellent cheeseburgers and pizza and a huge menu of other stuff. The Europan Bakery/Cafe has excellent pastries and cooked to order breakfasts. H&H Bagels and Zabar's are a couple of blocks up Broadway. As others have mentioned the front desk staff aren't the friendliest but I didn't really have to interact much with them. They obviously have perfected the "Dress like a big city hotel staff" part of the training manual but haven't gotten to the section on "How to make guests feel welcome and at home". They also have perfected the "Look busy on the computer so someone else will have to wait on you" routine. All that said, I loved my stay and they didn't dampen my enthusiasm. I'll definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, bad service”
Reviews.Author: janders36
Reviews.Content: The hotel and room itself was great. We did not have any problems with the room and it was well maintained and clean. The breakfast room was really nice. We did, however, experience the same rudeness from front desk employees as others have reported. I do not recall seeing them crack a smile once during our one week stay. Judging from other reports, this is something the hotel management should take very seriously because this hotel is in too good of a location and has too much potential to have careless employees ruin its reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: 5luvnyc
Reviews.Content: After all the reviews, we took the plunge and stayed at the Excelsior. The staff was aloof, borderline snobbish and not overly helpful, but if you understand that you are in New York, you can get over it. Half were nice, half were marginal. It's just the way it is. The room is VERY clean and VERY spacious by New York standards, very nicely decorated. This is an upscale hotel at a more than decent price in the city. You won't be disappointed. However, this is not the place for small children. THERE ARE NO LOCKS ON THE WINDOWS!!! Literally, anyone could fall right out of the 12th fl., no guards, nada! We strategically placed our luggage, and the kids were so doggone tired, they wouldn't think to get up at night, and we weren't in the room daytime. Airconditioner is so, so. You CANNOT beat the location!!!! The Museum of Natural His. and Central Park, literally ACROSS the street. Subway, outside the door! Would stay again, because of location! Overall very good value! Walk to Funky Diner to eat, food is EXCELLENT and they are friendly there! Taxi is $10 one way to heart of Times Sq., but its nice to stay away from the hustle.

Reviews.Title: “Even Worse”
Reviews.Author: chrismarti
Reviews.Content: I left some items behind at The Excelsior and called them and asked them to send them to me. You would not believe how snotty they were. They continued to give me a difficult time until after 8 emails - finally I sent them my Credit card # We have traveled all over the World and there has never been a time I have been treated so rudely. In 30 years whenever I inadvertantly left something behind, the Hotel always graciously sent it to me at no cost to me- as a courtesy. I do not recommend anyone support this kind of business and attitude. Find a hotel that treats you respectfully as their guest! Thumbs WAY down! Unforgiveable treatment of a guest.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good!”
Reviews.Author: eafp668
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel. A bit pricy, but that's what to expect in NYC. The first time I was there, in August 2006, we were upgraded to a one bedroom deluxe suite. The staff were very friendly. The only thing I didn't like is during the stay in 2006, the toilet broke, and it took them many hours until someone came up to fix it. During the stay in 2007, we were running many electronics and the electricity went out. Luckily, it was fixed within 10-15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Big Room, Not Many Frills”
Reviews.Author: A_Picky_Angelena
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior is far from the ultimate hotel experience, but it gets the job done. We needed a room ASAP in New York and hugely overpaid for our stay, but the suite had a fabulous view and I love the area. Because I lived in New York I have no desire to stay in touristy/business-oriented Midtown, so it's important for me to be in a real neighborhood near my friends and close to a subway stop. Hotel options on the Upper West Side are somewhat slim so the Excelsior fits the bill. However, service is not a strong suit and the staff is small. Decor is standard colonial stuff, nothing special. Room was very clean and big by NYC standards. I'd gladly stay there again if we can pay much less!

Reviews.Title: “#1 Hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: mahogoney
Reviews.Content: I Have stayed in this hotel several times and I find it quite amazing how people complain about it? I've stayed in almost everyroom available and they all seem quite neat & clean..The rates are great! location great! front desk may need a little tuning up, but hey it wouldnt be NY without a little attitude...lol...I would stay here as long as I visit NYC

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rattus
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within walking distance of Central Park and the Museum of Natural History. Unfortunately, we didn't have time to see the museum. The location is excellent. There are tons of wine and flower shops as well as restaurants and bakeries in the area. The hotel itself reminded me of the Titanic. It was decorated in an old opulent style. Our room was on the 15th floor, and our view was nice. The room itself had clean linens and was clean enough to be hygienic, but one could not say it was immaculately clean. The shower had mold in it, and the window areas were filthy. It was also dusty. The room was large enough, as was the bathroom, and it reminded me of a newer bed and breakfast. The carpet and wallpaper appeared to be brand new. The beds were comfortable. I'd stay here again, but I wouldn't pay a lot for the room. In my opinion no more than $250 a night. I paid less than that to stay at The Hard Rock in Orlando, and that place was immaculate.

Reviews.Title: “nice place!!”
Reviews.Author: oh-god-im-nearly-30
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excelsior from the 22nd march until the 26th march and then travelled to Canada. I had originally booked the Helmesley Park Lane but due to the many bad reviews we swapped to the Excelsior. We were slightly perturbed when we pulled up outside and saw the scaffolding but the interior was welcoming and the night staff reasonably friendly. Initially couldnt find the booking but found it under another name (my partners). I suspect we had a single room originally as he looked shocked when i told him there was 2 of us. However he checked the booking and immediately sorted the problem without bothering me with it! We were then shown to room 906, clean, fresh, light and airy with 2 large picture windows that opened onto a lovely view of the natural history museum gardens, the museum itself and some of the city skyline and if you craned your neck to the left a little you could see central Park! It was also great to have a bathroom window that opened, again clean, fresh and plenty of fluffy white towels available. Great water pressure too. The bed was a queen, comfy and well stocked with big pillows and a fleecy blanket as well as a quilt and top sheet. We faced onto the street which admittedly was noisy with the windows open but no more noisy than the main street we stayed on in Paris, Havana, Toronto, London and all other major cities we have visited and i wouldnt have sacrificed the view. We didnt use hotel catering at all during our stay so cannot comment on it, however we did have a problem with the safe and had to call maintenance in to sort it. He was a miserable bloke really, so much so he was actually laughable so we didnt allow his rude attitude to reflect upon other staff who were helpful and courteous. We used the in house dry cleaning and ironing service for my partners suit, we were assured it would be back in time for our theatre date but had to call to chase it up as we were then subsequently told it wouldnt be back until 8.30pm (had to be at winter garden theatre for 7.15 for Mama Mia!). However after a call to reception this was sorted and we werent charged the full cleaning price. I would recommend any of the dry cleaners in the area (and there are at least 2 that are seconds away from the hotel). We saw lots of locals using them as were a lot cheaper than the hotel service. The general area and location of this hotel was faultless, the subway is one block away and there are literally hundreds of local places to eat that serve everything from mexican to chinese to steaks to tofu! We found Columbus to be the best street. I agree with the person that mentioned the dog walkers, literally hundreds of locals out walking their dogs of all shapes and sizes. After a few days you start to see the same faces (both canine and human) and it was great to be in a nice residential area. We also asked for directions occasionally and people were really friendly and glad to help, we even shared a taxi ride on a Friday evening as it was raining! Overall i had a great time in NYC, the best birthday present ever (a small consolation fro turning 30) I would recommend the hotel to others but check out lots of sites that feature it to get the best price and also check with the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service Experience EVER”
Reviews.Author: catherine_garvey
Reviews.Content: I would just like to say that I lived in NY for 5 years and on the UWS for most of those years. Last year I moved to SF, but I still come back to visit my sister and fam on the UWS. Now there are a collection of hotels that I usually check out when I come, the Excelsior being one of them. Although, I had not stayed here in a while because I have found On The Avenue to be fantastic and cheaper. Nevertheless, I found On the Ave sold out for this weekend and decided to book a room at the Excelsior. I was already aware that the rooms at this hotel are reminiscent of staying with your Grandmother, but I was okay with that, plus it was the only room I could find up here. So, enter my my most appalling customer service experience ever: I enter the hotel with my sister( we were laughing and talking as we approached the desk, the desk clerk on the phone) as I await for him to get off the phone he barely looks sideways at me while still on the phone and curtly states, "Checking in?" after I reply yes, slightly surprised by his tone and lack of attention, he then simply and rudely says, "Name"...."Spell it" all while chatting on the phone and looking at a computer off to the side. "Credit card" were the next words out of his mouth and believe you me, these words in quotes, so far, were the only words he uttered to me.......besides the overheard conversation he was having on the phone in regards to Jesus being busy this week, and something about will they be washing the feet tonight......I put the card on the counter as opposed to handing it to him because I am, rightly so, putt of by his lack of attention and inconceivably rude actions and attitude. I can tell this bothers him, and I say, "I do think it is a bit rude that you are chatting on the phone while I am trying to check in to the room I am paying for. He says he is making flight arrangements that must be done at this very moment.....not sure where jesus fits into flight arrangements these days. I mention that I heard him discussing Jesus and the bathing of feet, not flight arrangements....he says this is his religion and it is very important to him. At this point I must add, this is not some sweet distracted man talking about the Lord. He sounds like his is gossiping about celebs while on the phone and his manner of speaking is so quick, sharp and filled with such bitterness and anger it is totally shocking. He is completing my room confirmation (still on the phone 'gabbing'.....I am not deaf, he was not making 'flight arrangements' ) I say," Really, this is very rude".....he then, in last ditch attempt to make his story real says to the person on the phone,"I will have to call you back....will you hold those seats"....c'mon, give me a break. He begins to lambaste my sister and I for throwing my credit card at him.....this did not happen AT ALL...my sister looks at me like is this guy for real? I told him why I thought it was rude, but he was so worked up I don't think he was listening or he even heard my sister say...maybe you are having a bad day...he was just railing on about how he hadn't done anything wrong.....obviously to be that worked up there must have been something going on. I proceeded to explain how I would have appreciated..."Welcome, sorry I need to be on the phone can i get your information"....or any variation on that theme.*(p.s. I paying a chunk of change for a 1 bedroom suite) I tell you, this was the most shocking service I have ever had...after I got his name, Joseph, if that is his name. I walked away only to then recognize he was playing some incongruent pop radio station rather loudly throughout the lobby. I was so putt off by the experience I was nervous about entering the lobby upon my return tonight, he was really worked up man....additionally, I am not only checking out tomorrow(p.s. the hotel ain't worth it anyway), but I will tell everyone I know of to never come here. Stay away unless a medical emergency prevents it to be so.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: RovingRachel
Reviews.Content: Flew back last night after 7 nights at the Excelsior. We have very mixed feelings about this hotel which pretty much concur with the last reviewer. Good points: The hotel is comfy and our room was clean although rather dated decor wise. The location is safe - it's more of a residential district so people out and about tend to be locals walking dogs (spotted more breeds than at crufts!) and hustling to and fro from work. As has been stated many times before, the location is great for central park, the Museum of Natural History (just across the street and a full day trip if you have children with you. Excellent IMAX presentation about the latest Rover moon landings, and an impressive planetarium) and the Metropolitan Museum which is a 10 min stroll accross the park to 5th Avenue. The housekeeping staff were great - our 9 yr old daughter vomited quite spectacularly in the lift one evening which we were mortified about but they couldn't have been nicer about it. To be honest we didn't find the desk staff rude or unhelpful - just perfunctory. Now the bad: We were on the 10th floor and found the noise level from the street quite intrusive, especially early in the morning. The lack of facilities is frustrating - no tea or coffee making facilities, no bar (can't really take the kids out bar hopping of an evening!) and no food except breakfast which we risked on our first morning - weird, stuffy dining room like a Victorian front parlour with no windows, and the cost was ridiculous $20 for a cooked breakfast and $16 for continental! $75 (inc. tax) for breakfast every day not really feasible for a family of four. There are lots of places along Columbus just a few minutes walk away were 2 teas, 2 juices, 4 pastries and a few pieces of fruit averaged around $24 the lot. The door man and concierge are quite amusing - tripping over each other to help with cases even when you don't want help. Had the opportunity to watch them in action for about half an hour whilst waiting for our airport shuttle - how moving a case 20 foot from the street to the desk and visa versa warrants the kind of tips they get is beyond me. We asked the concierge about theatre tickets for Mary Poppins, which provoked a sharp intake of breath and much talk about how difficult they were to get hold of. Eventually said he could get them for $118 each, so we phoned the theatre direct and got 4 good seats for the following night for $50 each! Overall a pretty average hotel which we probably wouldn't return to. On our last visit we stayed at the Holiday Inn Martinique on 34th St. Broadway, which again was nothing special but closer to the midtown action (just across from Macy's) and quieter suprisingly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location ruined by dirty room and unhelpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Bobothehobo
Reviews.Content: Lobby looks great, and rooms are smaller but the expected size for New York. Great location near the park, subway, Nat History Mus, and local shops and restaurants. But the room was filthy, the heating was terrible, constantly had to turn in on and off, open windows for fresh air, and the carpet had stains. Bed was supposed to be a queen size but was tiny. Rarely received a third towel when we requested one. Staff didn't seem too enthused to help or to do anything for that matter. Next time, I'll go back to the bigger chain type of hotels and not bother looking for a unique hotel with charm and personality because it's hit or miss. And the Excelsior was a miss.

Reviews.Title: “Pity about the staff”
Reviews.Author: shibbyuk
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 6 day stay at this hotel. First the positives - the location is superb - right by Central Park and with a subway 2 minutes away. There are some great restaraunts nearby - Isabellas is fantastic and EJ's is great for breakfast and lunches. Peaceful (but not quiet) at night but what do you expect in New York! Rooms were a reasonable size and were kept clean every day. We had read some reviews about poor water pressure - we were on 10th floor and there was absolutely no problem apart from when we arrived there was no water and one morning there was no hot water. Both were fixed pretty quickly. We have to agree about the staff - they were more interested in chatting to themselves and not helping the guests. We have stayed in many hotels from 5 star to bed and breakfast's and found this the worst as far as staff attitude was concerned. It was as if we were an inconvienience rather than paying guests. And the most we ever asked was directions on the subway and advice on restaraunts. Such a pity that they let down this hotel. One word of warning - do NOT use any of the concierge services. We had the misfortune to book a car through them, on their advice, to get to Newark Airport. Thank goodness we left in good time as the driver got completely lost on the way to the airport - what should have been a 45 minute journey turned into an over 2 hour journey from hell!! No aircon in the car (a very warm March day) and a driver who completely failed to grasp the need to get us to the airport on time. (and when we finally got there a few minutes before the gate closed - no apology) We have never been so stressed in our lives - it completely ruined the end of the holiday- never again will we use services such as this - you have been warned!!! Would we stay here again? If there was a change of staff definetely yes - however despite the location we prefer to be treated with some respect given what we were paying!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: TonyBlueblood
Reviews.Content: Just returned this morning after a 7 night stay and found it a lot better than last years stay when we stayed in Times Square It was so peacful as you stepped of the Metro onto 81st Street and the room was superb, Two double bed's for the two of us to share room cleaned everyday and fresh towels each day, Already sent e-mail about staying at this same place next year for another shopping trip to the Big Apple. No Tea making facilities in the room but i already knew this so took my travel kettle as i love my Englisg cup of tea in bed each morning A real 10/10 for this Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Would return here tomorrow!!!”
Reviews.Author: CGCEngland
Reviews.Content: Just returned from New York with my partner. First time for us both and we loved it!! Sooooooooo pleased with our choice of hotel as the location was great (just off Central Park so not noisy at night) as well as being close to the subway and within easy walking distance of restaurants and shops. The hotel itself was very nicely decorated in a kind of chic French decor. Room and bathroom very clean and how do they keep their white towels so fluffy?! We had planned to go out for breakfast but ended up having the continental style breakfast in the hotel each morning as the selection was great and it was very good value. Would recommend this hotel to anyone and the whole trip was great value. Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty disappointing”
Reviews.Author: JohannesBoston
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Excelsior in December, 2006. It's in a beautiful part of Manhattan, near the park, convenient to the subway. That's the good news. We booked a standard room with a "California queen" bed. Such a bed is supposed to be 60" wide and what we got was narrow enough that we had difficulty sleeping. My wife measured it and it was the width of a standard double bed. When we complained to the people at the front desk, they were pretty rude. Other interactions with the front desk were also about as unfriendly as I've ever encountered in what is supposed to be a nice hotel. It's too bad because the place is physically nice and well located, but the people running it are a real problem. I wouldn't stay there again and would absolutely not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Location was great, but...”
Reviews.Author: Ravenduffer
Reviews.Content: We booked a one bedroom suite with a dividing french door on the hotel web site for two nights because we were traveling with a baby. Upon check in we were shown a standard room, not a suite at all. We were "upgraded" to the suite when we refused the room. It sure felt like the hotel was pulling a fast one... The dividing door is clearly pictured on the web site. The suite with the divided door worked great for the baby, which was our priority. The tv in the bedroom had very poor reception, and the sofa needed to be recovered. The overall decor was dated. Bell and maid staff were nice enough. Great UWS location with convenient parking. Sarbeths and Good enough to Eat are good breakfast places. Would stay here again for the suite aspect, but there are much nicer places to stay for less if you don't care about the suite. If the suite is important to you, make sure you get what you paid for.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: geordie and wor lass visit new york
Reviews.Title: “our first visit to N.Y.and the excelsior hotel and can only say that we will ...”
Reviews.Author: JACKPAINT
Reviews.Content: It was our 30th wedding anniversary last year, and we decided to visit New York and then on with a trip to miami, It was a first for both of us to New York, and so of course to this Hotel, and the hotel ticked all the excellent boxes for both of us, the location was just right, with being just a gentle liesurely stroll down to times square and all the other major attractions, with central park very close by and an absolute pleasure to visit, we both found the Hotel staff extremely helpfull in all areas. I am sure when you visit any place on a first time basis, you may like me, try and visit by imagination, hotel, New York etc, but for any one who is undecided as to where to stay, wondering what its all going to be like etc, all we can say is its the best holiday desicion we have ever made. we never encountered any problems whatsoever, add this together with New York visit, and believe me you won't be dissapointed either, the people, the places, all we did was just fantastic, we were out the whole day every day, and visited the local irish bar less than 50 mtrs away from hotel every night we were there, we met and chatted with many local New Yorkers, it was all fantastic my only problem was......like all good things it has to end, but as each day passes we are one day closer to returning, (well thats how we look at it) and will most certainly be back to N.Y. and to the same hotel. It is the best expierience we ever had and will never forget. All the very best from us both, and look forward to seeing you soon. Colin & Linda

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: katie333
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent. We loved the upscale neighbourhood location, with fantastic city views. Walking distance to lots of great traditional NYC restaurants, delis, pizzerias and an easy cab ride to other locales near midtown. This was our first time in NYC and we were happy to have such a safe nice hotel to stay in. The room was a decent size and always kept very clean and orderly. The windows (which opened) provided fresh air and a lovely view of the park and city. We enjoyed walking in the area and the extreme proximity to the American Museum of Natural History in which we spent 6 hours exploring! Contrary to some reviews, we found the hotel staff to be friendly and helpful when we needed them. We did have a problem with our booking. I booked on Expedia and when I called to confirm the reservation with the hotel they showed us checking in a day earlier. Since at that time we would have paid a penalty for a no-show, I confirmed with Expedia (everything was fine on their end) and again with the hotel. I ended up speaking to a manager who confirmed it was an error on their part, and provided an email confirmation and apology about the mistake. Everything worked out fine in the end, but I do wonder what would have happened if I hadn't bothered to check with the hotel prior to check-in? Still, this was an absolutely great play to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experiance!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rondo_MA
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. Awesome room on the 10th floor overlooking the park, not huge but fine. The bed was very comfortable, the room clean and a nice white tiled bathroom accented with raised decorative tiles. Excellent location, 1/2 block off Central Park and a subway stop at the corner. The "museum mile" is a short walk across the park. Great value (for NYC!).

Reviews.Title: “great position, will go back”
Reviews.Author: Mossey
Reviews.Content: loved the hotel, had a great room, 9 floor at the front overlooking the park, 2 double beds, the room was a good size, always kept very clean, and in a great position, 5 minutes walk to central park , subway at the end of the road, then 10 minutes to times sq, another subway line about 10 mins walk away, starbucks at the end of the road for breakfast, Irish pub around the corner. Location of this hotel was excellent, found it nice to get away from the hustle and bustle of times sq, and somewhere bit quieter to recharge batteries, (nice walking in the park) before starting again next day, hope to go back one day. will post some photos when get them sorted.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Excelsior and plan to stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: retiredinlv
Reviews.Content: I have been to NY many times, but have always stayed with family. However, since this trip was a graduation gift for my granddaughter, I wanted to stay in a hotel. This small property with a European feel, is right up my alley. I loved the residential feel of the neighborhood, and the proximity to transportion. The rooms are small, but ours had 2 big windows which kept it from feeling claustrophobic.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, relaxing hotel”
Reviews.Author: BarbsieMay
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Excelsior in October 2006. We wanted somewhere out of the hustle and bustle of NYC yet close enough to be able to walk into the madness and the Excelsior provided that. The room we stayed in (915) was medium size and very clean and comfortable. The staff were extremely helpful and pleasant and I could not say a bad word about the hotel. I would definately staff there again. We found a fantastic cafe a couple of blocks down on Broadway and 82nd called Cafe 82 which I would recommend. The area where the hotel is is lovely - National History Museum just opposite, Central Park 2 minutes walk away and subway also 2 mins walk away. Very convenient to everything, yet relaxing at the same time. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place great neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: TRav100
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for 2 nights. Booked rooms (# 1602, 1604 & 1606) on top floor - all had great views of Nat. History Mus. and some skyline too. Rooms were small to medium with smallish but very clean bathrooms. Everything in it we needed, irn and board, safe, etc. No mini bar but we never use that anyways. Bottles of water were not complimentary cost about $3 each for decent size bottle. Windows open for air and views. If I had one critisism it would be the whole place was too hot and you couldn't control the room temps individually. Staff were fine, didn't need their services much but they were pleasant enough. Area is excellent - two streets over on Amsterdam is lined with bars and restaurants and an easy walk home. Subway on corner of 81st takes you most places easily. Can recommend highly - we got a good deal in UK from Purely America for about Â£70 per person.

Reviews.Title: “The Excelsior was good!”
Reviews.Author: springflower95
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Excelsior Hotel. It is a charming hotel in a charming neighborhood. The location across from the Natural History Museum is convenient as well as the subway stop one block away where I was able to get around quickly. My check-in was quick and uneventful.
