I was able to check in early. The room was quiet and in the back of the hotel and my view was the picturesque terraces of Upper West Siders. The pretty tiled bathroom was great, the closet space was large and the bed was comfortable. I don't understand why the bad reviews. I stayed two nights and wanted to stay more. Lunch at the Ocean Grill (try the scallops!) was great! Try it!

Reviews.Title: “Beware the Excelsior”
Reviews.Author: WanderingMusician
Reviews.Content: Beware of the Excelsior Hotel in New York! Other readers' reviews about their lousy service is straight to the point. I needed to cancel my reservation because of a change in plans. I called the reservations department in plenty of time to cancel, and was told that since I booked the room on the hotel's website, the only way I could cancel my reservation was through the website. (Every other hotel reservation I've ever made has never had such a silly policy.) The reservations agent refused to cancel my reservation. I told her that I couldn't cancel my reservation online because didn't have a password for the website, never had a password for the website, and none of the emails from the hotel would go through my spamblocker, so it was impossible for me to obtain a password in order to retrieve the reservation. The reservations agent argued and argued with me, asking how did I make the reservation in the first place. Finally, I asked her "are you refusing to cancel my reservation?" After all that arguing and grief, she finally grudgingly said she would. If you ever deal with this agent, beware. She said her name is "Daisy." Now, I'll just have to double check my credit card statement to make sure the hotel doesn't charge me. Also, when I called the hotel operator, they kept hanging up on me. I originally booked the Excelsior based on a friend's recommendation, but will never stay there again. I don't advise that you do, either.

Reviews.Title: “Love the City not the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gamblingqueen
Reviews.Content: One bedroom suite was comfortable and clean. I found only one front desk staff to be helpful and friendly. Bellmen and doormen are very friendly and helpful!!! Concierge / giftshop clerk was there occasionally . Beware when ordering show tickets!! You will pay a hefty fee for popular shows. When we picked up tickets at the theatre box office the face value was $110.00 per ticket and we had been charged $170.00 per ticket . We were not told of the $60.00 per ticket charge and when we asked the General Manager about it the next day he told us that is the brokers fee and referred us back the Concierge. We stayed for eight nights and were able to get one coke out of the pop machines on the first night and none after that. Both machines were basicly empty of all products for the full time. No interest in staff to follow up on this. The morning of checkout packed left few things on bed and dresser and went out with friends for breakfast. Returned at 10:15 to find housekeeping in the room cleaning and moved items from the bed to the floor. Check out time 12 noon. Went down to front desk to express my concern and was told they could do nothing but if I wanted they would connect me with housekeeping. Love the location of Hotel but would not stay again and could not reccommend it. Pricey for basically no service!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: meshellej
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. It was very clean, I even had a balcony off of my room so pretty. I would recommend this hotel very highly. Try Big Nicks for breakfast not too far away good food good prices.

Reviews.Title: “just ok”
Reviews.Author: spectator
Reviews.Content: Arriving around 3 PM due to bad weather, we found the room not ready ( check in is 4PM), the front desk person was not particularly helpful. We checked our luggage and needed to retrieve it that night. People at the front desk were extremely neutral - as though they were working on national security problems and really could not be friendly. The room was small, well appointed with a nice but small bathroom and good lighting. The internet service was an inexpensive extra - confirming unfortunately you get what you pay for. It was advertised as high speed but I think dial up would have been faster. When I called the internet provider for assistance I was told there was something wrong with my laptop. Upon returning home and using my wireless network, the connection was its usual quick self. I like the location and smaller size of the Excelsior but this will be my last stay there. They just aren't welcoming. I have stayed at the Excelsior several times in the past. The coldness of the staff ( they should have welcomed a repeat customer) and the poor internet service which has been spotty in the past will cause me to take my business elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “OK - but staff not very customer friendly”
Reviews.Author: pjg1965
Reviews.Content: What is it with this hotel. Rooms are adequate size and clean and in a quiet location although our room was overlooking the Museum and you can hear the horns of cars day and night. Enough of the adequate for the hotel but I read many reviews of the hotel before I checked in and there is definately a consensus of staff being unfriendly and our visit confimed this. The young lady who checked us in is the exception but all the others really seem to have a problem dealing with customers. (Hey is'nt this their job). They seem to be efficient enough but in a manner which is often abrupt and sometimes rude. The tall middle aged reception guy in particular needs to go to charm school because he is bordering insulting and someone I have read before about and others guests whilst in our stay had the same reaction.

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed again and again!”
Reviews.Author: svbowwow
Reviews.Content: I travel to New York on business almost twice a month and would definitely recommend the Excelsior. The lobby is beautiful in a "old world" style and even a cabbie from LaGuardia commented that this was a gem during the drive in. The rooms, although not huge, are clean which means the world to me. Views are awesome overlooking the AMNH and the Upper West Side. Location is perfect of course with a zillion restaurants and shops nearby. Yes, reception may not greet you with a big fake HoJo smile but they're efficient and even remember me each time I've been back. My only complaint is that next week I have to go back to NYC and they're fully booked which left me scrambling as it's become my defacto place to stay when in town.

Reviews.Title: “An 'OK' hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveller215
Reviews.Content: The hotel was OK. That's about as far as it goes. The rooms are quite old fashioned. The air con only worked for half of the room and the bath took almost 20 minutes to run due to VERY low water pressure. Having said that, the location is ideal for a Manhattan hotel. The subway is about 200 yards walk and buses stop on the street outside. The staff were friendly enough although nothing was done about the complaints we registered.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Excelsior Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tropicaltammi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights at the end of June, beginning of July. We had a room on the 8th floor and it was nice and quite, and spacious for NYC standards. The lobby was beautiful and the staff was helpful and friendly. The best thing for us was the location. The street it is on is beautiful, and tree lined. The entire upper west side was a really nice area to stay in and wander around. The hotel was a 5 min walk to the subway (if that) and right near the park and history museum. I only wish the rooms had a coffee maker/tea maker, but other than that it was great. I would stay here again in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk Unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: hildaToronto
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Excelsior Hotel many times and always found the front desk staff to be unfriendly and uninviting...I have even written to the manager without a reply. Many at the desk should move on because simple courtesies are lacking. These folks could take polite lessons from the hotel's excellent roadside porters...they are the very best in NewYork. From the time you arrive to the time you depart they are Sterling at what they do. They deserve generous tips and are the best Ambassadors for the Hotel and this great city I stay at the Excelsior because I Love its Upper West Side location .. The rooms are a good size for NewYork, kept clean by good housekeeping, however the room maintenance is not good. My bathroom had mould around the tub in the caulking. (easily cleaned and replaced) There is very little water pressure in this hotel... Theres nothing worse than arriving at a hotel after a long trip only to turn on the water to a trickle....the toilet seat was bent and crooked ...again easily replaced. Some rooms have very noisy air conditioning. Some have older models in the windows..ask about this otherwise you will never get a good nights rest. The Excelsior needs to prove itself before I return...however I'm doubful because there is an attitude of I couldn't care less at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Second Time Surprise”
Reviews.Author: ABtraveler06
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Excelsior in June 2004 and have stayed at the Lucerne since (5 visits) - but I decided to give the Excelsior a try again, mainly because they were much more affordable than the Lucerne for the days of my visit. Upon checking in I was given a room with a view. I hadn't paid the additional charge for a view of the museum so I was pleasantly surprised. The view was breathtaking. Two very large windows overlooking the museum and park. The staff is still the same. Not particularly unfriendly, but not helpful. The Lucerne's staff is much better to deal with. The only person who was especially helpful was the young woman behind the desk when I arrived. After that, the staff weren't nearly as nice. If you know your way around the city and you aren't looking for friendly faces, the Excelsior is a good buy.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced, with serious problems”
Reviews.Author: Riverdale
Reviews.Content: Having lived as a child only two blocks from this hotel and knowing the neighborhood and overall location quite well, I had expected far better during our five-night stay mid-June, 2006. Check-in was not pleasant due to a testy young lady who lacked any smile, friendliness or warmth at check-in and then called us in the room to demand that we return our luggage cart, which she claimed was their only cart, immediately. I explained to her that the bellman had used it to store our luggage while I parked across the street and that it was he who had taken the cart to our room - and was standing right there. He said to me, "what's she talking about? we have six carts!" After finally locating the World Smallest Closet - actually a tiny broom closet with a single one-foot bar that faces forward so you could only see the last item of clothing on the rack, and that only after removing the ironing board from it so it was possible to put anything at all on the rack - I called and asked for another room. The same desk person said "they're all like that" and if we wanted a better room we would have to get a suite for an additional $120 or so per night over the $239 we were already paying. We asked if they had a rack or wardrobe or anything at all that my wife and I could use to hang clothes; she said she'd check with housekeeping and get back to us. She never did. And I was in town for a convention and needed room for clothes, as did my wife. The room was actually a one-person room with a "queen sized bed" that was more akin to a double bed. No room in the bathroom to put out things, bathroom exhaust fan never worked, the air conditioner knobs went around and around but when we finally maximized what it was doing in the 90 degree heat outside, it never got the room cool enough. Yes, the location is very nice although we had to walk four blocks up Columbus for a decent breakfast. Why pay $16 or so for a continental breakfast at the hotel (they've got to be kidding!) and five bucks more for a fuller breakfast when you can get decent food in the area for perhaps $4 or $5. Also on a positive note, the fellows handling cars, entrance and exit were superb. They got me cabs very quickly and they really went the extra mile to do what they could to be helpful. And of course the view from the front is lovely, you're half a block from the park and from a train station, and if you know the great neighborhood restaurants around Columbus and Amsterdam Avenues, you're all set. Too bad the hotel has such poor amenities, high prices, and some indifferent staff. When I mentioned this to associates from out of town they all said "that's New York!" As a native New Yorker, I'm used to value for my money. I don't stay in midtown or anywhere near Times Square and tourist land, but perhaps the crush of visitors to the city allows joints like the Excelsior (our state motto, no less!) to charge what they do, and give very little in return.

Reviews.Title: “A week stay at the Excelsior”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 6 nights at the Excelsior, yes the room was clean, and perhaps a bit larger than many hotel rooms for the same price in New York City. The staff is efficient and gets the job done. I was disappointed that even though I had booked 6 nights, I was given a room in the front of the hotel that was so loud due to the street traffic that I could hardly sleep. Bring earplugs. I asked to be changed to another room the 3rd night in and the staff accomodated me with no problem. I think hotels should give their longer staying guests the best rooms available. ...not only quiet rooms but rooms with a window in the bathroom (which the first room did not have, but the second one did)......also, beware of the gentlemen downstairs who is the transportation concierge, he sold me the private car to the airport by warning me that cab fares had gone up and even though prices are fixed on the way in, they "get you on the way out." I have since learned that this is utter nonsense and probably spent $20.00 or more than I needed to get back to the airport. My husband, who left earlier than I did asked about taking the subway to the airport and the staff looked at him like he was crazy.. and said it would take several hours to get their by subway. He did it anyway, saved a bundle and made it to the airport with time to spare....(don't do this if you have lots of luggage!).

Reviews.Title: “AMNH Package”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My son and I spent a weekend in New York City to visit the American Museum of Natural History. Our stay at the Excelcior definitely enhanced the trip. The room, while not huge, was adequately sized, very comfortable and clean. The staff were polite and helpful. The location was excellent -- literally across the street from the AMNH. In fact, one of the best features of the Hotel was the package deal available through its website for tickets to the AMNH that went with the room. Overall, a very good value (particularly for New York City) and a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Excelsior for 4 nights at the end of April. Rooms was spacious and very clean, as was the bathroom. We were at the back of the hotel (so no park view), but being on the 16th floor meant we had a good view of the Upper West Side. The subway is at the end of the street, so you can get pretty much anywhere relatively quickly, and a stroll through Central Park brings you out brings you right into prime shopping territory. Madison and Fifth Avenue! A guest we chatted to in the lift advised against going for breakfast, sayinig it was expensive for what it was, but there are plenty of nice restaurants nearby (try Isabellas for breakfast). I can totally understand peoples views on the staff. The receptionist was less than welcoming! Service with a smile it certainly wasn't! Although to his credit, he did sort out an issue with our room type straight away (we were given a double rather than a twin). All in all, a good hotel in a good location. If you want somewhere away from the hustle and bustle of the city, I'm recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: FES
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Excelsior for three days in late April. I chose the hotel because of its location. Itâ€™s across the street from the Natural History Museum. The Metropolitan Museum of Art is a very pleasant 10 minute walk across Central Park. Lincoln Center is a 20 minute walk. Thereâ€™s a subway stop at the corner which we used to get to Times Square and lower Manhattan. We had a â€œPark Viewâ€� room that had a great view of the park across the street and the Natural History Museum just beyond. The room was tiny but it and the bathroom were spotless. I thought the room was a very good value. This is a residential neighborhood. There are plenty of nearby restaurants in a variety of price ranges. Thereâ€™s a Starbucks just around the corner. The Excelsior is a low-service hotel, best if you know what youâ€™re doing and where youâ€™re going in New York. The â€œconciergeâ€� is the guy behind the news stand counter who was stumped when I asked if there was a store around where I could by a belly-pack. The staff is there when you want them and not underfoot when you donâ€™t. Some minor complaints: The clerk at check-in was curt to the point of grumpiness. No smile, â€œpleaseâ€� or â€œthank you.â€� The TV channel line-up is missing Fox News, but this is the Upper West Side; maybe itâ€™s illegal!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Excelsior, good Upper Westside Location”
Reviews.Author: BWeissman
Reviews.Content: My teen daughter and I stayed here for a few days over Easter vacation and enjoyed the comfort and elegance of the Excelsior on W. 81st St., one block from Central Park, near the Museum of Natural History in a lovely neighborhood. The hotel is extremely clean and pleasant, and the location is quiet enough for a good rest at the end of a busy day of sightseeing and shopping. The standard rooms are on the small side, but adequate, and the bathrooms are lovely too, with flowered tile trim. We enjoyed the breakfast in the wood-paneled library, although it was expensive---$14.50 for continental and $18.50 for a full breakfast; both are buffets which are restocked constantly. (Note that several cafes are nearby on Columbus Ave. serving breakfast at better prices). Service was courteous and prompt. Two subway stops are nearby, as are several nice restaurants. Although expensive, $243 for the two of us, the Excelsior was a good value for accomodations, service, and a great location. I will stay there again if my usual Marriott Courtyards are not available.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great service!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mikebluesz
Reviews.Content: Well worth spending the extra money on this hotel! Great service, clean, great location near Museum of Natural History!!!!!......A++ recommended. Bathrooms are beautiful, water pressure in shower is a BIT under what it should be but that is the way NYC is usually. Right near the B and D subway stops not even a block away....some spots in the city call for walking quite a way to get to a subway stop! NOT this one! Go for this you wont regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Came in NYC to see the St. Partick's Day Parade. Two younger children, wife and self. Found the Excelsior to be an excellent bargain and very clean. Booked the suite. Kids slept on rollout, with no camplaints and played video games. The bed was VERY comfortable and the down comfortor on the bed very warm. Room came with robes, and again extremely clean. Had dinner and a guiness around the corner at O'Brien's nice little pub. Breakfast a little pricey but was very good. I would recommend the Excelsior. Right across from Central park a nice walk to the MET, which is directly across the park and the Museum of Natural Science is right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel a bit over priced”
Reviews.Author: Mike55058
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from 3 days in NY staying at the a week at the Excelsior Hotel. My first time in NY and I think I found a great place to stay. The location is excelent, not in mid town, but 2 subway lines just minutes away. The room was very nice and clean, the daily cleaning was perfect and I has a great time. Well, as expected not everything was perfect first the staff could be more feindly, seemed like it was painfull for them to give an answer for any of my question. The second problem was the price, NY is not cheap but still a bit over priced taking into account that I has to add about 25$ a day tax. Overall I would say if the price is no problem go there good location good room. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great.”
Reviews.Author: minikitten
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, quiet location and near some good restaurants, bars and starbucks. Lovely walks through central park to attractions and very close to subway station. Complimentary Danish and coffee in reception each morning and friendly staff. Lovely comfortable beds and good air-con. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent...definitly will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Aisling
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! From the spotless bathroom to the comfy bed this hotel was clean, quiet and hospitable. The location is wonderful... there are restaurants everywhere and the close proximity to Central Park, The Museum of Natural History and the subways are a bonus. Not enough can be said about staying on the Upper West Side except...."You don't know what you're missing!"

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience At Excelsior”
Reviews.Author: graceb
Reviews.Content: We were concerned about reviews on this site that said staff was bad. Happily, that was not our experience at all. We found the staff to be courteous, professional, and helpful. Our room was typically NYC small, but large enough for two people for a few days. It was nicely decorated, had a large bathroom, and was immaculately clean. I would recommend asking for a room away from 81st St if you are a light sleeper as there is unavoidable noise from that street - lovely views, though. The location is excellent, being across the street from the Museum of Natural History and a park and 1/2 a block from the subway which will take you to Midtown in about 5 minutes. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “The Excelsior used to be our favorite hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: SEJones
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior was our favorite hotel in NYC. We stayed in September on our way to London with two teenagers.The staff was snotty and unhelpful. We were delayed for 7 hours on our trip from the West Coast and a friendly person would have been nice. The bathroom was not clean, it felt like someone had used it after it had been cleaned. This is a great location and with a staff that was friendly it would still be our favorite hotel. Maybe they have so many people that want to stay, that they don't have to be helpful and accommodating. We stayed at the Marriott Financial District on our way back from England and the service was excellent. I don't think we will go back to the Excelsior when there are so many wonderful hotels in New York City.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location, opposite the Natural History Museum and Central Park was just at the end of the street. The room was clean and of good size. The staff were friendly and helpful, although the doorman were not of any help until we were leaving and there was the opportunity for a tip for putting the bags on the shuttle bus. There are some great places to eat near buy. Uno's on the corner serves great pizza and fajitas and over on Amsterdam the next street along between 83rd and 84th is a place called good enough to eat and it certainly was. The rooms are cleaned daily. My only problem was that the rooms were incredibly warm and we needed our windows open all night to get some air in, but we survived. There is a starbucks on the corner which is great after a long day shopping and sightseeing. I would come to this hotel again as it provided everything that we needed, a warm bed a clean room and a location that was well situated for the subway and many great places to eat out.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, haughty staff and no on site manager to keep them in line”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: While I've stayed at the Excelsior Hotel in the past it is going down staff wise and way up price wise. I received no greeting from the desk staff ( just cold stares and "you're room isn't ready. Come back at 2:00"). When I asked for help with the luggage the woman pointed to the right of her desk. There was no one there. We had just gone through hurricane Wilma and were in no shape to deal with heavy luggage. My husband was double parked outside. Other prospective patrons came to check in. They were also told to return at 2:00 and when the bellman finally came they were helped with luggage; we weren't. We had to carry our suitcases from the street and down their staircase to the storage closet. When we returned at 2:00 after a cold hour of walking ( we had arrived from Fort Lauderdale and although we had warm coats the winds still chilled us miserably) we were then told to come back at 4:00 p.m. by another clerk. We had already called 2 times prior to our arrival including that morning to strongly request an early check in as we had an affair to attend to and needed to be there early for photos. upset by having to spend another 2 hours to wait either in their little library or walking the street I made the mistake of challenging their competence and sensitivity. My reservation was cancelled and we had to leave. No manager was available. This hotel used to have nice staff and be reasonably priced. It is no longer. I would never recommend it and plan to file a complaint with the bureau of consumer affairs and the better business bureau.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: hippospots444
Reviews.Content: this hotel was great! it was in a perfect location across the street from central park, walking distance from the MET and close to a neat area with cool restaurants the rooms were a bit tiny but very nicely furnished i definitely would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: sharcare
Reviews.Content: 2 girls on a fun long weekend in the City. Have stayed in various other locations in NYC but never on upper west side. I really loved this location and the value of the 2 bedroom suite. I would stay again for the quietness of the location, the convenience of subway, restaurants, shops and value. A real find in NYC. Only objection was that there wasn't a refrigerator or coffee maker in room but deli was across the street and plenty of starbucks close by and great little bakeries, etc. We each had our own room and bathroom and could gather in the parlor together. One room (room without parlor) was a standard queen room with large new bathroom and had a great view of the park and neighborhood. The other room had king bed with French door leading to the parlor. Clearly this was the nicer room but who cared. The two rooms each had their own key and were connected by a hallway. There was a door at the end of the hallway that also locked so we could leave our separate doors open if we wanted. Thought the extended continental break. was high ($14) so we went out for coffee and bought our fruit at local markets.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed staying at the Excelsior”
Reviews.Author: aroundthenextcorner
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in October. The room in general was fine -- reasonably quiet, recently redecorated, attractive, good size -- although the bathroom was tiny (as are bathrooms in most of the older NYC hotels). And the view was impressive, although when the website says "park view" they don't mean Central Park, they mean the park behind the Museum of Natural History. Sneaky. But you also get a view of the 59th Street skyline, which was lovely. The location of the hotel was great for us. I was travelling with two older adults who had never been to NYC before, and I thought they might find the midtown area too frenetic. The Excelsior was perfect -- in a quieter area, but also convenient -- a block from Central Park, within walking distance of the museums on 5th Ave and the Lincoln Center, and close to some great restaurants. It would probably also be a good choice for a family with children. The service seemed perfectly OK to me. There was always someone outside to call a cab (we never waited longer than a couple of minutes), the doorman assisted us without being asked, and the housekeeping staff were discreet and efficient. We had a problem with the cable TV that was resolved instantly. The front desk staff weren't over friendly, but they were quick and got things right. In response to some of the comments on this site, I would say that the staff were just very low key. So if you typically need or expect a lot of assistance from hotel staff, you might not like the Excelsior. (Try the Lucerne instead, which gets rave reviews for service.)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to New York with our best friends, both of us celebrating our 30 year anniversaries. We did a lot of research and after much deliberating, decided to stay on the Upper West Side rather than Mid-town. We were so happy with that decision. If you like a neighborhood feel, with families walking their dogs, great restaurants and shops, and a much quieter area than Time Square, then this is the place. We really didn't want to spend a fortune on a hotel room that we would barely be in, since we knew we were going to do a lot of sightseeing each day. Our rooms were small but very clean. We had a horrible view of rooftops, but we really never spent much time in the room, so that was tolerable. We actually laughed at it. The hotel staff seems to go out of their way to ignore you. They weren't overtly rude, just wouldn't put themselves out. This seems to be the theme. We thought it interesting that the doorman wouldn't say good morning or open the door. Was he expecting a tip? All in all, we thought the Excelsior was a good value and were glad we stayed in that area. Great restaurants within walking distance, especially Monsoons, Vietnamese and the Columbus Bakery..yum..great for breakfast and you must get the chocolate cookies! For half the price of the Marriott or others, this place is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Accurate Reviews”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Excelsior from Sept. 24 - 30th and much of what we read on Trip Advisor was accurate. The hotel had a great location and was very clean. The front desk staff was not friendly or helpful at all, we never saw the concierge and the man working the incredibly small convenience store was always on the phone with personal calls and never made eye contact the entire time we struggled through the small space. The breakfast was very expensive, so we went around the corner to various coffee shops and deli stores. Stay here for the clean rooms, proximaty to Central Park, the subway, the American Museum of Natural History and The Dakota.

Reviews.Title: “Front Dest, Just Say No”
Reviews.Author: JACK STARR
Reviews.Content: This hotel really has so much going for it with one huge problem. The location is great, one bedroom suites are wonderful and the price is right! But do not, do not expect the staff to make for a pleasant visit. On our recent stay, the concierge forgot the flowers ordered well in advance, the front desk could not find a hotel umbrella to lend until we offered to buy one and which could not be returned. I do recommend this hotel with one caveat, do not stay here if a rude, unhelpful staff will ruin your visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but not memorable”
Reviews.Author: thedew
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excelsior with our three children, planning to see a show and visit the museum. The hotel is near the subway and the neighborhood is quiet but interesting. The hotel has rooms that will accommodate 5, which is rare in New York City and that contributes to the value. Instead of two rooms at another hotel, we could book just one here. (It was actually called a "junior suite, meaning it had a bedroom and living room.) That said, the room we had was TINY. We were stepping over eachother and suitcases the entire time. The little living area with sofabed was the size of a large walk-in closet. One child slept on the floor and could barely stretch out fully. The bathroom was also tiny. We had no view at all and no balcony. The furniture was mismatched and old. Nothing was broken, but we felt like we were staying in our grandparent's guest bedroom. Cozy but not updated. The hotel staff was not rude but not friendly either. One day, there was such a long line at the front desk that we ended up asking for directions at a coffee shop down the street. Frankly, for the price I didn't really expect any more than this. Overall, the hotel was clean and felt safe. If you have more than four in your group, or are staying for just one or two nights, the Excelsior is fine. I prefer staying on the upper west side to midtown, but I might try somewhere else the next time we go to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Wowza! Absolutely Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: yumyum90
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the weekend of August 5-7 2005. It is located in a great neighborhood on the Upper West Side. Its very quiet and family/couple oriented, but a few blocks up there is also a great night life. We had a standard room that was large in size with a big balcony that had a nice view. There were lounge chairs so I could sit and enjoy the sun rise. Even the bed was ultra comfortable, it felt as good as my own!The staff was great and very helpful, it was a lot more than i expected for the price we paid. I will definitely stay there again. We thought of staying in Mid-town or downtown but i'm glad we didn't it was too crowded with tourists. Staying here you get to experience a different side of New York than what you would get if you stayed in Mid-town or other areas. I highly recommend this hotel if you want a great experience in New York!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Excelsior from July 30-Aug.3. I have been in NYC a number of times, but have stayed at luxury hotels. I wanted to stay on the Upper West Side with a less expensive rate. Since I know the city I knew I would not have much contact with the desk staff. I got the American Museum package through the hotel's online site ($180 a night, includes a free buffet breakfast and admission to the Americam Museum of Natural History with a space show). The museum is fantastic, I highly recommend taking a free highlights tour first. The buffet was not much, I'm glad it was free for me. My room was very nice and clean. I was on the sixth floor. I could hear the traffic, but it didn't bother me. Air conditioning worked well. On my last two nights there were a group of younger adults who did wake me. The walls are not very soundproof. As for the desk staff they were polite, but not friendly. I had to remind them that I had the museum package. I would definitely recommend this hotel, especially to people who already know the city.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Anonymousatlanta09
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Excelsior Hotel in New York from July 20-22, 2005. This was our first time staying at the Excelsior--we will definitely stay there in the future. We paid $175 per night plus tax (came to a little over $200 per night with everything) for two people (queen bed)--booked the room through Orbitz. We felt like this was a reasonable price for the quality of the room (in New York). We were very pleased with the condition of the room (especially the bathroom)--extraordinarily clean!, and the decor was very pleasant as well. The room was not especially large but was not cramped or uncomfortably small--the hotel rooms I have had in New York over the years tend to be on the smaller side, so I have come to expect this. The weather was extremely hot when we were in NY, and thank goodness, the AC in the room worked very well. The bed was quite comfortable. I was concerned about how the staff would be at the hotel after reading other reviews here, but they were basically fine--not especially friendly, but they were certainly professional--we had no problems with them or with our room. The breakfast options at the hotel were expensive, so we ate breakfast at the Manhattan Diner over on Broadway (on 76th, I think)--it is excellent and very reasonably priced. There are many very good and reasonable restaurants within just a few blocks of the hotel, another added bonus. Wireless internet access in the hotel is available for a fee (we paid $25 for three days of access, which seemed okay)--it worked perfectly. The location (West 81st Street near Columbus Avenue) is very convenient to Upper West Side attractions, including the Museum of Natural History (across the street from the hotel), and also Central Park, which is also right there. We were not bothered by traffic (or other) noise in our room. Overall, we thoroughly enjoyed staying at the Excelsior, and we highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Uncaring desk staff”
Reviews.Author: emmajane7
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Excelsior before, with no problems, but this time my niece and I arrived to be told that there were no non-smoking rooms to be had. Having made reservations 6 weeks previously, I felt that my request should have been honored, and said so, but the desk staff looked at me blankly and told me that these things could not be guaranteed. I asked them to call the manager, but she was not in. When I went to see the room, I was told that the carpeting had just been replaced, so the odor was lessened, but we found that actually, after one day, the odor had increased. And the window airconditioner was extremely noisy and way less than adequate. I felt as though we were invisible, and will think long and hard before I go back to the Excelsior.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, rude staff”
Reviews.Author: MaineIzzy
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Excelsior three times. We love the Upper West Side, and this hotel is well priced for the area. The rooms are clean and comfortable--more room than other hotels at this rate. The only downside is the utter rudeness of staff (except the doorman, who is always great). I've written to the hotel's general manager about our concerns, but never received a reply. But, if you don't mind your stay with a heavy dose of snootiness (and I don't generally find New Yorkers rude), the Excelsior is a good bet.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice, great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: mbennett
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the The Excelsior over New Year's, and all in all I found it to be good choice. (In truth we ended up at the Excelsior because I made my plans late in the game, and the only NY hotels not booked at this busy time were in the mega-expensive category.) The wood pannelled hotel lobby was very attractive, with a classic New York feel. The room was on the small side, as you generally find in older hotels, but perfectly adequate and immaculate. The view, looking over the Museum of Natural history (with a small slice of Central Park to the side) was lovely. As this section of the Upper West Side is nearly all brownstones you can see for a quite a distance towards midtown. I am puzzled by reviews citing an uncooperative or unfriendly staff. When I made the reservation and requested a high floor in the front I was politely told that they could not make any guarantees. But at check-in they had my request in the computer and were happy to able to comply. Best of all, I think that The Excelsior is located in a much more interesting neighborhood then midtown, where most hotels are clustered. There's a diverse assortment of restaurants, bars, and smaller shops, Central Park's a block away, and it's primarily a residential neighborhood, so you are not surrounded by other tourists - or in an area that's full of businessmen by day but largely deserted at night. And why would people complain about the high-priced hotel breakfast when there are half a dozen good breakfast places within a couple of blocks?

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel! reasonable price, great location!”
Reviews.Author: adembik
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Location! Clean rooms, beautiful decor, and friendly staff. This hotel was so reasonably priced, we thought it might be sub-par. On the contrary, it was fantastic! Right near the Natural History Museum and Central park Try the Columbus Street bakery, down the street and to the right for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Upper West Side gem”
Reviews.Author: SweetieFreya
Reviews.Content: Wow, was I pleased with this hotel. We were hard pressed to find something in New York under $300 a night because many colleges had their graduations the same weekend we were staying. We got our room for $239 a night (queen bed) and were very happy to get that rate. [As a comparison, the less than stellar Hotel Penn was going for $199.] The room was very clean and nicely furnished. It was small by national standards, but average sized for New York. The equipment in the gym was kept up and the continental breakfast was nice, if a little pricey ($14.50 per person). It's the other end of the block from a subway stop and Central Park. Good eating (and shopping) are to be found on Columbus Avenue (a 30 second walk from the hotel) and Amsterdam Avenue (the next block over) and Broadway (the next block after Amsterdam). The natural history museum is across the street, which our room overlooked. Drawbacks? If you need two beds, this is not the hotel for you. If you are in town for business and need to be at Wall Street or Midtown, this is not a good location for you. And the air conditioning seems to be all or nothing. There is no room service, but all the area restaurants deliver. (This is New York--even McDonald's delivers.) I definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Regularly return to Excelsior”
Reviews.Author: LouMG
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Excelsior a couple of times and whilst I recognise "weaknesses" highlighted by other reviews I have to say I think this hotel remains value for money and one to which I'd always consider returning to. Having stayed mid-town a quite a few times I much prefer the Upper West Side for relaxing in after a long days sightseeing and museum visiting. The restaurants, bakeries and delis are more "local" than mid town and the pace alittle more relaxing and less pressured than the key tourist areas. I can see that the reception staff could be described as abrupt but other than checking in and out I've been fortunate not to have reason to have further contact. Housekeeping was efficient and polite. Rooms are spacious compared with my experience midtown and pleasant enough to relax in at the end of a long day. Starbucks across the way good for coffee/breakfast. Subway very close as is Central Park- for that stroll across to the Metropolitan Museum of Art. If arriving late email them with time expecting to be in.......we found ourselves being shipped off to hotel in New Jersey due to our room being given away (arrived 1am from UK) during a previous visit! (Made up to us with fabulous upgrade!)

Reviews.Title: “Good but we fried”
Reviews.Author: HeatherTea
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excelsior for two nights, 11th and 12th April. We booked last minute through expedia and had no idea what to expect. First impressions were good. We thought it was exceptionally clean and were ready to give it a five star rating. There were some nice touches and overall the value for money was good. However, although I found it pleasantly warm to begin with, we almost cooked overnight, and we were unable to turn the heating off. We had all windows and even the door open just to enable us to breathe. This of course let all the noise from the street in. Needless to say, we had little sleep which was a shame as it totally wrecked one of our two days in New York. I think I had a better sleep in the plane on the 20 hour flight back to Australia. I found the night staff unfriendly and not at all apologetic. Some kind of compensation would have been appreciated. The day staff were much more pleasant. On the second night we were given another room on the 15th floor. It was nowhere near as nice as the first room but at least we slept and it was noticeably quieter than the 7th floor. I think the hotel could be great with a better heating/cooling system (I see others have suffered the same fate) and some improvement in customer relations from the night staff. The position is good. Funnily enough we were watching an episode of Seinfeld while were there and when asked his address during a lie detector test he said 129 West 81st Street, just down the road!

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excelsior for 6 days in March 2005. The price was exceptional. The staff, to the contary of rumours, were best staff we had ever met in New York. Helpful, pleasant and humourous. Very clean. But no hotel bar despite having a floor devoted to "entertainment". The location is not the best for a first-time visitor interested in the usual attractions but the Upper West Side is excellent for families. Columbus Bakery is highly recommended (6 blocks north on Columbus); R&T excellent for $2 pizza and Dive75 on 75th is a good escape from the many local Irish bars.

Reviews.Title: “A true gem of a hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed here from March 16-26/05 and were truly impressed. I travel for work all the time and this is one of the nicer hotels I've stayed in. I was a little worried about some of the reviews and because of the age of the hotel, but my worries were completely unfounded. The room was bright and clean and well laid out, the bathroom was beautiful and spotless, maid service was fabulous the bed was comfortable and clean. We would stay here again without a doubt. If you want to be away from the touristy areas and see how real New Yorkers live, this hotel is in the perfect local. Try one of the local bakeries for breakfast rather than the hotel, and the concierge try's but doesn't have a ton of info. If you are an independant traveler that doesn't need to rely on the hotel staff to do everything for you, this hotel is great!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here spring, 2004. Nice, classy lobby. Staff apathetic. Room well appointed and decorated. We stayed in a suite with our two, small children. Their pull out sofa bed was seperated by french doors from our room. This worked well. Upper floor location reduced street noise. Avoid the breakfast room. Fabulous location, especially with children. Would stay here again as a couple or with children if paying less than full price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in a Great Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Opinion8ted
Reviews.Content: I first visited the Excelsior in October 2004 on vacation with my husband and my fourth grader, and have since been back twice on my own -- once to visit family and once on business. The most recent visit was in mid-January 2005. The Excelsior continues to impress with its terrific location away from Mid-town, the consistency of its amenities, and its astonishingly reasonable rates. On my last visit, the valets were particularly pleasant about stored luggage, even storing the luggage of a relative who had not stayed at the hotel. There are several places to grab great coffee and a quick breakfast in the neighborhood (breakfast at the hotel is expensive), excellent access to bus and taxi service and good access to subways, and Central Park is a mere block away. The rooms are not glamorous but are nice -- an acceptable size for NY with appropriate business amenities. The rates have been consistently terrific for NYC. If I must stay in midtown I stay at the Michelangelo; if I can avoid midtown, the Excelsior is my choice every time.

Reviews.Title: “*****”
Reviews.Author: Edcord
Reviews.Content: My sister and I spent three nights this past week at the Excelsior Hotel. Our park suite was on the 9th floor with a glorious view of Theodore Roosevelt Park, the American Museum of Natural History, the fenced dog run, and the NYC skline to the south and west. What a wonderful experience! The hotel is a jewel set in a pleasant, beautiful, and quiet neighborhood. The lobby, restaurant, hallways, and bright rooms are immaculate--presenting a special air of graceful hospitality and comfort. And your staff: at the door, at the desk, and at the griddle, greeted us with spirit and treated us with friendliness (which is far more than did the dour faces at the New-York Historical Society!!!) Thanks for making this trip a most memorable experience--you have far excelled yourselves, Excelsiors!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfiend and I stayed here from February 24th-26th for a girls weekend away. The hotel staff was friendly and courteous. They had many recomendations for restaurants, which are numerous in the area. The room was very clean, tastefully done. The bathroom was alittle small, but gorgeous with extras like a toothbrush and razor (we stayed in a 1 BR suite). We had a terrific veiw of the American Museum of Natural History. No coffee pots in room, which was ok, but could have used room service for that first cup. You are able to go get coffee at the dining area on the 2nd floor and bring it back to your room. Bed was so comfy..hard to get up in morning. Plush robes were another plus. Very clean and safe neighborhood. would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Attractive in a classic way, brass and burnished wood in the lobby, attendants in uniform; warm, quiet, smallish, with only a handful of rooms on each of 16 floors; each room's appointments were extra nice, tasteful. Thick towels, a jarful of cotton puffs and q-tips were the extra marks that said this hotel sets out to please, and hopes you'll choose it on return trips. Beds - even the foldout - were comfortable, and the linens were too. Our view was looking south over the park surrounding the Am. Museum of Natural History. Location: subway a half-block away, Columbus Ave, steps in the other direction, with bakeries, restaurants, shops......and it is lots quieter than mid-town! Heat adjustments not available, which could be a problem in extreme weather, hot or cold. Did I leave out safe? It felt that way.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: linmcclin
Reviews.Content: How did this hotel ever get a four star rating?...did I miss something?...We have just returned from a lovely Chrismas break in New York. From the outside the hotel was not disappointing...nor was the lobby. The bedrooms though are drab and very basic...with horrible pillows and bedding. There were no signs of any luxuries at all......just one lone bottle of luke warm water standing on top of the television..no fridge....not even coffee making facilities. Whatever you do...try not to wake in the night thirsty! Our heating in the room did not work...and neither did the safe in the room seem to either. There appeared to be no public areas other than the lobby....and no bar or lounges etc....and no apparent room service either. I will say though........that the bathroom was quite pleasant. The walls were very thin.....and we had to endure the sounds of a very energetic couple next door for quite some time during the night..! I would just like to know how this hotel got a four star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, not so great service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed being so close to the Natural History Museum and Central Park, and the neighborhood has a few nice restaurants and cafes. (It was also fun to see the Macy's parade balloons being blown up right outside our door!) We had a few problems, though, including a clogged drain in the bathroom and only one bed in the room when we were expecting two. When I told them the situation and asked whether they had any doubles, the complete response was "no," with no suggestions at all (like "we could upgrade you tomorrow" etc). When I asked for suggestions, the response was a sarcastic "sleep in the same bed." It was like pulling teeth to finally learn that we could do an upgrade to a suite for the following night--after she initially told us that this was not possible. As for the clogged drain, the repair person never showed up. Housekeeping was extremely friendly and helpful, and they did their job very well. The sofa sleeper bed in the suite was NOT comfortable to sleep on.

HotelInfo.Name: Excelsior Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 45 West 81st Street, New York City, NY 10024
